reviews.text: I ordered online with the option to have my food brought directly to my car. You order on their website, pay with CC and leave gratuity ahead of time, drive to the specified location, then park in any of 20 or so designated spaces. At your designated pick-up time CCF texts you and asks you to reply with the prominently displayed number of your parking space. All would have been perfect, like Gal Gadot and/or Sophie Winkleman, except for three failures by Cheesecake Factory. Issue #1: Despite answering yes to the online prompt, my order did not include napkins or plasticware. This left me a harsh choice. Risk inconvenience, GTA, COVID, and possible death by turning off my car&#39;s engine, unbuckling, getting out and walking 50 yards to wade through a sea of potential asymptomatic COVID carriers. Or, eat my food with my bare hands like an extra from the Turkish version of the film Quest for Fire, wiping my filthy hands on my pants like Lindsay Lohan after a locker room visit with the Toronto Raptors. Issue #2: I&#39;m not a fan of tipping before service is provided. You&#39;re just blinding hoping things will be done right. Foolishly I was very generous. Being the holiday season of a particularly difficult year I tipped extra, but not only was my order without utensils and napkins, the deliverer was not friendly, nor was a single word of thanks offered for the extra gratuity. I shall not make that mistake again. Issue #3: already I&#39;ve received three emails from CCF, asking me to fill out surveys and bite on their promotions. Now you&#39;re just wasting my time.
Always amazing food. We come here specifically for the gumbo and jambalaya. These dishes are always amazing. The staff is very responsive and makes sure we always have full drinks.

I love thIs place! <br>We waited only for a bit and then we were brought to a very small booth  ... my friend and I both stoo there stone cold and asked if we could  have a booth ... they were the sweetest and accommodated us<br><br>We had a great waitress and another waitress even  asked if we needed more iced tea.<br><br>I am always happy with the food... no matter which location I visit.<br><br>We both ordered a Cobb salad and we were both very happy with it.<br><br>This particular location the staff was very friendly and it was very clean food came quickly and we just enjoyed our time

It&#39;s hard to pick a favorite since they have a big menu! Miso Salmon substitute the rice for mashed potatoes is my favorite entree and the Red Sangria is always a great choice for a drink. This is a great location in The District in Henderson with lots of parking or even curbside pickup. They are also offering delivery through Door Dash. I am still practicing social distancing from home while supporting great restaurants like this one using Delivery. When ordering delivery they also include their yummy wheat bread and french bread. #YelpsBigNightIn

Cheesecake Factory has been one of my favorite stops the past month and the service keeps getting better and better! The restaurant has really got this down well, where if I order online, show up at my scheduled time, pull up, someone asks about my order and checks on it, then a few minutes later, everything comes out and is placed in my backseat. This very thorough process is enhanced by how well the food is packaged and also that my order has been perfect each time. Big shout out to the staff for setting a very high standard with to-go orders!! This is a large part of why I frequent the restaurant, plus they have lots of food in stock and it tastes great each time!!! Big thumbs up!!!

For starters, let me just say that The Cheesecake Factory is one of my absolute favorite dining establishments. My last couple of experiences have not been so great. Specifically with the location on Green Valley Pkwy. <br><br>My first bad experience - my daughter called to make a reservation in a week in advance because she wanted to take me to my favorite restaurant for dinner. We arrive on time and still had to wait and additional 20 minutes which turned out to be 30 minutes and they pretty much forgot that we were even there. I had to go back up and ask the hostess what was going on and after she saw I was irritated we were seated in no time at all. <br><br>My second bad experience - because I&#39;m nice and had high hopes, I decided to try the curbside pickup. I called, and placed my order. The lady taking my order, asks if I want utensils and I say, yes please. I ordered the Steak Diane with potatoes and asparagus. My girlfriend ordered a Rib-eye steak with potatoes and asparagus. My ordered and repeated back to me and confirmed to perfection or so I thought. <br><br>I arrive to pick it up. This dinner costs us close to $70 and I&#39;m picking it up so at minimum I&#39;m expecting everything to be in the bag. Once we get home, we are excited for our steak dinners and movie night at home. Open the bag and pull out our meals and everything appears to be as I expected then boom, no utensils. Furthermore, I pop the lid and to my surprise, I have no mashed potatoes with my meal. <br><br>I called the same night and spoke with a very nice lady who reassured me that a manager would be calling me the very next day to discuss compensation and she apologized that I didn&#39;t receive what I paid for. I trusted that I would hear from someone. Yet, here we are a whole week later and nothing. I live in Henderson and this location is closest to me. I will drive downtown before I dine here again.

I don&#39;t often come to this Cheesecake Factory location, but it always meets or exceeds my expectations for the quality of food and service when I do. Friendly service, well made and tasty food, and easy access (parking) are things I look for. This Green Valley Cheesecake Factory meets or exceeds all three. As I&#39;ve stated in other Cheesecake Factory reviews, I love this restaurant chain and virtually all of its other hundreds of restaurants. I don&#39;t remember ever having a bad meal here or elsewhere. Oh yeah, I can never get enough of the bread and butter they serve.

I and my family were passing through this area, oh my the service was over the top good and the fish was the best ever. I ate the salmon that the waiter suggested I was so happy he did. I am very happy we stopped there.

So annoyed. I have a gift card and im unable to use it to place an online order.  It states to you a a credit but I would need a zip for that. And I Input it as gift card and its not valid. I called in several times and it&#39;s a busy signal...

First time here--and will likely not be the last.  Diane and I arrived with our nephew and his recently expanded family to enjoy a leisurely dinner, and we were not disappointed.<br><br>First up were very good and rich Avocado Eggrolls, paired with a colorful and beautiful presentation of Thai Lettuce Wraps featuring nicely prepared hunks of chicken, fresh lettuce leaves, crunchy bean sprouts, trimmed carrots, and multiple sauces.  A Greek Salad with large crumbles of Feta Cheese was perhaps a gratuitous course, but I did not regret ordering it.  And there were the great complimentary loaves of oat-topped Brown Bread and butter to enjoy, as well.<br><br>A California Cheesesteak on a flour-dusted roll contained moist morsels of meat, three varieties (Green, Red, and Yellow) of Bell Pepper, and well-melted cheese, accompanied by tasty French Fries.  Meanwhile, Diane enjoyed mellow and densely constructed Fried Mac &amp; Cheese balls.  And, it was half-price cheesecake night, so the new parents took advantage of it by sharing a slice of Fresh Banana Cream Cheesecake.  <br><br>Booth seating was comfortable, including a stroller stand for my two-month-old grand-nephew, who slept through the entire meal.  And service by Jessica G. was spot on throughout the evening.
Amazing food and service!  And the strawberry shortcake is even better than the cheesecake!!

It was amazing service and our food was great we had to try each others dishes to see which one was better  I think the pasta bellagio was the yummiest . We had gone for my birthday and tried a different cheesecake this time. but we still like the banana cheesecake better

I ordered a whole bunch of food during quarantine when I was visiting the city with a friend. We ordered by phone and even had to call back to add to the order. <br>Everything was perfect. They did such a wonderful job with packaging everything. <br>The food was delicious ! Very nice staff and clean location.

Dinner is always great at Cheesecake Factory.  Great ambiance, great food @ reasonable price.  <br><br>Service is always very good &amp; professional, but for some reason our server  stood out that night not sure why- maybe the way he asked to see if our food taste ok or the way he checks on us but I want to give Chance P a five star for his service.<br><br>Thanks!

Food is good . I had the shrimp scampi pasta and crispy checked and shrimp... both good! Mom had the Thai curry chicken hubby had the chicken Madeira and steak and it was good too. They are kinda expensive but the food and service is always good. We will comeback. Make sure to make reservation to get in fast.

The location in Summerlin is soooooo much better. We usually go to that location but due to a last minute reservation Summerlin didn&#39;t have any availability and Henderson was wide open so we decided to drive out there for dinner. We had a reservation for 5:30pm and showed up at 5:30pm. They had a line of about 6 families in front of us. We stood in line for 15 minutes before reaching the front. When we made it to the front of the line we were informed that our reservation was automatically cancelled at 5:35pm. They block off the entrance to their door with the hostess so there is no going around to tell anyone you have a reservation. You have to show up 20 minutes early for your reservation with the lines they have just to talk to a hostess. Horrible customer service. We ended up having to wait till around 6pm to actually get seated. Will never be coming back to this location again.

Disapppointing that they dont have a system for sanitizing menus .   We were told that we couldnt have a menu and should use the QR code to get one on our phones.<br>Staff did not understand how to  use QR code, kept telling us to take a picture of it.  No one in our party had a QR app so taking pictures of it useless .  Given one menu for 3 people which didnt work, everyone ordered something they had before because without time to peruse menu, it was difficult and unwieldy to pull up on phone.   Our bill was $84, no drinks, drinks are not even on website.    You would think they could pay a kid to sit and sanitize menus.... if you have the nerve to charge $3.75 plus tax for an iced tea, you could have a better system.   Not the dining experience we were expecting.

I am not a big CF fan but today I am giving CF a 5-star review!  <br><br>Met friends, party of four, all arrived separately.  Two early, one on time and one very late.  But the staff was kind enough to seat the first two arrivals, giving them time to chat and catch up with each other.  When I arrived, I was pointed towards my friends.  We waited and waited for the 4th member of our party.  Ryan was handy, but didn&#39;t push us to order, knowing that we were waiting.  WE finally decided to order, thinking Sharon wasn&#39;t going to make it.  Five minutes after ordering, our friend finally arrived. <br><br>It didn&#39;t take more than a minute to see Ryan.  I got his attention and asked for a menu, which he presented almost immediately.  Ryan took Sharon&#39;s order and shortly thereafter, the first three orders came out.  We&#39;d agreed to go ahead and eat, but by the time we were taking our second bites of food, Ryan&#39;s assistant arrived with Sharon&#39;s lunch!  <br>It was so kind of them to move her order up so that she could eat with her friends, rather than after we&#39;d finished.<br><br>Our water glasses were kept full.  Ryan asked us if we wanted separate receipts or not.  Other people helped occasionally, such as the young woman who took the photo of us.<br><br>My Chicken Picatta was very good.  The breads in the bread basket are SO good.  I&#39;m going to start coming here more often.

I went here tonight and had a really good bacon burger. Waiting outside for 45 minutes to get a table wasn&#39;t a problem at all. I felt like I was eating inside an actual factory. Loud machinery was buzzing and various conveyor belts zipping by our table made for an interesting meal. <br><br>I guess this is what the commercials meant when they said the food is &#34;factory fresh!&#34; They gave sweet potato fries made with their own homegrown sweet potatoes. Very organic. I&#39;m happy to report my burger was certified Angus vegan. 100% quality.
One of my favorite places to eat!!<br><br>This place never fails, good quality food, good service and a very well trained staff

This restaurant at Henderson,Nevada has always been one of my favorites to have a good time with my children but it was not the same today.  Upon arrival at the restaurant I want to comment that the young girl at the reception was very friendly and the wait to enter was quick, but once inside the employee who assigned us the table was very rude and with a very bad attitude and gave us a table with high chairs that  Considering my age and back problems I asked her for a lower normal table and very rude she told me that I had to wait outside for at least 30 minutes, my daughter convinced me to stay at that uncomfortable table but to my surprise the table still had the  receipt and a pen that belonged to the previous customer.  I called another employee and told her that the table was not clean because there was still a receipt and a pen on top of it and she answered in a bad way that if it was clean and I kept insisting that that dirty pen was on my table but she  Very rude he told me that if I wanted another table that I had to wait outside.  At this point with so many cases of covid and with such poor hygiene in that restaurant and I, a health employee, knowing that even a contaminated pen is enough to get covid, we better decide to go to another restaurant where we could be safe.<br>I really don&#39;t recommend this restaurant and if you want to be safe keep away of this place!!

As Always a Fantastic meal, Phenomenal Service, Ileana is an Amazing server, the quality of food NEVER Disappoints, my parents came <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Ffrom.la&amp;s=5f942d011b216ea93f90de8d9ea56f8b70c42c5266dd9963539f9671370dfd8f" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">from.la</a> where their cheesecake factory is closed , they were beyond thrilled to eat here and said its better than the 1 in Sherman oaks! We will continue to Dine here!! Thank you

Henderson folks must reallyyyy enjoy Cheesecake Factory. I was shocked by how crowded it was here. There was almost no waiting room because it was THAT packed. Granted, we did come during peak dinner time on a Friday night.<br><br>Okay, let me get straight to the point. Here are some tips and opinions: <br>- lot available. Difficult to find parking when I went, though<br>- avocado eggrolls is a must try. I recommend the eggroll sampler! They were all delightful<br>- santa fe salad is delicious and filling. I would ask for the dressing on the side, because it can get soggy<br>- BEST cheesecake (in my opinion): red velvet, white chocolate macadamia nut, dulce de leche, or salted caramel <br>- one slice of cheesecake is like 800-1600+ calories (YIKES) but so worth it lol<br>- quite busy here, but service was great nonetheless
I love the shrimp scampi it&#39;s so good. Bestie and I always get the same thing. The creamy lemon and butter sauce gives me life!

My crispy chicken sandwich was excellent.  Bread and butter to start was very good.  My fries were not very fresh, only somewhat warm.  Was going to ask for fresh fries, but we didn&#39;t see our server for a little while.  My wife said her bronzino fish was decent with good veggies.  My kids Alfredo pasta was ok, somewhat bland.  He also got the Cinnabon cheesecake, which was delicious.  Overall decent, fair prices.  HUGE menu.  We were there the first night of 25% capacity.  Feel bad for the restaurant industry and servers.

Went here for my daughter&#39;s bday. Party of 6 since that is the max per Covid rules. I ordered my favorite the Chicken Picatta and it was as good as it is every time. This review is mainly for the service. Our waitress, Lais, was amazing. She was very attentive and made sure our drinks were always full. She also made sure to throw in extra compliments to make my daughter feel special. My daughter didn&#39;t want dessert BUT she did bring out a complimentary sundae to make sure we sang the good ol&#39; happy birthday song which brought an extra big smile on my baby girls face. Thank you Lais!

I love the Cheesecake Factory <br>But this Friday they sent out a special offer from door dash called 7 for $20 2 double cheeseburgers 2 Cokes , 2 Fries and a slice of Oreo cheesecake for only $20 <br>Sounds great ...But when I went to order it just now on the 4th they said they stopped to promotion due to overwhelming demand , that&#39;s ridiculous and false advertising it is supposed to run till the 5th you guys should be ashamed of yourself for FALSE ADVERTISING<br><br>The manager at Green Valley called me apologized and made everything right ... thank you

I ordered the Cheesecake Factory Special where you got 7 items for $20. This consisted of 2 Happy Hour burgers, 2 orders of fries,2 drinks and a slice of Oreo cheesecake! All this for $20! Whaaaa...???? What a robbery of an order at the $15 glamburger and 5 fries,$60 per order Cheesecake &#34;take my wallet&#34; Factory,lol. Nevermind about my amazement of the wallet friendly offer and on to the food:<br><br>Never had their Happy Hour burger before, but boy was it tasty! 2 juicy patties cooked medium as requested,crisp fresh letuce,cheese and a great thousand island type sauce to top it off. Bun was slightly toasted as well. Probably one of the best burgers I had in a while!<br><br>Fries: Surprisingly was given more fries in my neato cardboard cylinder takeout frybox container than I got in the store. They were still surprisingly crisp considering they had been sitting in that container for a while before I ate them. My side of my favorite ranch ever,onpoint as usual, wish they sold it by the gallon:/<br><br>Finally the Oreo Cheesecake: It was good,not great,but I&#39;m not the biggest fan of chocolate oreos(I&#39;ma golden O. Gal!) I prefer red velvet, but there were no substitutions allowed:(<br><br>All in all good, I couldn&#39;t tell you how many times I&#39;ve eaten here and 90% of the time I&#39;m only disappointed by the hate bill at the end. That&#39;s why I prefer to go here on dates,lol. That way my eyes are spared from the hateful numbers on the bill!

Guilty pleasures come in all forms here in Las Vegas, whether it be the gambling, the alcohol or the strip clubs -- however, for me personally? It would have to be a restaurant. And a chain one, at that -- my personal guilty pleasure is the Cheesecake Factory, which is infamous for being one of the most ridiculously unhealthy restaurants in the States ( with many of its foods clocking in at over 2000 calories by themselves, and that&#39;s not including the cheesecakes they&#39;re famous for! ). While it&#39;s not exactly the healthiest or the &#34;best&#34; place for food by far, I still enjoy it enough that if I feel like indulging in cheesecake, this is where I go!<br><br>Following the 4th of July celebration at Green Valley Ranch, I was looking for somewhere to eat -- and as I was off from work at the time and housesitting by myself, I was really looking for a place where I could just eat what I wanted since I didn&#39;t have to worry about being anywhere the next day. Since Cheesecake Factory was open after the event, that made my decision easy for me -- I ordered the chicken samosas, the steak Diane, and a slice of the cherry chocolate cheesecake.<br><br>Of course, the Cheesecake Factory provides complementary bread for one to munch on while waiting for the food, and it is quite tasty, though I admit I didn&#39;t eat too much of the bread as I intended to save room for my order. The chicken samosas were surprisingly light, flaky and flavorful, though I didn&#39;t care too much for the cilantro cream that they were served with ( and is the only reason why I&#39;m docking a point on this otherwise great outing ). The steak Diane was the better of the two dishes; medium rare steak with mushrooms, onions and a rich sauce -- all of these combined made for a savory dish that I consider one of the Factory&#39;s better options, as some of the NUMEROUS menu items tend to vary in quality.<br><br>The real star of the night was the cheesecake, however; true to its name, the Factory has numerous types of cheesecakes for all tastes, though for this meal I settled on the cherry chocolate cheesecake since I wanted something that wasn&#39;t too overly sweet ( LOL ). In that respect, the cheesecake was perfect: rich, decadent, creamy and studded with plenty of cherries and chocolate. Normally you&#39;re not supposed to finish the entire slice, but with how good it was I couldn&#39;t help but inhale it! ( THIS IS WHY YOU SAVE ROOM FOR DESSERT HERE. )<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is popular enough here in Vegas that it has multiple outposts in the City, including one on the Strip and another downtown by Symphony Park. However, of these, the one here in the District really does have the best service and the most relaxed feel of them all. This is definitely NOT the place for you to go to if you&#39;re keeping tabs on your waistline ( there&#39;s another place nearby for that, to be covered in maybe a future review ), but if you&#39;re looking for a good place for a solid cheat meal and good cheesecake, you can&#39;t go wrong by coming to the Factory.

Said wait time was 15 minutes but waited over 30 minutes and had to wait outside in sun. The bigger issue was many people were not wearing a mask while waiting for tables? Restaurant should enforce Mask use and social distancing while waiting! Food was good, but wait time excessive!!
The customer service was awesome!!! The food was absolutely delicious.. I will definitely be going back to lunch or again...let&#39;s not forget the cheesecakes!!! They were super yummy the next day.

The ambience of the place is really nice but the prices are way too outrageous for the quality of food! I had the shrimp scampi and it was just ok. My husband had the carne asada and what can I say this was no Carme asada it was just ok too. We took my daughters Fiancee for her bday because she loves it but it was way too expensive!! I was a total of $180 for just the four of us not worth it at all!!! The only good thing was the waiter have to give it to him he was awesome so as always we gave him a 25% tip because he deserved it!! Will not be back.

I went in for birthday dinner for my boyfriend and his friends although it was delicious I asked for no chicken in my pasta carbonara and they added chicken and MUSHROOMS which it did not come with and by the time had passed getting it I was hungry and didn&#39;t want to wait anymore, I did inform the server and she gladly didn&#39;t charge me for chicken. I don&#39;t blame the server at all. <br>I also specially added in my reservation that I wanted a particular cheesecake as a birthday slice for my boyfriend which I would pay for in my reservation and never got it sent to the table because of the HOSTESS not informing their servers. I&#39;ve worked in a restaurant and I know how it works. They should communicate with their servers more.

Cheesecake Factory is good no doubt. Sometime ago they have added Skinnylicious menu  which is just as tasty but with far less calories. I find myself often picking items from this menu. Caesar Salad with grilled chicken is just amazing!!! <br>However, after eating lower calorie salad I was ready fo get a slice of cheesecake!!! After all that is why I came here. However, as menu had calories for each slice, I lost my appetite!!! Each slice was well above 1000 calories. Some closer to 1500....I am not sure if calories on the menu are the law or not, but one thing is for certain...it does not help the sales!!!

Horrible service. Subpar food. If you are going to pay this much for food please go somewhere else. 45 minutes for a pasta dish... no thank you. I didn&#39;t order a well done steak it was just pasta.
Waited about 15-20 mins which was nothing to complain about. Service and food was amazing.

I get that this is a crazy time and pick up is new but they need to have someone with customer service skills at the door.  It&#39;s apparent she doesn&#39;t want to be there.  She had a very bad attitude, did not explain that you didn&#39;t have to stand at the door, that you could call and have your order delivered to your car. After standing outside for 20 minutes, we overheard her tell someone else that could be done.  We stated it would have been nice to know we had that option and she stated in a very nasty way &#39;I told you&#39;.  We corrected her and said she did not to which her snotty reply, similar to a child, was &#39;Yes I did&#39;.  She really has no business dealing with the public.  <br><br>We do give kudos to the manager, he was apologetic for the wait, had great customer service skills and was very friendly.<br><br>But when we opened the food, we had a top of a tomato on the burger

You had one job and couldnt get it right. I ordered 3 cheesecakes, not that many and you got the order wrong.  Frustrating that I cant count on you guys to get it right. Not sure how you confuse red velvet with strawberry?!?  Sad part is, when I called the manager, he informed me that I shouldve reviewed my receipt. HA!  Thanks- and my order was correct, its YOU guys who got it wrong.  But thanks though for trying to blame me.

We come to this location often and it never disappoints. Staff always gets the order right and they are accommodating  to special requests, they are also fast and professional. I usually get the cajan pasta and it&#39;s great!

We were able to make reservations online so our wait wasn&#39;t too bad. We were disappointed with our food and  service.  Service was slow and our waitress was not around much. With everything going on we put all of this in perspective. We hope in the near future they can get back to the service and food quality we are used to because all was lacking on this visit.

Cheesecake Factory never fails me, they always have the best service and food. I order the same thing everytime! I order the crusted salmon with mashed potatoes and asparagus. I also love the avocado rolls for appetizer. This is by far my favorite chain restaurant. Even during Covid 19 I felt great !

Very disappointed with my order today. Went inside to pay and was directed to go outside and it&#39;ll be right out. It&#39;s 106 degrees so 10 minutes is all we lasted. Then went to the car and informed curbside girl that we are there and she said I was supposed to wait in the car anyways. She was amazing by the way. Very tentative knowing we were waiting.  Finally got food 35 minutes after our pick up time. Got home and there was olives when I asked for no olives. Bacon on my sons sliders when he doesn&#39;t eat pork and no fries. I called to speak to a manager and he said he would &#34;call me right back&#34; and it&#39;s been 2 hours. I&#39;ve dined with them nationally and this is my worst experience.
Food and service were great as always! The whole place was great with following covid restrictions and still making the experience fun. Give the Avocado Egg Roles a try next time you are there.

I am truly disappointed and upset with my visit at Cheesecake Factory this time around. We eat at cheesecake 1-2x a month. <br>I went there to celebrate my bday dinner with my family.<br>My little sister found a hair in her bread but didn&#39;t say anything because we didn&#39;t want to ruin the celebration. <br>Then comes our appetizers and it went well.<br>Then we order our main entrees and wow did it take forever to arrive. There weren&#39;t even that many customers at the restaurant.  Anyways the food comes and some of the plates are cold like they&#39;ve been sitting there. Later that night we go home and we are all experiencing stomach pains. We all sleep it off and don&#39;t think much of it but my younger sister was up all night throwing up. She couldn&#39;t keep anything down.<br>The next day I immediately call the restaurant and the manager was very rude. He was not concerning and lacked empathy. He also said that he would give me a call back and never did. <br>So of course i went ahead and reached out to corporate and it&#39;s been 2 almost 3 weeks since I&#39;ve got any response from them.<br>It&#39;s truly disappointing.<br>We would make so many memories and spend so much time and money here but not anymore.

Ok, we love Cheesecake.... They are very consistent and the menu is HUGE. This time was no exception... Awesome chicken lettuce wraps and Scampi and Chicken Piccata. The real star of this visit was our server, Kenneth R.. He was FANTASTIC. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and gave us great advice. He was very pleasant and charming and everything you want in a great server. We noticed that he had some very difficult guests ( not his fault at all, just weird people) and he didn&#39;t skip a beat. A true Professional. Thank you for having Kenneth R. at Cheesecake Factory. Sometimes chains forget the value of great employees on the service level. We are glad to see that you haven&#39;t done that. Thanks, Kenneth!!

I&#39;ve been coming to this location since they opened. I also order for take-out/pick up/delivery. I have NEVER had a bad meal here until 9/5/20. I was there for brunch as I&#39;ve enjoyed here so many times before. I ordered the chicken &amp; waffle benedict...sounds delicious, right?  <br>Let me start by saying that I am not a person that sends food back. If I send it back, I will not order anything else in its place or expect the error to be corrected. IF I send food back due to a preparation error, I am no longer in the mood to eat at the restaurant. Well, both the chicken and the waffle were terribly undercooked. Fried chicken should never be blonde in color. Same of a waffle that is the base to hold fried chicken and poached eggs. The poached egg, hollandaise and potatoes were delicious. As those were the only edible items on my plate. Our server was great. He did advise the manager, James of the issue with the meal. The manager did come over to apologize and offer to refire my meal, I declined (see previous note). <br>The bill arrives, my virtually untouched plate of food was front and center on the bill, not even a discount applied due to the undercooked food. I pay the bill and we leave. <br>I now have a decision to make about one of my favorite places. Sure, all businesses have a bad day but recovery is everything. I guess it&#39;s time to take a break from The Cheesecake Factory...

We ordered 3 entrees and 3 slices of cheesecake. Sadly all 3 of our entrees were not as usual. This is a picture of the Chicken Bellagio. Literally one thing slice is prosciutto hardly any sauce. The second chicken bellagio was pretty much the same and the steak Diane with shrimp scampi was supposed to be cooked medium rare and was definitely overcooked. Will not order to go again! What&#39;s sad is we just visited the same location on Friday and had phenomenal presented plates.

I received a response to my review advising me to go to a website and select &#34;general questions&#34; under the &#34;contact&#34; option. The problem is there was no option for &#34;general questions&#34;. I was able to fill out a &#34;contact form&#34; but no response so far.

Stopped for lunch at the Cheesecake Factory.  The restaurant is always clean and the wait is generally not bad.  The service is consistently good.<br><br>The menu has so many items that it can be a bit overwhelming.  I got the shrimp and chicken gumbo this time.  Very generous serving size, I couldn&#39;t finish it.  It comes with a healthy scoop of either white or brown rice in the center of a large bowl filled with the gumbo.  Tasty stuff!<br><br>The other menu item I really like here for lunch is the Seared Tuna Takaki Salad.  Lots of seared tuna sliced and served on a bed of mixed greens.
Food was delicious, the service was absolutely amazing . I ordered the Louisiana crispy chicken with bow tie pasta.

Maybe it&#39;s the memories, but I love everything about the Cheescake Factory.  In olden times, I used to go to the one in Beverly Hills, and got some of my first &#34;gourmet&#34; cheesecake there.  Yes fellow Yelpers, cheesecake used to be one flavor only, cheesecake flavor!  I also ate my first noodle koogle there, like yummy rice pudding with noodles!  So it&#39;s no surprise that we manage to visit a Cheesecake Factory everytime we come to Vegas.  This time we were out running errands, and pulled in to the restaurant at 5pm, seeking an early dinner.<br><br>Lo and behold, they have a Happy Hour from 4pm-6pm that we never noticed before, and we were able to grab seats with no wait at a high table near the bar.  We were presented with their sumptuous Happy Hour menu.  I got a house Margarita, and then ordered Dynamite Shrimp and my honey got Southern Fried Chicken Sliders.  We had friendly service, and the food arrived in a timely manner while we devoured some of the delectable house bread.  We relaxed and chatted about our busy day, while the Happy Hour tables filled in quickly.  <br><br>We literally gasped when the food arrived, I had forgotten that the portions were so big!  We enjoyed about half of our servings, and then even ordered Roadside Sliders to go.  <br><br>The jewel in the crown was, of course, the cheescake.  My honey chose lemon-raspberry, since I had done the honors last time we were at Cheescake Factory, and gotten Dulce de Leches.  It arrived with a spectacular mountain of whipped cream and a small pool of rasberry!  We set to work, but also had some of this sweet treat leftover.  Our waiter nicely packaged up the leftovers in very sturdy recyclable plastic containers and bagged them in the signature Cheesecake Factory bag.  When we left, it looked like we had shopped til we dropped.

Consistency is key for Cheesecake Factory. When you don&#39;t want a big fuss expensive meal that includes dressing up, but want one step up from Olive Garden, The Cheesecake Factory fits the bill perfectly. Come here if you&#39;re in a group, as you WILL find something for everyone. Dress up or down, come any time of day or evening, you&#39;ll always feel welcome. <br><br>I like this location best. Most times I&#39;ve had to wait for a table, but this time I did not. It was 11am on a Friday. Was accommodated with a larger booth to seat myself, my hot wife, her mom and her scooter, and Baby2. <br><br>Two times ago I had the steak, and I believe it was THE best steak I&#39;ve ever had. I usually go with tacos or a burger. Today I went with one of the lunch salads with chicken.  Portions are large. We always have leftovers. I have never once been disappointed with The Cheesecake Factory, and I&#39;ve tried many different items. The Craig&#39;s Crazy Carrot Cake Cheesecake is my favorite dessert. <br><br>The food is always served timely, drinks are always filled timely, staff is always friendly, helpful, efficient. Dessert is a MUST. Plus whatever that brown bread is they serve, good grief, that is good bread.<br><br>Will return, would def recommend

We went there with a party of 7.<br>The place is always packed. <br>We were sat with very little wait time.<br>Abigail was our server and did a great job. She&#39;s has a great, cheery attitude and was very professional. <br>I had the steak Diane and it was perfectly cooked the way ordered it. The sauce with it was delicious.<br>Everyone else enjoyed their meals and especially their desserts.<br>We have been here at least 5 times now. One of the reasons we keep coming is because the food and service is consistently good. <br>They must be doing something right because this place is always busy.

Covid or not this location continues to disappoint. Have a reservation never honored on time they want you to sit with your 86 year old mother in 114 degree sunshine for an additional 30 minutes. Your food has gone downhill and so has your staff. We were regulars at GVR but no more.

I was worried about their massive menu, since usually the more quantity out have the quality goes down.  From the food I tasted, I could say it&#39;s pretty good. I wouldn&#39;t say it&#39;s the best value for your money. <br><br>I had the orange chicken and it was adequate to quench my appetite. The rice was a little dry for my liking, but the chicken tasted great.  I wouldn&#39;t recommend it for your first dish, but if you&#39;re an orange chick connoisseur feel free to try it for the experience. <br><br>I&#39;ve saved the best for last, this dish is something you need to try. The Avocado egg roll combine with the sauce complement each other, providing you with a unique taste you&#39;ll enjoy.
Went there for dinner tonight and 4 hrs later am very sick had just a cheese burger that&#39;s all I ate today

It&#39;s been a few years since I&#39;ve eaten at Cheesecake Factory. Let me just start off by saying they do a great job during Covid 19 with cleanliness ! Our sever was Justin phenomenal customer service, keeping checking in on us refilling our drinks etc. The food portions are huge and filling, I had the Fettuccine Alfredo with shrimp it hit the spot. Come check this location out.

On Thursday, my brother and I decided to eat at this Cheesecake Factory.   This was an amazing dining experience.  Theresa (Teri) who was our server was exemplary!   She was attentive and so kind to us during our service.   It was a wonderful, refreshing experience and we could tell that she was appreciative of our  choosing to dine there.    We both had the Turkey burger with a side salad and they were outstanding!   The burgers were &#34;picture perfect&#34;.   They are served with sautéed onions, tomato, <br>Avocado and a small sprinkling of arugula on top.   The warm soft wheat bun was delicious!    Ask for Teri, if you choose to dine here and try the Turkey Burger if you haven&#39;t !    I would definitely recommend this Cheesecake Factory!

Good food, large portions.  Noisy, loud and always a long line and a crowd.  I like the lighter fare of food 500 calories and under.  Gluten free options are available.  The cheesecake is to live for but the noise and wait are not worth it for me.  It&#39;s just not relaxing, always feel rushed.

First time being at the this restaurant and I love it. The restaurant is very spacious and open. The employees are friendly and the booth seating is comfortable. I had breakfast burrito which was bursting with flavors. I wanted to get one of their cheesecakes but I couldn&#39;t I was already full from the burrito. So I decided to end it with nice cup of cappuccino. I can just say that I have to try one of their wide variety of cheesecakes and something else from the menu in near future.

When you got to the Cheesecake Factory, let&#39;s be real it&#39;s for dessert. We stopped for lunch and the lunch was pretty mediocre. The chicken salad was good I would have that again with a side of mayo it was just a bit dry. This place is huge so even on a Friday night the wait is not bad. I had on purpose the second most caloric cheesecake The macadamia caramel cheesecake OMG so yummy so rich tons of macadamias , it was my last hurrah before my &#34;lifestyle &#34; change for the next 8 months. It was worth every bite. My husband had the tiramisu cheesecake, he enjoyed the cheesecake part , the tiramisu part not so much. Maybe I&#39;ll be back in 8 months!!!

The Cheescake Factory is one of my favorite restaurants and I go every year for my birthday, but this most recent visit was disappointing. I understand this is a hectic time for alot of businesses, but I feel this location could take some constructive criticism to improve during this pandemic. Social distancing was not enforced as customers who were waiting inside were passing by each other constantly to get out of the restuarant. Making an entrance and exit separate would improve this dramatically. Food was sitting out on tables across the restaurant, as hundreds of orders are being placed. My concern when I got my food was how long had it been sitting out and will I be okay if I eat this? Allowing order cutoffs would be helpful in this situation.

Our last few visits have been really disappointing.  The food quality has been below average.  I ordered the grilled chicken avocado sandwich.  The bacon tasted like salty burnt old bacon, cheese was hard and old.  I couldn&#39;t eat it.  I normally speak up but the waitress had a bad attitude and I didn&#39;t want to deal with it.  My husband ordered the salmon and normally it is good, but he said his frozen salmon at home tastes better.  Not worth the money going out.  Sucks!
great service!  Great Food!   Thank you for always getting my &#34;curbside pickup&#34; order accurate and DELICIOUS . You guys ROCK

Great service! Delicious food! Such a wonderful place to eat. I always enjoy everything. The chicken nachos are delicious! Small salad is huge! Great portions and come on every flavor of cheesecake. Was on a first date and was given time and space to enjoy conversation and still was given great service. Will be back over and over again.

Trying to support businesses on Mother&#39;s Day here in Green Valley.  Been coming to this location for over 10 years!  I understand we are dealing with special circumstances of Covid-19 and how we conduct business today while we try to get back to some normalcy of day to day.  Ordered online at 12:20pm and got here to pick up my order as it was scheduled to be ready at 12:40pm.  You get here and one of the reps tell you to park and wait for a text.  It&#39;s been over 1 hour and a half before I got my text and didn&#39;t get my food for 2 hours!!!  On a normal day, I would have left a long time ago.  It&#39;s Mother&#39;s Day and that&#39;s what my wife wanted but this is unacceptable.  There were so many customers that all they ordered were cheesecakes and can&#39;t pick up their order and have been waiting just as long!  The cheesecakes are already made and just need to be put in a to go container.  Terrible service.  Didn&#39;t even get an apology for the wait.<br><br>Attn: Cheesecake Guest Service,<br><br>Why would I want or need to go to your website after what I experience?

Go Here! Waitstaff one of the best In Las Vegas area. French fries are not well curated in the fish and chips. Sitting in the large Bar area is a good choice if are drinking. Top shelf liquor is 5 shelves high in the air (25 feet). Located in trendy Green Valley this Cheesecake Factory is like all the rest. <br>Tip: Avoid the usual mistake, leave room in your stomach for the cheesecake dessert.

I&#39;ve had cheesecake from Cheesecake Factory a million times, but it had been years since I actually had any entrees from here.  I was at work craving cheesecake one day and noticed Door Dash had a promotion for free delivery.  I didn&#39;t feel right just eating dessert for lunch so I ended up ordering an entree as well.<br><br>I must say the food was pretty good.  I&#39;m guessing they amped up their menu/recipes because a few years ago the only thing they had going for themselves was the dessert.  The entrees always lacked flavour and substance, but I was satisfied with what I got that day.  I ordered some sort of Cilantro-Lime chicken dish, but I am unsure of the exact name.  I tried to find it on their menu, but maybe it was seasonal?<br><br>Either way, good on you Cheesecake Factory.  Maybe now I will stop in for everything you have to offer instead of the cheesecake.<br><br>Forgot to mention the entrees are very overpriced and the lunch menu sucks.

The worst Cheesecake Factory service ever. Especially with this COVID going around. I called in the order and they made me wait a hour and a half. Wouldn&#39;t you think that they would want the service. Huh!

Was not impressed. Usually enjoy the food. We spent close to $150 with tip and the food was awful. Wings too hot to eat even one, avocado rolls not cooked throughly, kids sliders burnt and crunchy, also got 3 meals to go for a family in need. Hopefully theirs were better.
The food is always good here. I took off one star because one of the hosts was very unkind but other than that it&#39;s really good!

Ordered pick up from here only to get home and only recieve half of my order, missing my gumbo. Drive 20 minutes back to them to only wait 10 minutes for a manager to speak to me and only offered a slice of cheesecake for the inconvience. So when I get home to my sliders that are now ice cold i&#39;m only given two onions per burger. Probably won&#39;t be returning to this location due to this awful experience.

Great food and service! We came with a wedding party of 9 and they were great seating and serving us without a long wait. We had our table within 15 minutes. The server was friendly and very helpful. <br><br>The food is always exactly as described and delicious. Always fresh and hot when served.

Had such an awesome dinner experience tonight! Thank you Brett, working the outdoor patio tonight around 8:30p! Loved the fact that they allow service dogs, cuz our pups enjoyed dinner on the outdoor patio too! <br><br>Sooooooo it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory! Who doesn&#39;t LOVE The Cheesecake Factory?! If you love delicious dishes?! Cuz that&#39;s what you&#39;ll find here at Cheesecake. The menu is huuuuuuuge, be prepared it will take you a hot minute to find what you want to eat. My favorite dish is Chicken Piccata.  This dish has a bed of angel hair pasta with a creeeeaaammmmy white sauce with juicy chicken, capers and mushrooms. I love this dish! <br><br>You can&#39;t go wrong with the many options at The Cheesecake Factory. Seriously! For dessert, we opted for the red velvet cheesecake! Order this if you want some good good in your belly. <br><br>Note: if it&#39;s not too hot out, and if they have the misters going- sit in the outdoor patio, you&#39;ll catch a beautiful sunset. Soooo romantic!

Absolutely love the happy hour. They have the best prices on small tasty dishes and some great drink options, not to mention the cheesecake is always sooo rich and creamy. On the weekends they serve brunch and the lemon ricotta pancakes have me addicted ..seriously it&#39;s soo good . Try out the chicken and waffles benedict too! Only on Saturday&#39;s and Sunday&#39;s though because during the week they only serve omelettes and eggs :-/ I wish they changed that rule !! Lol <br><br>PS we accidentally left a wallet and the next day it was returned to us by our bartender , sorry we forgot his name (thank you again mr.bartender ) .<br><br>Ps.s (try the sweet tamale cakes)

Stopped here on the way back from Hoover Dam. While I generally rate the TCF as three stars, this particular one had a few menu items that I&#39;ve not seen at other Cheesecake Factories (in other areas of the country). There were several chicken and fish dishes that were unique. There may be other things as well, but it&#39;s a huge menu and my goal was not to compare every item. I ordered the Chicken Bellagio which was delicious.<br>Their salads we also a step up from any other CF I&#39;ve eaten at. And they were HUGE. Definitely enough for more than one meal and the quality of ingredients was top-notch.<br>Service was friendly and quick. As usual we were too full for cheesecake, but it is to die for.<br>Worth checking out even if you&#39;re not a huge fan of Cheesecake Factory.

We were excited to go out to dinner during this crazy time!!  From making the reservation to taking our cheesecake to go was absolutely a 5 star experience The service was awesome (Darryl I think, masks make it hard to hear sometimes).  He was attentive and had great back up help. Everyone was pleasant . Of course the food is always fantastic here.  Thank you for following the safety restrictions set by the governor.  Not easy I&#39;m sure but we really enjoyed our dinner and will be back!!!

This location is just okay. Came today and felt very rushed with our service. My daughter ordered kids fettuccine Alfredo, it came as bow ties. She didn&#39;t want to eat it so I asked for the fettuccine noodles and my waitress said this is the way it comes. I&#39;ve never heard of fettuccine noodles being called bow tie noodles. She reminded me 3 times, okay I get it. Then my chicken reisling had bones inside of it.

German was amazing as a server. Very attentive and considerate during these covid 19 times.  My moms food came out after I finished my meal- and the fries were cold. I was surprised the manager Bill didn&#39;t offer any dessert or anything to compensate for the error.

Had an 8pm reservation for the patio. There are two HUGE patios at this location, at least one has misters. It is being pushed for restaurants to encourage customers to eat outside when possible. And yet both their patios were closed?? This makes zero sense and is very disappointing

Curbside pickup was awful. Arrived at the time our food was supposed to be ready and was told it wasn&#39;t ready yet and to park until we got a text message. 30 minutes later still no message, so we drove through the line again and they brought out cold food that had obviously been ready for a long time. Spent a lot of money for garbage and when we complained the manager said since we paid online there was nothing she could do.

Stupid stupid restrictions. Makes you wait outside in 100 degree heat. Not enough umbrellas. Can&#39;t go back out the front door have to go the opposite way. Why? So we don&#39;t walk next to someone else? Well everyone&#39;s huddled under the same umbrella and not six feet apart. If you&#39;re going to mandate stupid rules at least make sense. People you have to grow a pair and not worry about Shittylacks hypocrisy. I had a gift card to Cheesecake. I want the money because I&#39;m not going back.

I just picked up my order via curbside - I ordered Fish &amp; Chips and when I got home discovered I was missing the &#34;chips&#34; (no fries). Highly disappointed! I never check my orders from Cheesecake because they are usually on point. I paid $18.50 for just fish and coleslaw? Smh! And to think I chose this for my birthday dinner today.

Cheesecake Factory has been a long time favorite of mine. I have never been disappointed in a meal at any location. <br><br>Service can occasionally be slow if you come around 3-4pm which we usually do, probably shift change. We like that time because it&#39;s generally not packed yet. Friday and Saturday day evenings you can expect to wait for a seat. National Cheesecake day is also pretty crazy but their service is pretty decent and quick. <br><br>Before I cared about what I ate, I used to order off the regular menu. The portions are so large you can split three ways or bring home leftovers...the leftovers taste even better sometimes! I still LOVE the avocado egg rolls and the sauce that comes with them. Must try! The bread they bring is always good as well. This time the bread was nice and warm. The brown bread and sourdough are equally delicious. <br><br>Skinnylicious menu- this is the menu I usually pick from now. The servings are more normal and the calories are MUCH lower. Don&#39;t let the word &#34;skinny&#34; fool you, all the food on this menu is huge on flavor and still satisfying! My favorites are the Mexican lettuce wraps, the flatbreads, burgers and the side salad that comes with the burgers/sandwiches. <br><br>Cheesecake- really, you can&#39;t go wrong!! I eat off the skinny menu so I can easily eat dessert. Top ones for me are original(so good), chocolate tuxedo mousse, red velvet, and Godiva. If you bring me any cheesecake on the menu I will eat it though. They also have a low carb cheesecake. Or if you&#39;re wanting a guilt free dessert you can opt for a bowl of strawberries. I usually bring my cake home to enjoy later.<br><br>Ambiance- it&#39;s quite pleasant inside although it can get loud. The booths are better than tables. Sometimes with a table you can end up sitting next to some very uncomfortable people who just sit there and awkwardly stare at each other. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory has been one of my all time favorite restaurants! Can&#39;t go wrong with pages and pages of menu options. There&#39;s something for everyone!

Off the strip delicious dining. Henderson is such a fun area to explore and this location was a needed break from the Strip. Family friendly, excellent service and good prices for big portions. The only drawback was how dark it was. We had to use our phones to light the menu! Enough yummy pasta for a late night hotel snack. Too full for cheesecake. We plan on staying in Henderson again for a Vegas trip and I would come back.

Post Covid-19, dining is open but expect about an hour wait. Will receive a text message when table is ready, this allowed us to walk around The District. Always great food here, huge portions and save room for cheesecake. We ordered nachos with chicken (add on) for an appetizer and it was delicious!

We had the worst service with this Cheesecake Factory. After a pandemic to be treated badly having a reservation and then being told it&#39;s an hour an a half to get seated.  The level of management is poorly hired and needs to be reassessed.  Wow!!

We had a reservation at 6:45 on 6/6. We were sat within 5 minutes of the quote. There was a long delay in getting our server to  to take drink and order. We ordered spinach dip which was long time wait. While eating appetizer, we asked server to place our food order. It took very long time to receive our food. From when we sat down until we got out food was approximately 1 hour. My friend ordered teriyaki chicken and it was undercooked and still bloody. I ordered chicken littles and they were over cooked and very crispy. The side dishes with the chicken littles, mashed potatoes and corn were ice cold. Three different managers came to our table and tried to fix the problem. I was given new side dishes and my friend ordered a different entree. ALSO, real silverware was given to us and it was dirty. Overall, a very poor experience. Both meals shouldn&#39;t been charged and we should have been invited back for another meal and given the Manager&#39;s card who handled the situation

Ordered fish and chips dinner, they delivered lunch size, made it right, however, seating to meal delivery was 54 minutes. Then offered no dessert or to take anything off the bill. Slow service, those around us were seated, and eating before our table. Not impressed for a &#34;high end&#34; area r<br><br>We were back in the area and decided to try again. With the exception of a fifteen minute wait turning into a forty five minute wait to be seated, much better experience. Our waiter Justin was top shelf. Drinks, appetizers, and dinners were great. Address the the wait situation.
Love the cheese cakes and all the fun drinks and pastas. The salads are great to. Fun for dates, going out with family and friends. Or grub hub it if your feeling lazy. Great food!

We had reservations on a Saturday for 6 people.  We only waited for five minutes and were seated.  Excellent service and food was as great as it usually is.  Ok and we splurged for 3 desserts although everyone was full ---certainly didn&#39;t stop anyone from finishing everything.
On time for our reservation told to wait on the patio until the table was ready. 108 degrees out, we can&#39;t stand in the entrance with a mask.<br>Waiting over 10 minutes-ridiculous

I usually don&#39;t have any problems going to Cheesecake Factory. However, what&#39;s unfortunate is when they&#39;re really busy, expect that your drinks will most likely arrive 15-20 minutes after you&#39;ve been seated. Their service is usually good. We had the same server as we did last time. He was great. Everything just took forever that night. My one concern, and the reason why I&#39;m writing this review, is in regards to their sanitation.<br><br>When we sat down, I realized they placed the utensils ON THE TABLE. Rather than on the napkins, they decide to place the utensils that you&#39;re supposed to use with your food, on the table after they&#39;ve bussed it. I think that is truly unsanitary and just plain disgusting. Also, my knife had a fingerprint!! They should change how they set their tables and where they place the utensils. <br><br>This is unfortunate because I like cheesecake.

The food is always so consistently great. There&#39;s always great parking and the wait staff is always so friendly and knowledgeable I&#39;ve been coming here for years and I will be coming here for as long. As they are around.
Had issues with my reservation. Don&#39;t trust setting up reservation requests on yelp. Definitely call to verify everything, even if the hostesses tell you to only book online.

Wife and kid took me to Cheesecake Factory for my favorite birthday dish, Louisiana Chicken Pasta. Yum. The restaurant was out of chicken at 8:15 on a Friday night. Are you kidding me? No chicken at the Cheesecake Factory? Took it in stride and went with something hard to screw up, cheesesteak sandwich. It was pathetic. Barely any meat, I assume they were running out of beef, and perhaps the worst attempt at cheesesteak I&#39;ve EVER seen. Thanks for destroying my birthday dinner

So thank you to the host. Went with family to eat today Sept. 8 my birthday. Wife advised to host my husband bday. He stated ok dont worry will take care of it. When we are are getting seated host says happy bday you want us to sign to you?.<br>Obviously I knew they where going to sign but I&#39;ve never had a host tell me you want us to sign to you or not. I said yes I would. Once seated we order some spaghetti for my 4yr old. Once we all get the food his spaghetti is bowtie pasta, so my son did not want it cuase he wants spaghetti. Server tells me all kids pasta are bowties (but I order spaghetti). Once we finish wife is waiting for them to come and sing with cake piece candle but nope we only got our bill. Paid and left. THANK YOU CHEESECAKE FACTORY for the Birthday Lunch disaster

Always fast service and consistently delicious options. I will say the calamari appetizer was not the best this time around. It tasted a bit bland and was a bit chewy in texture. Other than that the food was delicious as always. Also, their Pineapple Upside-down Cheesecake on special is so tasty. Not my typical dessert of choice but I&#39;m so glad I got it!<br><br>One service complaint was that there was no visible management doing table touches. Thankfully our server (didn&#39;t get his name) was attentive and polite. Courses came out in a timely manner and we never felt rushed nor did we ever feel like we were waiting for service. <br><br>Always have and will continue to recommend this location in Las Vegas.
Much better guys. Thank you. Still great service from the bar by Amy &amp; Chanel. This time our food, delicious as always, was served perfectly.<br>Nice to see things back on track.. Ciao.

Had lunch there today and have to give it a one star just like all of the other most recent reviews. Server brought the wrong drink initially as she was not paying attention to what i said when i was ordering. Drink was a margarita, about 8 ozs for $10.75, grossly overpriced and mostly margarita mix. <br>The chicken and avocado sandwich had a piece of chicken (not freshly cooked, could taste the salty brine of prior processing)  on it that was the size of a silver dollar under lots of lettuce and cheese. <br>Don&#39;t waste your time there for good food unless you are ONLY having cheesecake.
Food is pretty good on average but their menu is like reading a novel.  Who knew you could offer too many choices. I rarely go because I get bored looking at the menu

We had a wonderful dinner here over a week ago. We both had the Steak Diane cooked perfectly. The appetizer and drinks were also excellent. I felt pretty safe with their social distancing. We have been here many times over the years and have always had a great meal.

My bread was over cook but I got over that. Tried the Carne Asada which comes with rice and corn. I had the steak cooked medium, the rice was good and the corn was okay and that&#39;s only because the corn still had the string from the corn in it. But my cosmo was definitely good.

We visited the Cheesecake Factory for my daughter&#39;s birthday lunch and were not disappointed. The staff took all necessary COVID precautions and our experience was delightful. Our server was super attentive and kind. We ordered a bunch of appetizers and shared. As always, this place is one of my favorites.

It was one of my favorite place to eat because its convenient and i love their miso salmon with brown rice. Tonight i decided to stop by and get me and my son a salad and fettuccine Alfredo to go. When i got to the counter to pick up my order i notice that the cold salad was under the hot Alfredo in the same bag. Hence, my Chinese chicken salad is now warm. Saaaayyyy whaaaat? I had to tell the cashier they have t o make me a new salad.  I dunno &#34;bout everyone but i don&#39;t like my leafy green warm. I like &#39;em crisp!  Crunch crunch chomp chomp! Let&#39;s not get tight with the bag ,Cheesecake Factory.  We are still good with plastic bags here in Vegas :) ... no worries ill be back here still to get my miso salmon.

Curbside to go was fast and efficient. From the initial call to the young lady who came out to my car, service was great!<br><br>My wife loved her Skinnylicious Asian salad.<br>I enjoyed the Chicken Consoletta.

Came here with my husband on a Friday night. Place is beautiful. We came 1 hour before it closed. Our server Dante was routinely checking up on us to make sure everything was good. He was very professional and polite. He has the energy to still serve my husband and I even though it was late. Dante gave us an awesome Customer Service! Hands down. This is the type of people we need to see more in other restaurants. Dante deserves a raise. Food was great. I give this place a 5 star! Thanks again Dante.

I really like the place besides the excellent cheesecake if you have enough room after the huge portions. I normally get the fish and chips which is a nice portion and rake home red velvet cheese cake the bills over $20 but worth it. Service is always really good sometimes there&#39;s over a half hour line just to be seated

Food was fine, had a hard time seeing due to low lighting, a little cramped in a booth for four adults and the music was definitely to loud, waitress had a hard time communicating with us due to noise! Otherwise standard cheesecake fair.

I have this rating simply because they REQUIRE you to use Yelp to make a reservation. I called in and it took longer to explain to me how to get a reservation than just taking my name and party size.... Counter productive. I never use Yelp and to be honest, I really don&#39;t like Yelp they have horrible business practices. So why force your clients to go to a third party, where you&#39;re not even very well ranked on, to lock in business.

Usually we love this location. Today 9/22/19 it was horrible. <br>Our waitress was so disorganized and we sat, waiting for our checks for over 30 mins. <br>Mind you, it wasn&#39;t very busy. Total<br>Time was 2.5hrs!! Ridiculous!  The amount of time we sat waiting for food and checks was unacceptable.  Our food also came out in pieces instead of at the same time.<br><br>My order was wrong, she would come and check on us so quick and rushed. so I could send it back. <br>Never brought more bread nor asked if We wanted another drink, however did bring sodas to the table a few times. But dropped them off and dashed away. <br><br>My check, after waiting forever, was wrong then she ran MY card for someone else&#39;s bill on top of<br>Mine. <br><br>Worst part is, when another waitress came to help, she told her &#34;I got them&#34; which clearly she did not. <br>Unhappy and starving as the meal was inedible for me. Boxed it to bring to my dogs.

They have a huge menu on which nothing is really done well.<br>When you find something decent it gets removed service is extremely show at this location, it took over 20 minutes to receive pre sliced cheesecake. <br>Been here over 2 and a half hours.

NEVER COMING BACK. I think I definitely prefer another Cheesecake Factory. Everytime I try to give this location a chance, the servers prove to me that they have no care for the service they give &amp; they just care towards the end to give the bill. Oh! And may I add, the server checked on everyone else around us and us only towards the end. Totally not worth it to come here for the sh*t service. As we were leaving, server never said &#34;bye&#34; or &#34;thank you&#34; <br>Our server Jessica &amp; apparently some of the other staff needs to get retrained on what customer service means. I&#39;m no expert, but I know I should have been treated way better than that. I might as well have gotten to-go and served myself drinks at home since our cups were empty the whole meal. Server only checked on us when giving the check, not a descent thank you. Wanted to order more, but Yakno.. why stay in a place where we&#39;re getting treated like dirt!

Made an order today at 6pm.  Arrived at this location on Greenvalley parkway. While waiting I notice the lady next to me having a problem with her order.   Once the store manager left her car with a bag.  Unknown to me.   That it was mine.  Until the young lady parked next to me in space 9.  Asked.  Is your name Kayla.  I said yes.   She replied. That was ur order in my car.   She went on to say.  She opened the bag cause it didn&#39;t seem like it was her order or her order seemed too small.  Once they straighten her order out.  They bring me the bag.  She had in her car.  Rumbling through.  COVID-19.   This man the so called manager tried to convince me he threw away the order he got from the lady next to my car. He gontienued to lie and why was the seal broken on the bag.  He was rude and disrespectful.  I&#39;ll never eat there again.   He beat me mad. Cause I refuse to take the order he had in someone else car.  It was ur mistake.  Not mine.  How dare u lie to me.   I could have gotten sick.  Over your lie and mistake.   It&#39;s a damn shame.  And once I went into that restaurant.  I think that the health department should visit there.  It was very crowded inside while waiting in my refund.

What a success this place this is! Every table is taken, people willing to wait for up to an hour for a table and the patrons look happy.<br><br>Used a gift card for chicken potstickers and mixed veggie salad with added chicken. The potstickers were actually tasty and the shoyu sauce pleasing. Pal commented on how pure and unburpy the meat was. Loved the green onions on it.<br><br>The mixed salad had a lot of cheese chunks and mixtures of salad, asparagus and stuff. Don&#39;t remember a heavy or creamy dressing, but it was flavorful enough not to miss it.<br><br>Great service.

As expected, this restaurant nearly never fails at delivering not only great food but amazing service from the lady that waited on us. <br>I definitely will keep this place in mind for those &#34;special... but not THAT special&#34; type of nights

It was worth the delicious wait. I ordered the Ahi Tuna Tar, Tar appetizer, It was scrumptious. But the delectable treat of the night was the strawberry , pineapple  upside down cheesecake. Simply put, it was divine. I&#39;ll be back

This Cheesecake Factory was at the district in Henderson. The food was great, the service was even better. Our waiter (didn&#39;t catch his name, but he had a distinct handlebar mustache), mentioned the daily specials and was very accommodating to our customized orders. <br><br>We didn&#39;t wait too long to be seated, and our food came out pretty fast too. <br><br>We&#39;ve eaten at many cheesecake factories before, but what made this review and experience so yelp worthy, was our fantastic waiter.

Great spot for a birthday dinner with a plethora of dessert options!<br><br>The wife and I met a couple of friends here for her birthday dinner and only waited about 15 minutes before being seated (at 6:15pm). We started with waters all around and a couple of cocktails: the strawberry martini and the factory peach Bellini, both drinks were very good 5/5. <br><br>For appetizers we ordered the avocado spring rolls 5/5. <br>The bread was also delivered with butter and the wheat loaf is always delicious. <br><br>For entree&#39;s we ordered the Orange Chicken: deep fried pieces of chicken breast covered in sweet and spicy orange sauce accompanied with rice (white or brown) and veggies, usually lots of snow peas and some carrots 5/5, shrimp jambalaya delicious flavors 5/5, shrimp pasta 4/5, and the chicken salad with extra chicken 4/5.<br><br>For desserts we tried the white chocolate raspberry 5/5 and the Craig&#39;s crazy carrot cake cheesecake 5/5! Honestly I think all of heir desserts are 5/5!<br><br>Service was on top of everything and even came to sing 8-D.<br><br>Thank you for a nice birthday dinner!

I hate this place you wait forever even though they have empty tables. Because they don&#39;t have enough employees. Maybe they should hire more people to help customers. We waited over 54minutes when asked how long more she replied &#34;I don&#39;t know we are too busy another 40 minutes&#34; and this wasn&#39;t a party of 40 people it was only 3 of us. We couldn&#39;t take it anymore so we left <br>You&#39;ll never see us or anyone we know here again. Very rude<br>The lady with short hair who was telling everyone at the front was extremely rude. <br>She was acting like she owned the place.

Well if you want to carry out Don&#39;t go here!   We got 4 Cobb salads with chicken and we think a chicken walked through it but otherwise not enough chicken to feed one....on top of that the lettuce is the center yellow stuff you normally discard...my cesear salad was not green it was yellow ....the only part worth anything was my flat bread pizza which was good! <br>Eat in or stay away

Not a normal Mother&#39;s Day but the curbside pick up from Cheesecake Factory was just amazing!!! Suuuuppeeerrr great girl (didn&#39;t get her name) brought out my food and charged me from my car outside. My mom and auntie loved the brunch. Homemade mimosas were the perfect touch for sure :)

Menu items aren&#39;t really gluten free even if you request them to be prepared gluten free as the menu states.  Management admitted that they have separate fryers but state they are &#34;too busy&#34; to dedicate a fryer for gluten free items.  So you order something to be prepared gluten free but it isn&#39;t.  Waiters were unable to identify if any salad dressings are gluten free.  One of the steak items was teeny tiny ,tasted bad and was ice cold.  The manager even admitted that when he saw it being served it didn&#39;t look like it was prepared correctly but he didn&#39;t stop it from being served!  The food wasn&#39;t served at the same time for everyone at the table.  The restaurant lighting us way to dim.  You can&#39;t even read the menu. Will not be coming back here. Everyone is very disorganized and clueless.
Cynthia....!!!!! Amazing amazing service!! Thank you sooooo much!!!! Will ask for  you when we go back!!! Ur the best!!

Sheryl &amp; Stephen are awesome!  4pm Happy Hour w/ them is fantastic &amp; the crowd is very friendly.  Mostly locals.  I have to leave a new review because I had the Beet Salad for the first time here &amp; I highly recommend it!  Super beautiful salad!  Mmm mmm!   <br><br>My friend got the Dynamite Shrimp &amp; Spicy Chicken.  I tasted both &amp; the only thing dynamite on both were the sauce on the side.  The batter on each were not spicy whatsoever.  My girlfriend got the Tomato Basil Flatbread &amp; Adam&#39;s PB Chocolate Ripple Cheesecake &amp; both were absolutely delish to share!!  I have to say the PB Cheesecake blew our socks off lol!  Wow!  The Reese&#39;s PB Cheesecake is mixed layers of cake upon Cheesecake so not an all Cheesecake FYI.  Mmm!

I think for such a large fast food chain restaurant they should offer Wi-Fi when you enter the restaurant your whole Wi-Fi is shut down you can&#39;t post on your Facebook you can&#39;t look up anything on the internet, and you end up spending $60 or more 4 meal for two people and you can&#39;t even get on the Internet or I have Wi-Fi I think it&#39;s totally ludicrous

Everyone&#39;s had food from The Cheesecake Factory before but what distinguishes this restaurant from others is the service that the staff provides. My family and I came in on a busy holiday post mandated quarantine and the manager was very accommodating. I called ahead to make sure we were all on the same page as to what we needed and he explained everything clearly and even offered to meet us when we arrived. Our main server Katya met all our needs and was very patient! Her coworker Sarah helped take our orders, answer all our questions and both were super friendly and courteous. My mother in law commented on how the food was cooked perfectly, and the manager made a note to let the chefs know and make sure they were rewarded for their excellent service. In this day and age, everything is so hectic and every little thing gives people anxiety with masks and social distancing but this team made us feel calm and enjoyed every moment of our celebration. Thank you for your fantastic service!

I love the Cheesecake Factory!!! I have not had one bad dish from this location.<br><br>I always get the Factory Chopped Salad. The chicken in it is always tasty and tender. The apples and bleu cheese are always a perfect balance. This is a must have and it is large enough to split with several people.<br><br>I also got the lunch portion of the Chicken Picatta. Even though it was the lunch sized portion there was still enough to take home for leftovers. <br><br>Give this place a try everything here has big portions and is super flavorful.

Called ahead of time to get information on menu and reservations. They do have a full menu except for any item containing tuna and made a reservation on yelp. Upon arrival the hostess checked me in and said my table was being prepared, after a 15 min wait and a crowd forming in the small lobby at the entrance because you are not permitted to sit the waiting area, I informed the hostess that I would wait outside, obviously she has forgotten about the COVID 19 social distancing implemented by the state, after waiting another 15 min and asking the hostess to just tell me I was going to wait longer or I was going to take my business elsewhere she decided to have someone sit us. I waited a total of 30 minutes after my reservation which makes the reservation pointless. Once I was at my table the waitress was awesome and the food was great no complaints there apart from a few people who apparently thought it was okay to have full conversation instead of approaching each other. If you go to a restaurant please have respect and consideration for others around and don&#39;t a one star guest as people are having little patience for idiots in the world due to the current pandemic.

Horrible!!! Do not order from here. I placed an advanced pick up order here for 5:45pm. Simple enough right? When I left to pick up my order I almost immediately received at text from Cheesecake Factory almost 25 minutes early my food was ready to be picked up. When I complained to the guy in front he agreed was much too early to be ready and then disregarded my complaint. It took another 7-8 minutes to get my food even though I received a text 20 minutes prior it was ready. Of course by the time I got home everything was cold and pretty much disgusting. Money is not worth wasting on this restaurant during such a time or anytime for that matter.

Late night meal at the bar with my husband after a long flight.  Had the Steak Diane and it was just okay.  I wasn&#39;t a fan of the added mustard as an ingredient.  That&#39;s what I mostly tasted.  Not sure that&#39;s supposed to be so prevalent.<br><br>Ordered a Skinny Sangria and it was heavy on cinnamon.  Also had to call it out to my server like, &#34;Is this right?&#34;  I get it that cinnamon does certain things with the body and taste buds but I would have much rather preferred a Sangria with Stevia or something so it didn&#39;t taste different than other drinks.  I&#39;m not in love with cinnamon like that.  It is &#34;Skinny&#34; though because I only had one.  <br><br>The wheat bread is always the same and I ate plenty of it.  I&#39;ll probably stick to Happy Hour and eat the beef and chicken sliders as I have been.  Stay away from the &#34;skinny&#34; stuff here.  Cheesecake is for the happy fattening food eaters.
It&#39;s been a year and this place still rocks the house.  Awesome food and great service.  Thanks!

No bueno! Dirty plate and butter knife. When I asked for a replacement one of the gals brought a setting in her hand (Yuck) not in the usual, wrapped up in a cloth napkin. The service was super duper slow and it wasn&#39;t even peak dining hours yet. Asian lettuce tacos are my fave but NOT when its served with piece of raw chicken  The manager was apologetic and offered to bring me something else but that didn&#39;t cure my upset stomach.
So disappointed with my lunch today.. had the Renee&#39;s special for the 1st time.. never again...they need to rethink this dish..

Was over on that side of town and my husband and I stopped for lunch.  I had the spicy chipotle chicken sandwich and it was absolutely delicious with just the right amount of spice.  My husband was not as happy with his fish and chips.  I don&#39;t think the fish was breaded there. I think it was frozen and taken out of a box to fry.

I hate to give them 2 stars but after ordering take out from them twice, I&#39;ve gotten food poisoning twice...it&#39;s not fun.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory was a place where it was once in awhile cause if I wanted to splurge, this place would be on top of my list. Which now I hate to say I don&#39;t think I&#39;m going to come back. <br><br>It was a good place to meet up with people, a good place for date night and a good place to just over indulge and not feel guilty. But lately, their food is sub par, and it&#39;s sad. I ordered the chicken and shrimp gumbo, the first time I had it, I couldn&#39;t stop eating it. The last time I had it the shrimp wasn&#39;t cooked all the way, and this time I ordered it the grease was so thick it just tasted like oil. My girlfriend ordered the corn cakes and they weren&#39;t even cooked all the way, it was doughy inside ...not edible. And our tiramisu was just thrown in the container, looked like half of it didn&#39;t even make it. <br><br>The service at the bakery area wasn&#39;t that great. Literally had to wait 10 mins to be acknowledged, then just to get attitude from the girl. Not even a smile or nothing.
