I waited for another 15 mins for my food which should&#39;ve been ready for pick up, but it wasn&#39;t. The girl was talking to another girl across the counter disregarding a couple people behind her. It&#39;s kind of sad to see a good food industry just not have the enthusiasm as before. It&#39;s hard for places to stay up and running when other places are coming in and taking over. I would hate to see this place go down in the dumps. Maybe when they get better reviews and more stars I will rethink my visit...but until then I&#39;m sorry, I won&#39;t be back.

Ordered food on Friday for pick up on Sunday for Mother&#39;s days. Was on the way to pick up order when I got an email stating there was a problem. Order was cancelled at 1240 when it was supposed to be ready at 1. Line was busy so when I arrived I went in and was told the order could not be full filled, so they cancelled and hadn&#39;t prepared any of it. Was told they could make the order but wait time would be 2 hrs. Thank you for nothing. Never again. Do not recommend this establishment, even if you are being proactive.

We&#39;ve had mostly all good experiences at this location. The servers are friendly and the food is great. It&#39;s in a nice location too. I think once we didn&#39;t specify we wanted a booth so we were led to a crowded tiny table area, and when we told our server we wanted a booth she wasn&#39;t thrilled and just waved us off. But we were seated at a booth and it was all good after that! Always love dining at Cheesecake Factory.

I was super impressed by our experience. Our server (i forgot her name, started with an M ) was soooo great!! I was asking her questions about the kitchen because I&#39;ve always wanted to be a chef and she had an answer for everything and more! In just meats alone they have over 50 different kinds, and just in the avocado egg rolls sauce they have 17 ingredients. I guess everything there is made from scratch and they truly care about their ingredients! Wonderful experience!
Steak tacos were awesome today! Great service by Christina D - she was totally on point, courteous, friendly, and very prompt!

Came here this morning for brunch with a couple of  friends and was thoroughly disappointed. Juliet was our waiter and took literally 20 minutes to even get our drink order in. Than came back 10 minutes later to take our food order. After placing our order in it took an hour....yes ONE HOUR to get our basic omelettes and chicken/waffles. <br>I was shocked that the people around us had received their food before we had and they were seated WAY AFTER US. <br>It&#39;s safe to say I will not be returning here based on poor customer service.

This is one of the only chain restaurants I frequent because I think their cheesecake and their selection is absolutely amazing. Hubby and I usually share an appetizer and then two cheesecakes. Our favorites include any of the egg rolls, fried Mac and cheese balls and lettuce wraps. And for dessert either the Reese&#39;s, the Oreo, the S&#39;more or the the Chocolate Hazelnut (although there are a TON more awesome options)!<br><br>Another cool factor, if you have a baby they give you complimentary plate of banana slices. Who knew?! My baby boy certainly enjoyed those.

I sent an order in around 5:20 and they said our food would be ready at 6:15. I sent my youngest son in to get the food and they totally didn&#39;t get our food out till 8:30. I went to relieve my son and the manager said they lost my order, he the walked out 10 mins later stating I found your order and handed me 2 hour old food. FUCK YOU CHEESE CAKE!! At least get me fresh food! You fucking pricks!!  I didn&#39;t even get chicken in my Alfredo!! You didn&#39;t even get the fucking order right!!! What a waste of time!! At least be honest with your organization and tell me you fucked up, not just tell me it was door dashes issue. I would never expect you people to be this rotten!!! I spent over $100 on foot there and ended up eating sandwiches because of the cold and old food you gave us!! Thank you for the showing me the real Cheese Cake Factory. Oh well

it&#39;s a new system you guys are trying to not tell people you&#39;ll receive a text when there order is ready? what!?  that&#39;s why your parking lot is full of people waiting ... so maybe you should tell them they&#39;ll receive a text instead of not saying anything instead of wasting our damn time sitting here!!

Food was great. Service was great. Up until it came time to pay. My roommate and I were presented one check with three items on it. Two were hers, and one mine. We paid with different colored cards and on the check I wrote next to each item red or blue for our debit card colors. <br><br>We got charged backwards. No big deal, waitress took the bill and brought it back ten minutes later.<br><br> The same thing again-charges were backwards. So we explained that the charges were backwards a second time. She said she would get a manager to fix this and when he came over and took the bills and brought them back they were finally correct. <br><br>My debit card was charged three times for something simple to figure out.<br><br>The one star is literally from the last 30 minutes we were stuck here waiting for our bill to be correct. I&#39;ve waited tables for years so I know I&#39;m not being a bad person when I say this could have all been avoided with one simple sentence; together or separate checks? <br><br>Kind of a bummer evening for my roommates bday dinner and the poor waitress that was almost in tears over something so easy. It was literally written on the check whose card to charge.<br><br>Such a disappointment.

We got here in a big group on the weekend so it really took time to sit on the table &amp; ordering. Everything got delayed here since they were too busy. This place is good for big group hang in out since they have big menu with different things. The drink menu &amp; the dessert as cheese cake are most popular here. The food here are variety for different taste &amp; different culture but everything is so so not for the best. I got my mushroom pasta which is too creamy for me. I didn&#39;t expect it in the best way right at beginning but our cheese cake are delicious.
We waited 45 minutes to get a table, and service was super slow ! It wasn&#39;t even that crowded and literally took 40 minutes for our salad to come out. Best to get carry out.

Called at 10a to try and make a reservation, since it says on yelp and online that they open at 10a.<br>Girl says oh we only make reservation the first 40min after we open and weve been open since 9a.<br>Update your info on yelp and online please

Horrifying! The worst imaginable service ever and we ordered take out!! 5:23 was when the order was sent in and confirmed by email. 9:30 is when we were able to sit down with old cold trays of our order that no one for the first 2 hours had any notion of. Disgusting, utterly ridiculous
Always my favorite go to! Staff is friendly and professional. Continued to check and refill our drinks without having to ask.
Customer service a little off and could have been better but with Covid who knows how staff is adjusting or being trained

My mom eats at this location often, and I probably come 2-3 times a year. My food has always been really  good, and I&#39;ve never had bad service. But I&#39;m giving a 5 star review because yesterday we had the best service I&#39;ve ever had, anywhere! Our server Brandy was pleasant, and very patient with our indecision. She&#39;s very knowledgeable about the menu, and accommodated our requests like a rock star! My mom and I have both worked in the service industry our whole lives, and we agree that Brandy is top notch, A+. We look forward to seeing her next time we come in.

I was a loyal customer but after today I will never go back. They are not in compliance with the government and state mandatory Covid 19 procedures at all. They are not social distancing they are not wearing masks. And when an incredibly rude guest bumped into me then stood up against my body and when I asked them ro back up 6 ft i was discri.i aged against. I then called the manager and they told me they didn&#39;t care. I have su ce reported them to the county and OSHA. Hopefully they are shut down soon and the hostesses that allowed this behavior fired for there complete ignorance. If I do get the corona virus I will be sure to sue this company for thrte complete ineptitude

We went on a Sunday afternoon and it was very busy. Waited about 30 mins to be seated for a party of 6.  Not unexpected on the weekends at this location. Our waitress was really nice, she got our drinks and bread right away. I ordered the circumvent lemonade- very sweet and refreshing. I get it every time. I also ordered the buffalo blasts and bbq ranch chicken salad. If you like buffalo sauce and Bleu cheese- you should definitely try the buffalo blast. They are perfect and so the Bleu cheese is made in house and the perfect combo of creamy and chunky. The salad is like a southwest salad with black beans, corn, avocado grilled chicken and fried onion string. I was too full for a dessert, but super satisfied with my meal. One of my favorite brunch/lunch spots.

The Cheesecake Factory is nothing if not reliable. You know exactly what to expect on a visit from the service right down to the food. <br><br>Visited late (9 pm) on a Thursday night and had good service. Was seated next to the bus station which turned out to be very distracting (servers rolling silverware, etc.). <br><br>Margaritas hit the spot (although not as good as at CF at Union Square in San Francisco!). Everyone&#39;s meals were tasty and filling (chicken enchiladas, flatbread, fettuccine, 4 cheese pasta). <br><br>Will probably be back during our visit because it&#39;s one of the few restaurants where everyone in the family can find something they love.

Ordered thru doordash for pick up.  Went to pick up, got home and we were missing the 2 cheesecakes and chocolate cake we ordered.  Called them and they they dont deliver and told us to call doordash.  So we went back to pick our desserts....got home and still wrong!! You would think they would get it right the 2nd time !!  Called them again and spoke to an ANGELA....in a condescending tone she sd...&#34;oh whats wrong sweetheart?&#34; like she was talking to a 4 yr old.  I paused and asked her why she was talking to me that way?  Then I asked for her manager...she said...&#34;oh you want to talk to another manager?&#34;  I sd no, I want to talk to someone higher than you.  So hlagter a long hold...on the phone comes Cecil...he listened and apologized. He told me I have to call doordash for a refund and that he will call them to explain the situation...at the end...all but a waste of time!  Cheesecake Factory should close!!!..poor service...food not great and people are rude and useless!  I would give you a zero if I could!
Always a pleasure dining here. When you don&#39;t know what you&#39;re in the mood for, Cheesecake Factory has a great selection.

Had the best lunch yesterday at the Green Valley location. Our waitress, Sarah was the best. She suggested the Roasted Artichoke and Garlic sauce to start us off, amazing! Her knowledge of the menu and the ability to engage with people was both helpful and comforting. We can&#39;t wait to go back.

Oh my, I lov Cheesecake Factory usually which I&#39;m so annoyed because I ordered turkey sandwich on whole wheat bread and meatloaf dinner for my mom<br>She liked the meat loaf but my expensive turkey sandwich was a major disappointment <br>I didn&#39;t want it toasted. The bread was so dry and stale it ruined the experience of my sandwich <br>My French fries were cold. <br>My moms meatloaf was warm so I know the fries had to be cold to start<br>I&#39;m so disappointed <br>I hate ordering takeout and getting home only to find that the restaurant gets away with a poor job<br>And poor quality of food <br>Wasted money big time!

Cheesecake Factory is always my go to! Their alcohol beverages are all so delicious and definitely recommend the 4 cheese pasta w/ shrimp to every and anyone! Don&#39;t even get me started with their cheesecakes especially the tiramisu one....
It is always a great choice when different people want a variety of food and flavors.  Cheesecake Factory always deliverers!  Great place!
My family and I are so happy you have finally opened.  We missed your great food and service.

You know, I always thought you can&#39;t go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory. Decent prices, good food, pretty big portions. My recent lunchtime visit proved me wrong. <br>Everyone was seated by the bar area, right next to each other, even though there was plenty of space in the restaurant. This placed us sandwiched between parties having very loud conversations without much wiggle room. Ok, fine.<br><br>Next, my date ordered the Lemon Herb roasted chicken. I ordered the mushroom burger. When we got our meals, the chicken was different than it has been in the past. Now, instead of the actual 1/2 chicken on the bone, it was chicken pieces (mostly boneless). Turns out, they&#39;d changed the recipe THAT DAY- and hadn&#39;t changed the description on the menu, nor had the server thought to inform us of the change. So he had his mouth set for something in particular and was pretty disappointed when it arrived. Moreover, he ordered the sautéed spinach as a side dish, and it came out dry and barely cooked. They did bring a new side of spinach, but weren&#39;t very apologetic about the chicken, just tried to convince him that the new recipe was better. <br><br>My burger was fine, just a small slip up as I ordered a side of honey mustard that didn&#39;t come until I asked again for it. <br><br>We did get dessert to go, and the salted caramel cheesecake was pretty good. <br><br>Side note... the Cheesecake Factory was the only place he used his credit card that day. But the next day he got a fraud report- someone used the card info to try to make a large purchase at Cartier. Definitely suspicious. <br><br>I don&#39;t know that i would return to this location.

This place is always an easy choice based off all the food options. We went here for lunch during the week and were seated promptly, greeted soon after and drinks and bread were on the table within minutes. <br><br>Our waitress and I&#39;ll leave her name out in fear <br> of being incorrect reeked of pot... I can&#39;t say that she was high or smoked but I am saying she smelled... I noticed it sitting all the way in the booth. However I am pregnant, so EVERYTHING is heightened.. not to make matters worse but 2 of the 3 of us were pregnant so I wasn&#39;t nuts the whole table made a comment and just breathed through our mouth when she came by. <br><br>We eventually said something in a lighter tone and she and played off the smell blaming this nice bald waiter but we knew it was her so it made it really unappetizing to eat our food. <br><br>I will day I had the spicy chicken tacos and they were adorable! The only suggestion I&#39;d made it tone it down on the cilantro in the rice, but that&#39;s completely preference. <br><br>I&#39;d definitely go back because the food it great and well I&#39;ve never met a piece of cheesecake I didn&#39;t get along with.

It is really hard to find any better happy hour in Vegas other that Cheesecake Factory. Even though their items recently increased from $5.95 to $6.50 it is still a great deal. Lasting for only 2 hours and in the bar area only where you can sit at the bar, one of 5 or 6 high tops, one of 5 or 6 tables and even the patio.  All items are $6.50 and we are talking full size appetizers not small portion appetizers that many restaurants give you at a reduced priced and call it a happy hour. They offer 5 or 6 specialty cocktails and most beer and wine.  Also about 15 of their most popular appetizers again at $6.5 and full size regular menu portions.  You really can&#39;t go wrong. Also they start you out with some great fresh made bread and butter that never ends if you wish.<br>Service for the most part it usually pretty good. We have probably been to this and the rampart location 30-40 times over the years only for happy hour and suggest showing up at 4pm for a table with usually no wait.<br>The 3 Amigos

When we arrived, I requested a table for 3, and specifically asked for a table, not a booth. My dad is in a wheelchair and needed to stay in it and just move a chair. We were told there would be about a 20 minute wait. So about that time passes and our pager buzzes, so no problem with initial wait time, except we were taken to a booth. They apologize and were very accommodating and fixed the problem within about 10 minutes. As apologetic as they were, this made our wait time about 40 minutes total and I was specific with my request for a table in the first place. <br>Our appetizer was out almost immediately after ordering, but entrees took quite a while. It was a Saturday night and they were pretty busy, so understandable to a point.<br>I ordered pizza and half the pizza was soggy. I couldn&#39;t eat it. Also described as a &#34;flatbread&#34; pizza and the crust was very thick. Wasn&#39;t too impressed.<br>All of this and I still would have probably given 4-4.5 stars, except as I am leaving the restroom while we&#39;re getting ready to leave I hear a waitress loudly complain, &#34;I like how this guy in a wheelchair passes me and says &#39;excuse me!&#39; &#34; <br>I know my dad, and I&#39;m sure he did say excuse me. He would not have said it rudely, he probably said it loudly because it was VERY loud with music and lots of people. He did not ask to be in a wheelchair nor is he in it because he&#39;s lazy. While I understand in a fast paced restaurant like that, waiting is probably stressful and any obstacle or something that throws off your groove is frustrating,  but that was extremely offensive. You never know who is in ear shot so I&#39;d advise management to bring this to their wait staffs attention. <br>That said, the manager was extremely apologetic with the initial table issue, our waiter was great considering how busy they were, and both my dad and his wife were very happy with their meals.
I tried several main courses and they never failed to please. Great cooks, great service, great experience. The Cheesecake Factory is a signature for time and money well spent!

I love this restaurant and the service inside is fine but take out is horrible! I&#39;ve had many issues with being put on hold for 10 minutes and my order is wrong 90% of the time. I&#39;ve started going inside and checking my order before I leave, so I can ask for the items they forgot. (Every time!) It&#39;s annoying because they offer curb side takeout but when they forget stuff, you have to wait for them to go back inside and get it. <br><br>If I was rating the food, I would give them 5 stars but since I order takeout 95% off the time, my rating is based on the takeout service, which is lacking. <br><br>They get super busy, pretty much every day of the week, so be prepared for a wait. They are open until midnight on the weekend and it&#39;s way less busy around 10pm.
I absolutely love the service cleanliness and all around atmosphere of this place during quarantine re opening they are top notch and the raspberry cheesecake is to die for

This place never falls short, always perfect, my family and I love it here. The food, service, atmosphere and the cheese cake of course is fantastic every time. <br>Five thumbs up <br>I would suggest going anytime of the week.

Buyer beware! Never recall an in-restaurant problem over the years at this nearby restaurant, however take-out food leaves excessive room for improvements. Wanting a late afternoon light meal, we ordered 2 Renee&#39; specials for takeout and highly disappointed. Sandwich breads were excessively hard, meats ordered inside extremely skimpy, and salads were a fraction of sizes ordered tableside. Soup bowls were not even 1/2 filled, but placed on bottom of delivery bag with nicer sandwich/salad packaging placed on top. Both bowls leaked and why place on bottom below heavier items? Despite nearby residence, soups were marginally warm, certainly not hot whenever packaging occurred. Very disappointing for prices paid, will not be ordering takeout from this establishment, but look forward to restaurant reopening in near future. Service and delivery to curbside was very acceptable, and friendly/courteous, just lousy food and packaging.

Placed an order on the website at 11:42. Website said it would be ready at 12:02. Got there at 12:05. Told the server our name. We were told to wait in the parking lot and wait for a text. No text ever came through. Server came to check on us a couple times and kept asking the kitchen if there was an order for us. Half an hour later he came back with our food. He apologized. Said they had it under our last name. Which by the way we gave them both first and last name. Called to speak with the manager. He was rather unapologetic and somewhat condescending. He just made excuses for the poor service. Disappointing reaction. Disappointing service.

I don&#39;t know what it is about this place, but Cheesecake Factory just seems to always be on point. No matter if it&#39;s this location or any other location across the country, Cheesecake Factory is just consistent and delicious. <br><br>This place is pretty much a great restaurant that caters to all. You come here and always see large groups of families, especially little ones. If you come for lunch, this seems to be the spot for moms/wife&#39;s lunch dates with their friends. High school kids date nights. Or, for myself, just your casual Friday night date spot with the girlfriend.<br><br>There is always a line here and usually always a wait. However, it&#39;s so big and they have such a big staff and kitchen, the wait is never that long.<br><br>The food here seems to always hit the spot. They have something for every taste bud. Not the greatest, but they a pretty good job for every kind of dish for a place that doesn&#39;t specialize in one thing. The portions are huge.<br><br>Some of my favorites are:<br><br>Red Sangria<br>Chinese Chicken Salad<br>Salmon Kale Salad<br>Beet and Goat Cheese<br>Pear Goat cheese flatbread (substitute blue cheese for goat cheese - thank me later)<br>Chicken Nachos<br>Chicken Gyoza <br>Bang Bang Shrimp and Chicken<br>Orange Chicken<br>Spicy Cashew Chicken<br>Egg rolls <br>And of course - the cheesecake<br><br>Just overall a great spot.

Came in with my husband around 6 on a Monday. It was not the busy but the hostess took our name. I noticed she was giving everyone else buzzers. I came back up to tell her we did not receive a buzzer. She assured me it would not be a problem. We waited 20 minutes and 4 other parties that came after us were seated before us. We had asked for a larger table, but they ended up giving it to two other people who came after us. <br>The service was prompt with taking our order but the food was painfully slow coming out, I know it&#39;s not the servers fault but time wise it was unreasonable. <br>I asked for buffalo sauce and blue cheese three times. We actually ordered food to go for our kids which came out before our meal did. <br>I did leave a note for the manager to call me, since we were already here for two hours. No phone call or any type of communication. The service has really gone down hill which is really sad, because it was our go to.

So let me start by saying we are HUGE fans of the Cheesecake Factory ! They have amazing Food with a great all around selection of dishes , desserts and appetizers!! We have been going here since it has opened and in no way will we stop going and or want anyone reading this to be discouraged of going as well !! <br><br>Tonight we decided to go during HAPPY HOUR to have a couple drinks, dinner and spend some time together as a couple ! Our service was an issue from the start with a very slow start ! We ordered our drinks and something was floating in my wife&#39;s drink and we asked for another one ! We watched very closely to ensure that she received a fresh drink and this time the glass was dirty ! Third one was the charm although she really on drank one drink !! My beer on the other was tasty but and hour later finally received my second ! <br><br>The waitress was nice and we did give her some feedback and I must say she had enough courage to tell her manager without us asking ! The first manager approached us and was full of excuses from the start blaming Happy Hour - For real , you have happy hour the same time everyday and a manager should never Make Excuses !! They had 2 bartenders three servers and a manager with less than 50 people to wait on ! Later on in the evening Dawn , another manager came to our table and took full responsibility and apologized 100% with no excuses giving us a 6.00 discount ! We were not looking for anything but I must say overall a disappointing experience this time around !!

I&#39;m a huge fan of The Cheesecake Factory! My boyfriend and I chose to go at around 6:30pm on a Wednesday, and the wait was like 30 minutes. We ended up scoping out a high table and swooping in. The waitress (wish I remembered her name) was super friendly and available. When I asked for lemons for my water, she brought a full saucer! As far as food, we ordered from the Skinnylicious menu. He got the salmon, and I got the chicken taquitos. I didn&#39;t try his, but he was happy with it. I loved the taquitos; not only were they only $5.95, but they were quite flavorful. I&#39;d say it was a successful dinner! :-)<br><br>Tip: If you&#39;ve never been here and hate deciding from a large menu, you will be overwhelmed. If you like a lot of options and delicious cheesecake, this is a must!

Cheesecake wAs good but that the host was absolutely rude . She showed no interest in us last night . She didn&#39;t say hello or welcome and rushed us to the table and then argued with us over what table we wanted. Terrible service ! She had long black hair and was short.  We almost left . Waitress was very nice though and we always enjoy our meal.  <br>Update . We did talk to the manager while we were there and he apologized and said the host had previously been called rude. He didn&#39;t make any other comments or make sure we left happy .
This place has the best for cheese cake, although it seems like there slices are getting smaller and prices are high for a slice.

We met up with my Mother-in-Law, as it was convenient. This was a first for me, as I have never been to The Cheesecake Factory. We were here at around 11am, and I had already decided on getting breakfast. Of course, on display as you walk in are all of their amazing looking cheesecakes. I was &#39;this&#39; close to just saying &#39;forget the breakfast, bring on the cheesecake!!!&#39;.<br><br>Our waiter was awesome, and very professional. He was not wearing a nametag, but he must be the tallest guy there. I ordered an Eggs Benedict with regular bacon, as I always do, and my husband go the Spicy Chicken Sandwich. What I loved about both of these is that the condiments were in small bowls on the plates, rather than dealing with messy ketchup bottles. The lettuce and tomato for the sandwich were off to the side, so they stayed nice and cold. Nice touch. My bacon was not super crispy, but overall the benedict was pretty good. <br><br>We had no room for a cheesecake, but saw the monstrosity that the couple next to us got. It was enormous!!! But they finished it. Ha ha. Next time I think that I will come here just for a  piece of cheesecake. The problem will be deciding which one.

The Cheesecake Factory is one of my family&#39;s go-to restaurants, whether it be for dinner on the weekend or when we&#39;re celebrating a special occasion. The menu at The Cheesecake Factory is very extensive, a bit overwhelming at that! With the menu consisting of just about 20 pages, everyone is bound to find something they&#39;ll enjoy. The food is consistent, always fresh, and the portions are ridiculously huge. I always have leftovers for lunch the next day!<br><br>A few of my favorite dishes include the Barbeque Ranch Chicken Salad and the Crispy Chicken Costoletta. <br><br>If you have room, there are over 50 cheesecakes and various desserts to choose from! We normally come to an agreement (which can be hard) and share a slice! Seriously, after a meal here, a slice of cheesecake will push you to the edge.<br><br>During our most recent visit, we received the most outstanding service from Aiden! He was on his A-game from start to finish, exceptional to say the least. He was very informative when we had questions about items on the menu and even recommended a few of his favorites! Aiden was constantly checking up on my family and always made sure that our waters (and bread basket) were filled. Not to mention, he can really carry a tune! We were very impressed! Thank you, Aiden!<br><br>Now, if only it wasn&#39;t so dark inside the restaurant! The ambience is nice, don&#39;t get me wrong, but I wish the lighting wasn&#39;t so dim! There was a single light shining down from the high ceiling in the middle of our table, and everyone was taking turns using it to read the menu. I know, it sounds ridiculous, but it&#39;s true. With the sun going down sooner in the day, there&#39;s not much natural light left to come through the windows before dinnertime.<br><br>Overall, great location, great service, and most importantly, great food!

My most recent visit since last year was two nights ago with my line sister! She invited me to eat Cheesecake Factory because she was craving it and staring at the menu while she was studying. So we ended up going there after my shift at work.<br><br>Friday night. Busy night. We pull up and everyone&#39;s waiting to get seated. A whole bunch of parties ahead of us, but there were only 2 of us so the wait was about 30 minutes. Not bad. We waited. Got seated. On a tiny tiny table.<br><br>Our server was quick and attentive. His name was Sayem or Sam I think? I&#39;m not too sure but he&#39;s indian. I think..... Anyway, good thing we shared appetizers! We got four different plates. A house salad with mixed greens, cucumber, tomatoes, and balsamic vinaigrette. Fried Mac &#39;N Cheese balls--macaroni put into a ball, deep fried, with creamy marinara and parmesan cheese sauce. Fried calamari (self explanatory)--however it&#39;s paired with cocktail sauce (I prefer marinara). Buffalo blasts-- chicken marinated in buffalo sauce wrapped in a wonton and deep fried. However, ours was SO breaded and there was literally a tiny bit of chicken in there...... <br><br>Overall, our server made the experience an awesome one! :) Ask for him!

I really appreciate cheesecake factory for what it is...they&#39;ve got a broad menu, and despite how broad it is, the food tastes good. I&#39;ve had my fair share of items over the years, and there&#39;s always something for someone. What keeps me coming back are the BUFFALO BLASTS. <br><br>I&#39;ve since tried a couple items I&#39;ve never had, such as the loaded tater tots. Not the typical tater tots, and they were good!<br><br>My fave part about cheesecake factory is, no matter which location, the food is consistent. It tastes the same EVERY TIME i&#39;ve gone. <br><br>And who doesn&#39;t love free bread. I love the brown bread.

One of my favorite places to come for lunch or dinner! Great long menu! If you&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory you know the menu! This time I had Chicken Collete, Oh My it was so yummy. The lemon sauce is perfect! Great portions, come hungry! I have not had a bad meal and I try something different each time! Friendly and great service. I like sitting at the bar! The Grey Goose dirty martinis with stuffed blue cheese olives, so delicious! Check it out! Get there early, always packed!

Same old same old. Loved this place 20 years ago. It always tastes great but we&#39;ve learned to eat entrees and appetizers that are not sweet and loaded with sugar. So, though its always delicious we&#39;ve found that by desert time we just really don&#39;t need more sweets! So we pass. <br>This is still a very popular option for us and many others. Service is usually above average. Portions are usually quite generous though smaller than in years past.

This place is review proof but it&#39;s worth saying this particular location in Green Valley is consistently above average. It&#39;s always busy but we are consistently seated in less time then we&#39;ve been told. We&#39;ve dined there at least ten times and every time is a positive experience. It&#39;s like the &#34;Cheers&#34; of restaurants. The servers are friendly, warm and professional and they always go out of their way to make sure you are having a positive experience. Outside dining while the weather is still cool is the best. The food is always good, perfectly cooked, flavorful and plentiful no matter what you order. Though I have been there many times I&#39;ve never had the Cheesecake or any of their desserts. Please note I gave 5 stars in context to the type of restaurant it is.

I mean if you have a thing for Cheesecake, you go to the factory! I never had bad Cheesecake from here. The atmosphere is quite romantic, at dinner time, you don&#39;t have to worry about seeing the real face of your date, cuz the light is really low, guarantee anything would look better in that lighting they set up for ya. <br><br>The food is also pretty good, huge portion!! I can&#39;t never finished my food. Cheese bread appetizer for $9 is ridiculous when I comes in 6 pieces and the cheese doesn&#39;t even melted all the way. I expected more from $9 appetizer. <br><br>Big parking lot with specific 15 mins parking spot for pick up order.

I love Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s by far my favorite place to go, especially with the family since there is so much variety to choose from. I usually end up getting appetizers as meals every time I go. This time was no different except I added a cup of clam chowder to it. Oh man, that clam chowder was amazing. And filling! I could hardly finish my other food. I got nachos, sweet corn tamale cakes along with the mix of egg rolls (sorry, no picture). Avocado, Cuban, chicken southwest and the salmon one. In my opinion all tasted great except for the Cuban one, didn&#39;t care for the ham flavor in it. I just wasn&#39;t a big fan of it. Everything else, amazing. This place will always be a favorite of mine.

Absolutely horrible experience tonight. The kitchen was horribly slow and we waited over an hour for our 4 meals. Mine came out cold and my pops was 15 minutes behind the other 3. The waitress tells us the manager was going to take care of Pop&#39;s meal. Well, I guess pointing out that mine was cold meant my Pops now is forgotten about. My meal, which I didn&#39;t eat, was taken off the bill, and Pops just had to finish his meal alone.

Food was good, atmosphere was ok, but the Service was terrific!<br>Some waiters really get it. Server &#34;Tom&#34; had perfect timing, and was very helpful. The reason I am giving this a 5 star review is primarily because of the service.
The best of the best!  Great food, great service and great atmosphere. Our last 2 trips they placed us in cramped spots but everything else was great.

Poor service waiter went missing for 10 mins didn&#39;t get any steak knifes or salt or pepper had to get up and get salt and pepper from another table didn&#39;t enjoy my steak Diane. Should of went to  tcf in Summerlin smh

Went during week day dinner hour and was seated fairly quickly.<br><br>Had the Parmesan Chicken - pizza style. VERY good. <br><br>The beading on the chicken was nice and crunchy while the chicken was tender and juicy. Angel hair pasta covered the top rolled into a semi-compact &#34;bun&#34; that was easily spread out an onto the edges of the pizza style &#34;crust&#34; (breaded chicken).<br><br>The pasta had just the right amount of alfredo sauce. Underneath that was hints of pasta sauce for that &#34;pizza&#34; effect. Yes, they did mix well. The dish was heated just right and one bite led to another.<br><br>Had a slice of lemon-raspberry cheese cake. Although I usually prefer any one of several other flavors I took a chance on this one and was pleasantly surprised with the balanced taste.<br><br>Yes, warm bread was served as expected and tasted fresh as usual.<br><br>Service was good as usual even when the section I was sitting in became more and more busy as I was eating.<br><br>Another poster mentioned one of my initial concerns involving the &#34;massive menu&#34; - too many items to choose from. Easy to get lost in the menu while worrying about food quality. However, as I stated, my main dish was tops in taste.<br><br>Just had water, but due to the great meal I left wanting more.<br><br>Great job Cheesecake Factory!

I called when I arrived for curbside pickup. They said it would be right out. Several other ppl arrived and either had their food brought to them or went in and got theirs. I finally went in and my food was just sitting there. Apparently they were never planning to bring it out. Waste of my time so 1 star sucka

The Cheesecake Factory is an excellent choice whenever you&#39;re not quite sure what you have a taste for.   Every location seems to be as popular as the next and there&#39;s almost always a wait. However, it&#39;s always well worth the wait.  We arrived and it seemed as if the parking lot was completely full. Upon entering, we were told there would be a 10 minute wait. This was perfect, a 10 minute wait gives an opportunity for winding down just prior to your meal.<br><br>The hostesses Michelle and Kelli greeted us with a huge smile&#39;s and we&#39;re very cordial.  After about five minutes of waiting our name was called and we were seated.  Our waiter, Todd was nothing short of amazing.  We didn&#39;t have drinks however ordered right away.  I was considering something different so I tried the Shepherds Pie. Yum Yum!  My friend had Shelia&#39;s Chicken and Avocado Salad.  Both meals were absolutely amazing. I can hardly wait to try the Shepherds Pie again.<br><br>This location is just outside Las Vegas (The District), is tucked away nicely and I encourage everyone to try it.

Formerly a restaurant that could be trusted to provide decent, if not good food. My dinner last night, a Santa Fe Salad was wilted and unappetizing, entirely unpleasant, lacked the chicken element, the dressing they used was disgustingly sweet and rendered the entire meal virtually inedible. The bread and butter was good and our server was sweet, thoughtful and professional. With all the restaurants to patronize in Henderson, I wouldn&#39;t waste my time or another dime on this place. I think they are over-rated as it is and that includes their namesake product. I am aware this is not a fine dining restaurant and is really more of a TGIF or Applebee&#39;s type of low end establishment, but I have had meals at other CCF locations that were better than this by far. I will not return.

Came here for our mom&#39;s 75th birthday. Chris, our server was very nice and attentive. After eating, we have no more room for dessert but he came with a little dessert with a candle, just so we could sing happy birthday and my mom can blow her candle. Would definitely come back. I hope we get Chris again :)

First time here. Atmosphere is great. Girls working host stand looked bored and not interested in helping us. Our waitress also had the personality of a brick wall; basically just took order and brought food. After ordering she came back and told us the kitchen ran out of what we had ordered, threw a menu on the table and was like &#34;order something else&#34;. The entire wait staff seemed very rushed and unattentive. <br>The food was pretty good. Flavorful and good presentation.

We don&#39;t order out as much as we used to but I&#39;m super impressed with the customer service and smooth operations of the Cheesecake Factory &#34;Curb To Go&#34; and crew at The Green valley location. <br><br>Anthony makes us feel like V.I.P&#39;s and goes above and beyond each and every time we order, even when they are full.  <br><br>Great Job Anthony!!

I know that this is VERY popular and is generally packed! I am not a huge fan, but go with my friends as they like it. I had the chicken Cajun pasta. It was ok but nothing to write home about... seasoned well, but was a bit dry. Ordered the carrot cake to go and it was amazing.
It is Always a pleasure coming to this location . Food is delicious and service is on point .

Wow. Very large server in a leopard tie was shaming a mother for breast feeding her child while in her booth. I guess he thought he was not in ear shot of anyone but his deep voice echoed and bothered me. Suggesting she feed her baby in a bathroom? That&#39;s even worse considering public bathrooms are covered in germs. Will not be back. If he talks like that about a guest and I could hear?? What else does he say about his tables ?! <br><br> No more Cheesecake Factory for me.. I&#39;ll have to learn to back at home now.

Husband ordered the Tacos. I had the Eggplant Parmesan. Oh My Goodness it was a huge portion and very tasty. I could not finish it! It was like eating a lasagna without meat. Very well put together. <br><br>Didn&#39;t take photos of the desserts because we took it to go. They were equally as delicious.

So I pretty much dine here every other morning,noon,or night. I know all of the employees and have tasted just about everything on the menu. What can I say.... Consistency and quality will always keep your customers coming back. --It&#39;ll keep the lights on in your establishment as well.

I want to thank luis in the front for taking time to find my wallet outside . I cant thank him enough ! Very honest worker . And for our server . I didnt get her name but we were in the far left corner booth . The last booth ! Thank you very much for making us feel at home . We will be coming back !

Loved the Mexican lettuce cups, but other than that it&#39;s just like your typical Cheesecake Factory. Chain restaurant; nothing special. The service was nuts this night because it was half off cheesecake. So I gave them an extra star for that. They stayed positive and eventually all of our food showed up. Cheesecake was smaller than average that night and my family wasn&#39;t too pleased about that. It was a fine experience. Nothing to write home about.

Wanted to thank Mike for making it right! In midst of all the chaos that&#39;s going on due to the Coronavirus pandemic, the manager Mike at this Cheesecake Factory location turned what was originally a frustrating situation into a 5 STAR experience. In short, we ordered curbside pickup, only to get home and the order wasn&#39;t correct. Missing items and cold food, more than likely because of the demand during the Coronavirus crisis. I called to the restaurant and spoke to the manager on duty Mike and he apologized several times for the error. He offered to remake the food and assured that it would be delivered curbside hot and fresh. It was just that!!! More importantly, Mike delivered our order to our car himself!!!! Professional and topnotch service Mike! Thank you so much! 5 STAR SERVICE!!!!
I love there cheesecakes . I came for a light meal. I&#39;m always happy with the food. The service is always a bit slow. Over all the cheesecakes have me coming back for more.

Everyone knows Cheesecake Factory.  You are going to find an extensive menu and you&#39;ll have to decide what you are in the mood to eat.<br><br>Depending on the day and time, you may have a wait.  Attempted to go here on a discount cheesecake night and the expected wait was 45 minutes to an hour.  I&#39;m not sure how long it was because we bailed after 20 minutes.<br><br>Back to the last time my family and I ate here this past week.  The food looks amazing.  (See my pictures). The taste is OK.  The side salad was supposed to have balsamic dressing and I tasted none, so I left it.  The chicken salad sandwich is delicious!  Should have gotten the full size instead of the lunch special, as the soup was also only OK.<br><br>The men in my family enjoyed their burgers, which was big enough for my teen to also have for dinner.  Daughter liked, not loved, her grilled cheese.

Love this restaurant!! Food is to die for. The staff is friendly and nice and accommodating. This is my favorite location. I drive past 2 Cheesecake factories to get to this one but it&#39;s so worth it! :)

Cheesecake Factory is one of the few chains that I not only like, but I think is pretty good.<br><br>This location is conveniently located inside The District. It&#39;s on the opposite side from most of the shopping so parking is easy. Just like most of their locations they have an enormous amount of seating and outdoor seating as well. The patio is a nice option when the weather is nice.<br><br>The menu has a large amount of options and a large variety of options as well. There should be something here to please everyone. I like that a group could come in and order completely different foods. Surprisingly, everything I&#39;ve had is really good. They are one of the few places that can pull off a large menu without sacrificing taste. The portions are always big enough to make into two meals. I love fun lunch leftovers.<br><br>This is one of the few restaurants that make it easy for someone on a diet if you aren&#39;t looking to treat yourself. The Skinnylicious menu has some great options and the calories are listed on the menu. They couldn&#39;t make it easier for someone counting calories.<br><br>The cheesecake lives up to the hype and just like the regular menu there are a ridiculous amount of options. My favorite is the Lemon Raspberry Cream Cheesecake. <br><br>Pricing is reasonable for the portion sizes. As I mentioned, most entrees are big enough to be two or three servings for the average person.<br><br>I&#39;ve been to this location many times and service has always been great. Despite the fact that they are always busy it never takes long to get food and drinks are refilled promptly.

My wife and I live in Las Vegas and went to this location at 3:30 to eat outside since the weather was warm. As we approached the restaurant, we saw people sitting outside and thought, Great! We go inside and ask to be seated outside and the hostess said we couldn&#39;t sit outside because they didn&#39;t have any servers. I said there were actually people sitting outside eating and asked why we couldn&#39;t. She replied, well, we don&#39;t have enough servers. As you you can probably tell, this is very annoying and makes us not want to return. I would suggest you staff appropriately or stop picking and choosing who sits outside, especially when people are already out there. Insane!
Take advantage of their happy hour. Servings are just as same with the regular entrees. <br><br>Must try! Avocado egg rolls, burger sliders, nachos, buffalo style chicken.
Great location in the District...they have some great cocktails! Always has a good crowd...menu has lots of variety...you&#39;ll find something good.

They don&#39;t take reservations for over 6 people. I don&#39;t see the point in even accepting reservations if large parties are not allowed. They were pretty upset and gave us a hard time when I showed up and told them that I had 7 people, not 6. They made us wait and then squeezed us all into a booth with a chair off the end, sitting in the walkway. Food was good but nothing special for what the prices are. We will not be back.

My daughter and I  went in a week ago to have dinner and celebrate her birthday. Upon arrival, the tattoo-covered red lips hostess didn&#39;t seem to be having a very good evening, and we were just a distraction to whatever she was glaring at in front of her. After what felt like an eternity, she looked up from the glare...no acknowledgment, no greeting, just &#34;how many&#34; in a very snippy and curt manner. For fear of being banished, we waited in the direction of a corner where her finger pointed us to.  Once seated, there were no pleasantries &#34;enjoy your dinner&#34; or &#34;your server will be right with you...&#34; just a menu handoff and we waited for the next round.<br><br>Then our server Shannon picked up right where tattoo-girl left off.  No welcome, no happy, just &#34;what are you drinking?&#34;  I replied &#34;nothing at the moment&#34; which she didn&#39;t find amusing.  I was trying to keep it light but we&#39;re already in a tailspin. Once we ordered, we never saw Shannon again.  She would do a fly by but never stopped.  One meal was wrong, the other cold, our drinks sat empty most of the time (iced tea &amp; water, no bar items) and by the time everything was corrected, the evening had lost its fun.  Even our cheesecake was wrong! <br><br>I love this restaurant, their food, the management and most of the servers.  Usually this location is a five star but that night, it was way off.  And that WASN&#39;T the first poor experience I&#39;ve had with Shannon.  So...when you go in and get Shannon as your server, be prepared for a not-so-great experience.  This way you won&#39;t be disappointed.  You now have that knowledge.  Oh...and don&#39;t stare directly into the eyes of the tattoo-hostess-girl.  She&#39;s a bit scary.

Guest service left a comment stating they wanted to speak about the issue further and to go to their website(which I went into more detail about situation above), almost a month ago and still haven&#39;t received a reply...

It&#39;s honestly like 60 degrees in this restaurant and everyone we know says the same, it&#39;s super cold so bring a jacket to eat here. We asked if they could turn up the temp a bit and they told us we could go sit outside.... (where it&#39;s 110 degrees?). Also there is NO cell reception or service in this location (we had At&amp;t, T-Mobile and Sprint) and they don&#39;t have Wifi... what restaurant does not offer WiFi to their customers in this day and age? It&#39;s a $100 expense for the restaurant per month to make sure costumers have a way to have lunch meetings or calls, emails or whatever.<br><br>Food is good as with every cheesecake fact.

Cheesecake Factory is my favorite. I do, however, get really overwhelmed with the amount of pages there are on their menu. But that&#39;s just more options!<br><br>I like ordering appetizers cus I can get full off those rather quickly. My absolute favorite is the loaded baked potato tots. It&#39;s exactly what it&#39;s called and the flavor is delicious! I also like ordering the egg roll sampler -- because I can&#39;t choose just one type of egg roll lol. <br><br>When I&#39;m on my lunch break with co-workers, we sit at the bar and get quick service. The lunch specials are amazing and so are the prices. I love the crusted Chicken Romano lunch special! <br><br>On a normal visit with no time restraints, we get seated anywhere. The most recent time, our server, Sayem, took really good care of us. He had a lot of recommendations and was very friendly. He even had some staff sing to my friend for her birthday! Now that&#39;s customer service! <br><br>Now for the best part: dessert. Anything is delicious, really. I like the lemon merengue cheesecake, Oreo dream extreme cheesecake, the snickers cheesecake, even the original is yummy! But you have to remember to save room for dessert!

Ronny and Phillip are excellent waiters. Very friendly. The food here is always consistent. No matter how busy it is this restaurant is able to get your food out hot, fresh, and fast. <br><br>They always cook their steaks right the first time which I really appreciate. <br><br>Highly recommend this location and restaurant if you are looking for large selection of dishes and cheesecakes

Had dinner this evening at bar area, ordered the Seared Tuna Titaki Salad it was amazing, also tried the Mango Keylime cheesecake which was so delicious! Kevin at the bar was very friendly great customer service! Will be back soon!!!

Best thing about Cheesecake Factory is that the variety their menu is so big that there is a very good chance that you will find something you will like. The last few times we have come here it seems the server takes a long time to take our order but once they get it things go by pretty fast. Our food was delicious and prepared to our request and the staff friendly.

Could it be this restaurant has reached a &#34;level&#34; where they can admonish their customers for arriving a little early to pick up their order?  Excuse me the &#34;system doesn&#39;t recognize me&#34; because I arrived 15 min. I shouldn&#39;t have had that welcoming or the attitude. I would have understood &#34;the order is almost ready if you could kindly wait &#34;. But, no.   <br>Not only that, but I parked at the parking slot for curbside where you call, pay, and then they come out to bring your order. They never answered. <br>I drove out of my way to get a cheesecake from the &#34;cheesecake factory&#34;. But in the future, I will think twice about it.

If you&#39;re willing to come to The Cheesecake Factory for a bite to eat one day, coming during Happy Hour is a must! It&#39;s from 4-6 PM every weekday and it&#39;s half-off alcoholic drinks and select appetizers.<br>My two friends and I came here during Happy Hour and we were expecting it to be a little busy, but it really wasn&#39;t once we walked in...of course it&#39;s a Wednesday afternoon.<br>I tried the fried Mac and Cheese, which was excellent, along with a $5.95 margarita. What a deal that was. I&#39;m glad I came during Happy Hour.

Food was excellent as always. As far as the staff goes I was very disappointed. My son ordered lunch sand soup and salad. We asked what the soup of the day was and we were told it was potato. Well I wanted to try it and turns out it was clam chowder. I am allergic to seafood fish ECT. We informed our server of the situation . A manger never stopped by so either he said nothing or manger didn&#39;t care enough to stop by. My mouth was swelling and burning also had blisters in my mouth. We had to pack everything and leave in hurry. <br>Cheesecake factory is one of my favorite places eat

Not impressed with this place.  Two stars is generous.<br><br>First of all we ordered a large ($300+) take-out order for a client online.  We went in 45m early to dine in on something small beforehand and when we inquired about the take-out order it took them 25m to find it so then it wasn&#39;t ready on-time.  I wonder how late it would have been if we hadn&#39;t gone in early.<br><br>Second, the cleanliness of the restaurant was C+ at best.  We were there when they opened and our table had a few small random pieces of food on it.  The silverware also had water spots and scum on them.  The floor under the table next to us had a big brown smear under it that I hope was chocolate.<br><br>Third the food was very salty and they hit a big pet peeve of mine which is pepper shakers where the pepper comes out at a trickle.<br><br>Fourth, and this is just a matter of taste, the music is all the whiney pitchy stuff that only appeals to a small percentage of the population.<br><br>Anyway the only save here was the attitude of the hostesses and waitstaff who were very nice.
Fish and chips are great. The coleslaw is fabulous. Jambalaya breakfast with fried egg is great.  <br><br>What would be great is if they had a Rueben.

We just ordered to go.  It was easy and fast, service was great.  I asked for a to go menu, the guy gave me the restaurant menu.    I ordered the garden salad and pizza.  Hubby loves there meatloaf.  So when we got it home, my pizza wasn&#39;t even a little warm, it was cold.  We don&#39;t live that far from this place for that pizza to be that cold, so that was a disapointment.  The salad just had tomatoes in it.  So I had to come home and doctor it up.   Yeaaaa, I wouldn&#39;t ever order this again

So my sons and I went here to eat today.<br>We got there around 4pm and had to wait for 15 minutes for service.<br>We finally ordered our food and they started to bring out the food<br>We started eating what they had brought out but they forgot to bring thinks out like my sons French fries and of course my food.<br>I did not receive my food until we where finished with the food that they had brought out<br>I ate some of my sons food while I waited for mines but as I said I did not get my food until we was finish <br>The sad part was they where going to charge me for that food until I talked to the manager <br>It&#39;s so sad that they made a mistake for not bring out my order and still going to charge me

This is my second time at this location, and definitely not the last. The Cheesecake Factory is my FAVORITE restaurant, I am always at the location in Los Angeles which is where I&#39;m from. <br><br>Since it was a Friday night it was about a 30-minute wait and I got there around 6:15 PM. There were a lot of parties waiting - for graduations, and also it&#39;s Father&#39;s Day weekend. The 30 minutes went by quick though, as I was looking through the menu and picking out a cheesecake to order for dessert in their display. 30 minutes is such a nice waiting time, and didn&#39;t seem that long especially because the one I go to in LA has a wait time that goes almost 2 hours! It&#39;s crazy. <br><br>I ordered a strawberry lemonade with a Chicken Marsala with Mushrooms - it was in a wine sauce with bow tie pasta around it! It was delicious and I loved the plating. My uncle got the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta with shrimp and chicken and it was so yummy. Not too spicy at all!<br><br>We also ordered the carrot cake cheesecake. I liked it. I&#39;ve tried almost every cheesecake and this just crosses it off my list! Took two bites and had to take it to go because I was too full. <br><br>Our waiter Brittany was very attentive and nice and checked up on us! Definitely a plus when waiters/waitresses come and check on us every so often rather than waiting for one to come by. <br><br>Wish it wasn&#39;t so hot outside, maybe next time I&#39;ll sit outside and enjoy the view! (And all the cars driving by lol).

This is one of my favorite locations, but today&#39;s visit was horrible. <br>The host sat my fiance and I on the patio in a section that was not assigned to any server. <br>It took 20 minutes for us to be served and I was charged full price for a lunch portion of pasta. <br><br>I will always love CCF, but not this location.

I am not sure how much more they can &#34;down-size&#34; the slices. I have ritualistically eaten the tiramisu cheesecake for years and never when I ate a slice, was there more whip cream on the plate than actual cheesecake. It is more than disappointing to order slices to go and get home and wonder what happened to the other half of my slice. If this is the future slice size, I will be ordering juniors to ship from NY. What a let down. The only reason I am giving the second star is because the flavor is always delicious and consistent but not worth the price when I open the box to this.

Went here for dinner with 15+ family members and everyone was super happy with the experience. We ate outside (in October) so the temperature was great, a little cold as the night went on but they had heaters which made it very comfortable. I think a couple of the guys sitting directly in front of the heaters mentioned being a little hot...but as a female who is prone to cold it was perfect!<br><br>The server was amazing - very engaging and attentive, I always had a full drink and the bread kept on coming throughout the night. The bread is my absolute favorite...I made a conscious decision to get a salad so I could eat as much bread as I wanted and not feel (too) bad about it. <br><br>I ordered the Caesar Salad with Chicken and it was amazing. The chicken was real, fresh, grilled and seasoned chicken breast (as opposed to pre-cut pre-cooked chicken slices that most places use) and the lettuce / dressing was perfect. Croutons were a little interesting - more soft &#34;bread&#34; like than I&#39;m used to but no big deal.<br><br>Everyone&#39;s plate was practically licked clean by the end of the meal. Dessert was amazing (obviously), and overall just a great dinner. I&#39;ve been to a couple Cheesecake Factory restaurants in different cities and while they are all usually pretty good, this location stands out to me as the best.

We haven&#39;t been to the Cheesecake Factory for over a year because of the service. Well we decided to give it a chance last night and we decided to sit at the bar. I must say Cheryl and Steven the two bartenders who served us made up for all our bad service in one night. They were both absolutely excellent. So if your out that way and you want to have great service,great conversation go see Cheryl and Steven. I highly recommend them!

Really no complaints, we arrived here at 11am and there was no wait. We got seated immediately.  Server and manager both came by table immediately being seated. Service was excellent, we had Traci, she explained a few items on the menu we were interested in and check on us through our meal.<br><br>I ordered the Mexican Chicken Lettuce Tacos, husband got the skinny Chicken Pot Pie, and our friend got the Ahi Tuna Salad. <br><br>Only downside I encountered was the bathroom, certainly was clean but they used a very dirty mop. Left a mad smell in the bathroom.

Today, my family and a few friends decided to hit up The Cheesecake Factory for happy hour. It was a great food and drink decision! I had the cheeseburger, which was juicy and filling, with perfectly salted fries. I also had a couple house margaritas, which were the perfect combination of sweet/sour. My wife and her friend split the fried chicken sliders and they were great. Another one of our friends ordered the corn tamale cakes and we all helped;) The Oreo Dream Extreme Cheesecake was about as good as it sounds-amazing! The Cheesecake Factory is always good, but tastes even better @ happy hour!
Today I had the Mexican Tortilla Salad and it was pretty good. Big portion but good. Ample parking. It was about a 15minute wait. Good service.

Hungry, but don&#39;t know what you want? They have it here! The Cheesecake Factory has an enormous menu with every type of food you could crave. The service here is pretty consistent but there can be very long waits when it&#39;s busy. <br><br>Some of my favorites are the factory chopped salad, fish tacos, chicken and garlic pasta and the avocado eggrolls which I&#39;ve never seen anywhere else. The food is always good and usually comes out quickly, even when they are busy.<br><br>Of course I can&#39;t come here without getting a piece of cheesecake. The red velvet is delicious, loaded with cream cheese. I also like the white chocolate caramel macadamia nut cheesecake. It&#39;s one of my new favorites. For being a chain restaurant the Cheesecake Factory delivers a great experience with good service and a wonderful selection of food.

OMG<br><br>I LOVE THIS PLACE!<br><br>Go with a big appetite!<br><br>The staff is very professional, very clean warm atmosphere and a awesome  dining experience!<br><br>I always get the chicken oriental, yum  so delicious every single time!<br><br>Ok, really, desert is the best!  <br>Yum  yum  yum!<br>Cheese Cake - OMG SNICKERS!<br><br>So Awesome, everybody should go, it&#39;s fabulous!

The Cheesecake Factory has to be my favorite restaurant ever. It is the perfect place for any occasion. <br><br>My favorite things about this restaurant is how it is dimly lit. It adds a more intimate atmosphere and makes the room feel more luxurious. The music they play definitely makes the experience a lot better. It can be quite busy every night as it is perfect for a casual dinner or more special dinner. The servers have always been great and very friendly! <br><br>The menu offers you so many different choices. My personal favorites is the fried calamari for appetizer, of course the delicious complimentary bread basket, the herb crusted salmon and mashed potatoes with asparagus and a lemon sauce, I made the mistake of switching it up one night and got a rice dish, nothing compares to the salmon, then finish it off with, of course, cheesecake! The classic strawberry cheesecake is not too sweet and fresh, but still satisfying for any sweet tooth. <br><br>I was always come back and have had great memories every single visit.

Wait times too long for takeout, waited for an hour on one occasion, need to hire better takeout people seems very disorganized, items always missing, wait times too long, I do enjoy dining in but don&#39;t like the takeout here

Calorieake Factory, Henderson, NV<br><br>250 lbs - Drawn like fat little moths to our glittering temple....<br><br>If you&#39;re going to visit a restaurant that more than lives up to its reputation for dietary madness, go on an unrestricted night, because it&#39;s stupidly futile to observe gustatory rigor at The Caloriecake Factory. Their well-honed formula will suck dollars from your wallet and pack pounds on your waist. <br><br>And it is a successful formula, at least as best I can tell: each dish is savory and well prepared if not totally inspired, and most spill over the sides of large plates. Gracious, competent staff, expensive drinks, and no room for dessert, which you will order anyway. <br><br>Chicken Madeira: Heavy and comfortish, with nicely cooked chicken breast slathered in peas, carrots, heavy cream/chicken/cheese sauce, stacked on top of a George Foreman fist sized serving of creamy potatoes. Because this setup is too low carb, Caloriecake adds two standard sized buttery biscuits on top of all this, which is good because I totally didn&#39;t get enough bread before the meal. With butter. And beer. <br><br>Total calorie weigh-in: 1650 for just the dish alone. <br><br>Bacon-bacon burger: perfect sear over hot pink beef. Soft, sweetish french roll, fresh crispy veggies, and a joyfully disgusting amount of cheddar cheese and mayo. Man, what a good burger! Alas, sidekicked by fries with a sadly low crunch halflife. The fries could be better. <br><br>Calories: 1500. This is so much naughty fun that it&#39;ll come with a hangover. <br><br>Caramel Salted Cheesecake: 1000 calories for one slice. I&#39;m laughing as I type this. <br><br>Back on program tomorrow. The Caloriecake Factory adds just enough pleasure to your guilty to keep busting diets like belts. Go enjoy. Occasionally.

I love the Cheesecake Factory, even though my boyfriend calls their menu a &#34;monstrosity&#34; of different restaurants​. That&#39;s probably true, but everything I&#39;ve ever tried has been delicious, so I don&#39;t care. :) Also, this location usually doesn&#39;t have a very long wait, which is always nice. <br><br>One thing we&#39;ve noticed though is their servers all try really hard on the customer service side of things, almost to the point where it&#39;s​ over the top. We&#39;ve had three different servers who, for lack of a better word, bugged us all night. Constantly checking in to see how our food was, refilling glasses that are only 1/4 gone, and generally hanging around the table. Similarly​, every time we have eaten here, they have offered us dessert as soon as my boyfriend finished his meal, even though I still had 2/3 of my meal left. I know he&#39;s a fast eater and I&#39;m a slow eater but checking in about dessert 2-3 times when I already said I&#39;m not done eating is a quick way to drive me mad. That was a bit weird and I don&#39;t know if it&#39;s just those servers, or the management at that location. <br><br>Overall though, we like the food, the price is fair, and its better than waiting in line at the Summerlin location or paying Strip prices.

Went here for lunch with my mom. We were the second group to walk in. First group got seated, we were told it would be a moment. 5 minutes, 3 servers, another woman on the phone, finally the hostess comes back to seat us at a corner table. Almost 10 minutes goes by before we&#39;re asked our drink order. Drinks come from someone else. Waitress gave the impression she&#39;d rather be anywhere else. Food is good, service and host station were really lacking.
Steak shrimp scampi came out room temperature, honestly felt like the server didn&#39;t pay much attention to us. Give this place a all around 6. Might be back and try again.

It is a Cheesecake Factory so you know what to expect.  <br><br>-massive menu<br>-huge portions of food<br>-consistently good presentation and taste<br>-pricey food costs<br>-decadent cheesecake dessert <br>-take home boxes galore<br>-loud / crowded / insane dining room<br><br>Not much else to say.  You either are OK with Cheesecake Factory or you aren&#39;t.   It isn&#39;t for me but I get the appeal so putting aside my personal views, it gets 4 stars from me.

Zero star for the retard hostess with the bun in her hair. There was a line of people and a bunch of girls walked straight up and asked her how long the wait was and she proceeds to get their name and number of people?!??! Excuse me lady with the bun there is a line don&#39;t you see?? Why don&#39;t you pay attention to your surrounding. Get some training because obviously you don&#39;t know anything. I then told her we were first and her response was wait wait wait the wait time is still 20-30 minutes ! Um excuse me not if they have a party of 3 and we have a Party of 4 guess who will be called first???!!!!! Plus what about everyone else behind us in line?!!? Do you think they were just standing there??

I adore CF&#39;s Thai Lettuce wraps.  It&#39;s an appetizer but filling enough for a meal and the sauces that accompany the chicken satay are amazing!  <br><br>All in all I don&#39;t usually go for anything else on the menu.  My husband likes the Louisiana chicken and we both like the fresh bread served as an appetizer.  CF is usually crowded and loud.  But the service is typically good and the portion sizes are huge!

This is hands down the spot! From walking through the door, the service, the food all of it!!! <br>I brought my daughters for dinner on a Wednesday evening around 5:30 it was pretty full but we were seated immediately. Our waitress Tina was phenomenal no exaggeration! The food was great! We had an amazing time!

I get out to Henderson about once a month. On every trip I always come here. I have never had a bad meal at Cheesecake Factory and have been coming to multiple locations ever since the chain opened. My favorite dish is a toss up between the Chicken Madeira and the Shrimp Scampi. Imagine my delight when they started the combination meal so I can get both. I love the brunch menu. The Lemon Ricotta Pancakes are the best and the bacon is perfect. My favorite appetizers are the fried zucchini, Dynamite Shrimp, and the new pork belly sliders. Love the bread of course.<br><br>Make the fried pickles a separate appetizer please! Love &#39;em!!!<br><br>Love every cheesecake I&#39;ve ever tried.<br><br>Service has always been very good, especially in Henderson. They really hustle here without seeming to be rushed. The servers are very nice.

YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(312/365) &#34;The Default Dinner&#34;<br><br>Brain Fart-when you can&#39;t recall something that you wanted to say or mention, and its at the tip of your tongue, but still can&#39;t remember?<br><br>Food Fart-my term for when you are hungry, but you can&#39;t decide even with the HUNDREDS of dining options and cuisines in the 702 AND the Yelp App where you want to grab a bite to eat???? Anyone else run into this problem? <br><br>Anywho, we were on this side of town and we didn&#39;t care for anywhere on the strip(don&#39;t think anyone who works on the Strip cares either)and we were Chinatown&#39;d out (also a famous area for Dirty Dining lately...looking at you, Joyful House!) Prices are very reasonable here and the portions are HUMANGOUS which is why I like to order off their Small Plates Menu and I always get the Pear, Bleu Cheese,  and Pecan Flatbread which has always been consistently good. I also got the Veggie Fries Combo which came with Portabellos, Zucchini, and Avocados. The avocados were my least favorite because they have no business being in the fryer IMO. These are one of those things that are great as-is.<br><br>Totally stuffed from dinner, we had no room for dessert, but we were pleased with our meal.  This is the first time though that our server kinda sucked. She just looked like she didn&#39;t want to be there...lucky we didn&#39;t let her ruin our visit. Next time you find yourself having a food fart, Cheesecake Factory may just be a good option!   ALOHA!!!!<br><br>Shaka Meter:  \uuu/   \uuu/   \uuu/   \uuu/  4<br><br>*Sorry for the dark photos...CF&#39;s lighting ain&#39;t the greatest and I didn&#39;t want to be &#34;that guy&#34;...

I&#39;ve been to other locations, but this was my first experience at this Green Valley location. I was pleasantly surprised to only wait 2 minutes for a table. That almost never happens at Cheesecake Factory. That&#39;s where the positives pretty well came to an end. <br><br>For starters, it took our server almost 15 minutes to see us for the first time. I get that a busy restaurant requires servers to attend to a lot of customers in their section, but waiting 15 minutes just to see us the first time and take drink orders is pretty bad. It also unfortunately set the tone for our service through the rest of our meal. <br><br>We started with fried Mac and cheese, which ended up being pretty good. It took a while to get to the table, but it was delicious. I decided to order the tempura fish tacos. Having to decide from 150+ menu items isn&#39;t my favorite thing but it is what it is. <br><br>Unfortunately, the fish tacos were horrible. The batter wasn&#39;t all the way cooked and the fish smelled horrible. I get that you can&#39;t expect super fresh fish from a chain restaurant, but it was awful. The pieces of fish didn&#39;t even fit in the tiny tortillas they put them in. I could only stomach 2 before calling it quits. <br><br>The shortest time between waitress visits was between taking our plates and bringing our check. Needless to say, I won&#39;t be back. We were thinking about getting cheesecake for dessert but didn&#39;t want to spend another 30 minutes and 10 dollars here. We filled out our check and got out of there. <br><br>I take some of the blame for ordering fish tacos, but if Cheesecake Factory can&#39;t produce something that at least tastes ok, then take it off the menu....or at least make your service passable. Unfortunate, but that&#39;s how it goes sometimes.
Every thing was delicious. Only problem is my salmon had a few thin bones in it  and the wait a a little ridiculous. I will come back.

I gave thrm 3 stars because of the horrible service we got.<br>I rarely give 3 star reviews , none of the food we ordered arrived on-time to our satisfaction.<br>I had to ask for the bread-and-butter more than 3 times . And I was given the excuse that it&#39;s in the oven , which I can understand because it was a busy night.<br>We ordered some beers that came without the foam on the top , and we got a horrible excuse that beers don&#39;t come with forming the on the top.<br>Like always the food was very good.<br>I would still recommend this place I just hope you guys will get a good service.<br><br>DO NOT ORDER BEER
Great service and delicious food. Great selection for the kids to! Only negative is the very noisy atmosphere makes it difficult to have a conversation

The takeout counter Receptionist Chris was so great tonight. He sat and listened to me yapping about nothing important and his customer service was great. You could tell he&#39;s just a great person. Go see Chris!!

Our waiter smelled like alcohol. I do not believe he was drunk, just extremely hung over as he was still sweating all the booze off. Food was great but service was slacking.<br><br>Update:<br><br>I submitted the comment on the corporate Cheesecake Factory site and did not receive a response.
came in for cheesecake to celebrate my birthday! Oreo cheesecake was so rich and creamy and the salted caramel cheesecake was light and yummy . :)

***PROS***<br>* Short wait for table - 10 mins<br>* Attentive waiter - never hungry, thirsty, or wondering where he was<br>* Great food! We had 4-cheese pasta which tasted like a pizza with so much flavor, herb-crusted, grilled salmon with broccoli and mashed potatoes that were wonderful, and tempura-battered fish tacos with chipotle sauce, pickled red cabbage, salsa and guacamole that was delicious. <br>* Complimentary bread at table was warm and fresh, served with large pats of butter<br>* Strawberry lemonade had real strawberry seeds in it, sugar rim on the glass, and wonderful sour flavor. <br>* Cheesecake to go was packaged with extra whipped cream and plenty of napkins &amp; forks<br>***CONS***<br>The only &#34;con&#34; was that the waiter mentioned the computers were slow because of a Christmas coupon that was difficult to enter yet many customers were using. I wish we knew about the coupon. I&#39;d say check their website for details, get on their mailing list, or follow their social media accounts for details.

Let&#39;s talk about how I never leave bad reviews unless it&#39;s the server.... lol well yeah that happened tonight. <br><br>Service was great till I ordered my turkey burger add grilled mushroom, no tomato. When I decided to put my &#34;lettuce&#34; on the burger, I noticed how bitter my burger was. I looked harder at the lettuce. It was actually cabbage!! I couldn&#39;t believe I was eating cabbage on half of my burger lol. Anyways, I take it off the burger and continue to eat. At the end when the server took my plate, I asked if that burger is supposed to have cabbage?? She said it&#39;s supposed to be a mix. I said weird it says LTO on the menu, I&#39;ve ordered this 3-4 times before. She couldn&#39;t resist that this dish was suppose to still have a mix and maybe they forgot the lettuce. I just told her maybe she should look into it. Got the check and still tipped 20%

Passion fruit mojito  amazing <br><br>Cuban sándwich  only place that gets it rightly in town ..<br><br>I don&#39;t mind waiting for a table because I know the service will always be on point and the quality of food will always be great.. <br>I always change my plate and never get disappointed .. the passion fruit mojito I don&#39;t change because it&#39;s amazing and no one else has it

The wife and I decided to try this location again (with some friends) even though we know the wait times are usually ridiculous. We were able to get a seat immediately on a Tuesday evening. I had the Farfalle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic and it was amazing! I was so glad I was able to figure out what I wanted since their menu is huge.<br>The service was excellent. No one had a empty glass all evening. Very courteous and consistent all night long. We will definitely be visiting this location again soon.

I like coming here between lunch and dinner rush. You usually get seated pretty quickly. I&#39;ve been here several times and the servers have always been friendly. The food always comes out the way it should, but there seems to be some consistency issues as far as how often the servers check up on you. Some seem to just disappear for a while and you end up flagging down the next one you see to get a refill.  Not a deal breaker for me but I don&#39;t like troubling someone else&#39;s server.
