I give this place a 4 for food value and service.

I like this restaurant. The food here is consistent, albeit with varying quality. The decor is excellent. There is a large menu with a lot of variety. This is a great choice when your group can&#39;t agree on a specific cuisine.<br><br>If your group can agree on a specific type of cuisine there are definitely better options in both quality of food and value. Quality of food ranges from subpar to fairly good, but remains consistent across visits. This restaurant has above average prices. <br><br>The service here is outstanding. Have visited this location about 4 times and each time I have had fast refills on drinks, and polite waitstaff.<br><br>Food 2/5<br>Service 4.5/5<br>Decor 4/5<br>Value 1/5<br>Overall 3/5
Great service and variety. Early Saturday   evening seemed less crowded and we got a table right away!

Just had lunch. Always great food and even better service. The Bartender remembered my name from last time. Took my order, my drink came fast and bread came out right after. It was warm, which allowed the butter to melt. Love that. Then my food came out. The herb salmon is always amazing. Fresh food. Made my day so much better.

Went for my son&#39;s 20th birthday. We were seated right away. The place is in serious need of some type of light on tables. Had to use the light from our phones to see the menu. <br><br>It took a very long time for our food to arrive. When it finally came, my chicken was burnt and potatoes were cold. I asked the server to send over a manager. The manager made excuses that the recipe for this dish had recently been changed and the kitchen still hadn&#39;t gotten the hang of it. She said &#34;its supposed to be served dark, but not THAT dark.&#34;  Better to just apologize rather then tell me your kitchen doesn&#39;t know how to properly cook your dishes. She said she liked the old recipe and didn&#39;t know why they changed it. <br><br> I sent it back and by the time my new dish arrived everyone else had already finished their meal. This time it wasn&#39;t cooked enough! UGH. I just took it to go, since I didn&#39;t want everyone else to have to sit there while I struggled through rubbery chicken skin. Truly unappetizing!  I tried to crisp it up the next day and it was still disgusting. I&#39;m very disappointed because this used to be my favorite dish. Also this put a big damper on our birthday celebration. We were so disgusted that we took our cheesecake to go (not even a comp piece for his b&#39;day).<br><br>I hope they can get their act together since this is my son&#39;s favorite chain.

I felt lead to leave a quick review because I&#39;ve been here about 6 times and never had much issue. One dish wasn&#39;t prepared well (chicken and biscuits) but the staff did their best to rectify the issue which was appreciated. Overall we love this location and the food and service has been great overall!

Although this is a chain, I felt the staff went above and beyond to get it right. Food was fresh and delicious and the staff cared about service. My modified salad tasted great and appreciate they made the effort to work with me. Avocado egg rolls were the family favourite.

Cynthia was super slow, unfortunately I was very disappointed by the business. For some odd reason she was attentive to all the other table besides ours. We were visiting her from SF and celebrating our friends birthday here was not as expected. For me this is not worth coming to, other chains are much faster. The food was ok, a little on the salty side.  She didn&#39;t even fill up pour water, we were left on the table for awhile till she came back, when she filled out water it was when we were paying. I hope she gets some training it gets less tables so she can improve service. As for everything else, waiting time on a weekend was 1+ hour. Anyone visiting, service is super slow, so if you are visiting don&#39;t come here many more places to explore in Vegas.

This is based on dine in and take out. Dine in started off great! I was ready to leave 25+dollars on a $62 dollar bill, however, as we wait to order cheesecake to go and cash out - our server never returned. 5 minutes became 15 minutes and so on. Finally I left 6 dollars and ordered cheesecakes separately from the to go counter. The server came to our &#34;area&#34; but never came back to collect our check or see if we needed anything else. Next two visits were to go online orders. Both times I arrived to pick up order and there is no one there to help - the hostesses stare at me, but never offer to call someone so me and other guests just wait and wait. When this woman finally comes over, same woman both times, she&#39;s acts like she&#39;s working there by force, like someone has a knife to her neck. No smile, no customer service, no apologies for the wait. Management needs to observes these practices and step in. My favorite place, just not this location.

Let me start by saying the food was amazing. It&#39;s always good here and we been here a few times. But today, the service wasn&#39;t that great. <br><br>Our server was Jessica F. She had no personality, no greeting and didn&#39;t smile. We had to keep asking her for refills, asked for bread, extra plates etc. after a few times it started to get ridiculous. <br><br>My family and I will be back, but we&#39;ll make sure not to get seated in her section.

It was packed since it was weekend/dinner time/Fathers day, we were told that the wait time will 20-30 minutes.. we were seated at exactly 30 minutes. The host was really nice.. our server was really nice too and attentive to our needs. It was another good experience in this restaurant. Truly a place for special occasions
This location had the typical Cheese Cake Factory Experience. The service was average.  I believe they are over priced for the portion size.

I Would like to do three, but two stars is well earned...!<br>First time, and last,<br>Me and my wife order chicken taquitos, corn chauder, chipotle chicken pasta,<br>And carne asada, from the menú,<br>attention M.O.D.<br>No specials, no soup of the day, no recommendations, no check back ((two minutes two bites)), no refill drink, no desserts offered, no way <br>Waited 15 minutes for appetiser, 20 more minutes for dinner, only to find out that I&#39;m getting lasagna verde, instead of my carne asada, obviously I rejected the lasagna, I had to wait another astonishing 25 extra minutes for my carne azada, <br>OmG, at this point I&#39;m still trying to keep my cool,<br>Chipotle Chicken pasta, had only a few chicken nuggets, and carne asada was no different, a few pieces of meat, no larger than a 50 cents coin, <br>had to &#34;dig&#34; in all of the veggies to find the carne asada,<br>Oh, well, for those extra 25 minutes we spent waiting for my meal, there was no more time to enjoy one of those world famous cheese cake, i really was craving for, <br>I do not think we will be back,<br>rather Chicas, Yardbird, or Seferinos..<br>I&#39;m sorry, I really hate to do this, but excellent customer service is a must..

Tried their Miso Marinated Salmon, such a tasty and beautiful dish. I loved the white sauce that gives it a sweet taste. Comes with brown or white rice and snow peas. Portion was great too I was able to take leftovers. I recommend this dish if you&#39;re in the mood for some seafood. Our server was great, made sure our drinks were refilled and was very attentive. I like the dim lighting and atmosphere is quite romantic. This place gets pretty pact and although they don&#39;t take reservations until after 8pm I would call ahead and ask what the wait time is. We were able to get seated right away on a Wednesday night though. I&#39;ll definitely be back!

I had thought that since Cheesecake Factory was closely related to Lux Cafe (which I love) I&#39;d go there and be very happy.<br><br>I ordered the closest thing to a Southwest Salad (that I normally get at Lux Cafe).  I was disappointed.  Tons of food on the plate.  It was just a little bland, and I felt like a cow in the pasture just munching away.  It really didn&#39;t have the kick I was looking for.<br><br>Prices are pretty high.<br><br>Service was good though.<br><br>I think I will just stick with Lux Cafe...

Staying in Henderson this Cheesecake Factory was the first I&#39;ve visited which I didn&#39;t have to wait for seating at dinner. I was seated at a booth which I requested and was comfy.<br><br>My friendly waitress greeted me asap and gave me a menu with the large variety of choices to choose from. I ended up going with the Salmon Miso which was topped on steamed rice and served with pea pods. The fish was fresh &amp; moist and the miso sauce went good when combined with the rice and pods. Instead of going with a fancy cheesecake I chose the original which was served with whipped cream. The cheesecake was silky smooth and creamy and not overly rich but filling.<br><br>Overall for me - the large variety of choices, good quality in a pleasant atmosphere make Cheescake Factory a solid choice to dine.

I had the Louisiana pasta. Not a bad pasta dish but not great either. Chicken was crispy but the sauce on top was a little mediocre. The massive menu here makes it a challenge to find the dishes that they do well here. The wife had the chicken maderia, which she enjoyed the balsamic tasting sauce on top of the potatoes and chicken. The spicy spinach dip was tasty with nice crisp chips on the side was definitely a highlight. And of course washed it all down with a nice hunk of peanut butter cup cheese cake at the end, which was excellent. Service and ambience was great! I just gotta find a more suitable entree there for my palette.

Wife and I split a chicken madera lunch. Absolutely great. Plenty for both. Then added cheesecake - took some home.<br>More than we normally spend, even with splitting the meal, but was worth every cent!<br>If you want great food, give this a try. Also, server with Buffalo Bill Cody mustache was great too.

This place in general is average. Never exceptional.  I arrived for lunch at 10:59 doors locked. 11:02 doors open. Why not open 10 minutes early?? Don&#39;t make customers wait outside.sat down was not served for 10 minutes. Had various waiters help us then after 20 minutes of waiting watching others getting their food , people that had arrived after us, our food arrived with apologies that a take out order took all their time. <br><br>The enchiladas we had ordered were cold. After waiting another 5 minutes to flag down a waiter we were told they could reheat it.  They took the food away and brought the salad bowls back asking us if we wanted to eat that while we waited. They had offered my salad to my guest and hers to me, wtf... I then told them to start from scratch and remake it all and she proceeded to look at me with a totally bewildered look. I repeated this and she just went &#34;but, but,but&#34;. Having had enough and 40 minutes into this circus I left 5 bucks for the ice tea and told her to tell the manager to get their s$$t together then left. Who has hours to mess around at lunch.

Ordered pick up from Cheesecake Factory in Henderson and spent 125.00. We treat our selfs on Fridays from a restaurant because we are stuck at home and we are all a little over whelmed with all the cooking for the family and also to help the workers with keeping them open BUT when you get your order home and it&#39;s not like how you normally get it! It&#39;s very frustrating... we ordered a couple of chicken Madeira, if you&#39;ve had chicken Madeira before you know that it has that wonderful sauce and lots of it to cover both pieces of chicken n asparagus. They packed the sauce separately which is fine BUT when you put the sauce in this little small sauce container and it&#39;s barely enough to coat 1 piece of chicken, it&#39;s so disappointing and frustrating. So we only each ate 1 small pierce of chicken because the rest was just dry and the mash potatoes was cold and hard. I called to let them know that I was not happy with my order and that I had tipped them 15.00 on top of my big order and the young lady that answered all she said was I&#39;ll let the cook know. Excuse me! How is that gunna help me now with my order. She didn&#39;t offer a credit or a gift card! Nothing! So no I don&#39;t recommend you order to go from Cheesecake Factory!! Never again will they get my money.

It&#39;s been about 4 years Zapponians and myself have come here to team build - and it wasn&#39;t a disappointment!<br><br>From the time we were brought to our table to the time we left, everything was a great experience!<br><br>Tiffany, our waitress deserves a special shout out for being so attentive to our group!<br><br>Every time I eat at a Cheesecake Factory, I typically order the same food dishes, starting off with the avocado egg rolls with the sweet cilantro dressing.<br><br>If you&#39;ve never had these, definitely order them as a starter! Ah - Maze - Zing!<br><br>I&#39;m also a burger lover and saw the Mac n cheese burger!? What?! My two favorites put into a burger!<br><br>Now, I&#39;ll be honest, it was delicious to have Lk that extra cheese, I wish the fried Mac n cheese had more of a crunch. I feel the cheese sauce doused that crunch one would want for texture contrast.<br><br>Minor detail, it was cheesy, beefy, and the sweet potato fries were delicious!<br><br>With the amazing portions that you are served, you have to remember to leave room for dessert!<br><br>To top off such an epic meal, a slice of salted caramel cheesecake is always a great closer!<br><br>If you&#39;re in Henderson and want something to relieve that &#34;hangry&#34; pain, come here and spend time with the fam bam or your crew!<br><br>They&#39;ve got something for you!<br><br>:)
Love, absolutely love.  Their menu? Huge. The ambience? Simply the best.  It&#39;s truly a struggle to find what to order with such an extensive selection, and everyone knows it.

Not only am I fan of the cheesecake but also the food. As of late I&#39;ve found myself sitting at or in the bar area so I don&#39;t have to wait for a seat. It seems this location is always busy. Happy hour is M-F 4-6pm with reduced price drinks and appetizers.

I am saddened to give a 1 star for Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>April 16 went for birthday dinner with 7 people.  Waitress Tina was fabulous.  5 Stars all the way around service food etc.<br><br>Since our experience was so well we decided to go again on the 17th this time with 9 people.  Was given a beeper and told 45 minutes.<br>There was a crowd of people Wednesday night but not so many that we had to wait almost 2 hours for a table at which we ourselves suggested to sit outside.  This should have been suggested by the hostess as we several time went in to check on the status of our table.<br>&#34;Its spring break lots of kids, just 15 minutes, table set up for outside which we could see and then 15 minutes later we are finally seated&#34;<br><br>The music was so loud you couldn&#39;t hear your conversations, we asked that it be turned down the lady manager sorry i don&#39;t recall her name said of course.  She did not turn down the music we had to go back inside and ask another person if they could turn it down.<br><br>Our Waitress was very very good and her service was excellent.<br><br>Food came after 40 minutes with us asking why is it taking so long.<br>3 Poeple ordered a Cajun chicken it came bland there was no seasoning on them at all.<br>Chicken tequeitoes had barely any sauce.<br><br>Manager was spoken to about the time issue and the fact she didn&#39;t turn down the music when asked.  She said she would take care of our check with a discount.  The check came and there was no discount.<br>Had to be returned for adjustments and then it showed only free drinks.  Mind you some of the guests only had water.<br><br>We then made comment about the quality of the food and the lady manager went and got James.  We were not trying to get our meals for free we just wanted them to hear our concerns and that fact we purposely choose this restaurant 2 times in a row.<br>After hearing that we came at 6pm and now leaving at 9pm he comped all our meals which wasn&#39;t that much as some only had appetizers.<br><br>Needless to say we will not be going to Cheesecake any time soon in the future.

Let me just start off by saying: Cheesecake Factory is my all time favorite place to go. Their four cheese pasta is the best (ask for angel hair instead and omg) you&#39;ll absolutely fall in love. The potato bites are super good too, very flavorful! We typically receive great customer service here also! This last time Tina helped us and she was the most upbeat and sweet server ever! She has an amazing personality and is truly about her customer service! She offered suggestions and seemed to genuinely care. We need more &#34;Tina&#39;s&#34; in the world!

One thing about cheesecake factory that I love is that they stay consistent with food..their menu is always the same and each dish is prepared the same every time. When you come here the only thing that may bug me is their service.It&#39;s like one day I&#39;ll eat here and the server is awesome and the next time it&#39;s the total opposite.But I will gladly take it for the food is key. I normally stick to a couple things here but I&#39;ve tried alot of things that are amazing.<br><br>My faves are<br>Ahi tempura roll<br>Shrimp and bacon club<br>Rib eye steak with garlic mashed potatoes that comes with one delicious onion ring( I wish they came with 5 of them..lol)<br>Miso salmon (sometimes the rice is too hard and uncooked)<br>Cabonara <br>Of course the red velvet cheesecake is the best<br>(Ive tried alot of other dishes here like breakfast stuff like the chicken hash and the Monte cristo sandwich but they weren&#39;t really memorable)<br><br>Oooh and don&#39;t forget about that bread! Yummy! I will always have cheescake factory as an option for a meal any day of the week

We ordered drinks as we sat down  and we waited 20 min ,no water, no drinks and no bread and the food arrived before anything and we have to ask for drinks again .terrible service.on the bright side the manager heared<br>Our disappointment and came and wanted to give us complimentary dessert... but I am not there for free stuff so I refused the offer but I appreciated the effort made.
great food, service was amazing,  clean restaurant, friendly-family environment and our waiter was awesome.

Wow it was my birthday and this place disappointed  our friends salad was bitter the leaves were not fresh.  My friend and I got the shepherds pie and the sauce was really off: Way too salty and tangy yuck.  The other person got the meatloaf it was dry and tasteless.  The sauce was also bad.  The only thing very good was the cheesecake.  Oh and the service was slow <br><br>Next time we will go to grand lux cafe in the Venetian much better and higher end version of Cheesecake Factory.

Sunday brunch is popular here. The menu is like 1,000 pages and extensive.<br>They really could make it more compact. Anywho, I really liked my California omelet, it had lots of toppings and was a generous portion. My family also enjoyed their meals, and we got a comped menu item due to the long wait for it (the manager stopped by to surprise us with this). That was nice of him and certainly appreciated. Good place for large portions and huge variety.

Waiters are so rude, food was never how I ordered it, have gotten food that they were bringing spilt on me many times. I always try to give them another chance but it&#39;s not getting any better. Will not be going back

This Cheesecake Factory is in a great location right off of the 215 and Green Valley. Lots of available parking, comparatively speaking to the Summerlin location at Boca Park. We arrived at 6:30pm this Friday night and waited for about 30 minutes. Even though it was really busy, none of the servers seemed to be running around with no remorse for guests who were waiting in the lobby/hostess area. I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory&#39;s in the past where this has happened.<br><br>After we sat down we were greeted by our waitress Andrea R. Very knowledgeable, very friendly and patient. DEFINITELY, three important qualities needed for working here as a server. <br><br>We started with avocado egg rolls and buffalo blasts. Avocado egg rolls, as always were fantastic. Buffalo blasts were great as well, however it seems there&#39;s a little too much extra breading around the outside. I&#39;m sure for the cooking style it&#39;s beneficial, and they are still very delicious otherwise and definitely a sufficient enough portion. <br><br>Since the dishes are so plentiful, I chose to order an additional appetizer, the Crabcakes. They were fantastic (even though I only enjoyed one of the three) and served fairly well. The only adjustment to this dish I would make is how the Crabcakes are served. They are presented on a bed of Chinese noodles (little foam type noodles). As you cut through the Crabcakes the noodles stick to the Crabcake and it changes the consistency of the bite. The crabcake itself was DELICIOUS. But, it would have been far better if I didn&#39;t have to fight noodles through every bite! <br><br>After dinner I had the Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Fudge Cup Ripple Cheesecake and it is wonderful. Not too sweet, very satisfying if you&#39;re a chocolate lover. <br><br>The service here is excellent, the food is delicious, and the atmosphere like any Cheesecake Factory is comfortable. I will come back here again and I would recommend any one else too as well.
Darren the manager rocks!! So friendly and helpful.  Definitely ask for him to say hi of if you have an issue.  He makes this place!!!  Our waiter Mike was excellent as well. Great experience.

This location is super busy because of the near by Casio.  The food is the usual American food options which is decent priced for the portions but they are really slow getting the food out. Its not a favorite of mine but it&#39;s not a bad place for dinner with an ambiance. The only reason I usually go is for the desert.

I forgot to update this but after we ate here, I took home my leftovers and when I heated it up the day after, there was sooooo much grease in the bottom of my plate. And if I tilted it over to the side as if I&#39;m draining it, even more grease accumulated- like a quarter cup of it. Needless to say, I threw it out. The pasta is good but I&#39;m pretty sure the dim lighting is what covers up people from seeing the grease.

I&#39;m usually excited to go to Cheesecake Factory. Their food and service usually receives high marks from me, but this time wasn&#39;t good. I ordered the chicken bellagio like I usually do, but I bit into something very hard. It broke off into many pieces, and I felt like I was chewing sand. I didn&#39;t complain because when I had spit it out it  had already partly dissolved and wouldn&#39;t show on the napkin. I love Cheesecake Factory, but this experience was painful for me and my tooth. Just putting this here to enlighten the masses.

All you are in need of a good happy hour with decent food, good drinks and Brittney (our waitress). She&#39;s what made this happy hour experience 5 stars! According to her she&#39;s always there in the bar area...so if you want 5 star service and a good happy hour experience...give Brittney your tip money...you won&#39;t be disappointed!
2nd week in a row I asked for Korean cauliflower extra crispy with sauce on the side only and it didn&#39;t come the way that I ordered it. Again. But they&#39;re sorry

First and foremost, Cheesecake Factory is not kid friendly. Yes they have a kids menu, but nothing to keep the little ones distracted. I took my daughter there for a lunch date and felt pressured to order as fast as possible. We ordered our drinks and went to use the restroom to wash up. By the time we came back, the table was cleared and setup for someone else. <br><br>I asked our waitress why they cleared the table and she said that she thought we left, even though we ordered drinks and had bread on our plates.<br><br>It is not the worst place on the planet for food, but there are about 25 other restaurants in the area that I would choose before going back to The Cheesecake Factory.

HORRIBLE , HORRIBLE , HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE experience from the general manager of the restaurant. Even after I have notified her that the food was lousy, my wife got stomachache from their food. <br>I have contacted the corporate office and they did not do anything about it, I have tried to reach out to the regional manager and he never tried to call me , nothing. <br>After my wife got food poisoning from this location at Green Valley, I went back to the restaurant to speak with a general manager and she refused to speak with me. <br>I can&#39;t believe how Cheesecake Factory treats their loyal customers, we have been coming to this location for years and brought so many friends there and they did not care about that a bit. <br>We will definitely never ever return to the Cheesecake Factory again, I will rather go somewhere else and spend my money,where I will be appreciated as a loyal customer .
Another chain restaurant...that charges too much and can&#39;t handle the business thrown at it. 4pm on a sat....really
Great food and open late. Unlike bubba Gump, CF knows that people are at Disneyland and may want food after the park. Good job. Shrimp scampi was wonderful. <br>.

There&#39;s a reason for the one star. The food itself was good (salmon with veggies), but I told them specifically not to give me mashed potatoes. Just veggies. They still gave me mashed potatoes. My wife and I asked for hot tea and they have us a steel pot each of hot water and a &#34;Nuvi&#34; brand tea packet each. Cost was $7 per tea. Ridiculous. Not even good Japanese restaurants charge $7 for tea. Each person at that. So $14 for two tea packets. Starbucks won&#39;t even charge that much for tea.

I love Cheesecake Factory and me and boyfriend always eat there. There&#39;s never a time that I didn&#39;t enjoy the food and desserts they offer. If I want a good dessert the place is my always first choice. Omg!!! Now I feel like going there right now

I really dig this place. It presents a lively atmosphere with huge portions of food that are reasonable for the prices you pay. Don&#39;t be alarmed by the $14 cheeseburger, it&#39;s a nice portion and higher quality ingredients than your average chain restaurant. The cheesecakes are amazing, and they even have an Atkins-friendly low carb cheesecake that&#39;s made with Splenda and a crushed nut crust! It&#39;s crazy good. <br><br>Why do I frequent this restaurant? They have an understanding of special food and diet requests. I live a low carb lifestyle and it&#39;s so easy to make substitutions here. Salad, broccoli, spinach or green beans instead of fries? No problem. No bun? They&#39;ll lettuce wrap it! My new &#34;thing&#34; is to get the chicken pasta with spinach instead of pasta. Yes, the kitchen will easily accommodate special orders. It might take a lot longer to get your food (my last visit there resulted in a wait time of nearly 55 minutes from the time I placed my order &#39;til the food arrived), but at least the cooks get it right. <br><br>Minus a star because of three problems: 1. The usual slow service: it shouldn&#39;t take nearly an hour for food to come out of the kitchen when the restaurant is 3/4 full 2. The always dirty and gross bathrooms: Yuck, clean up more often, please! 3. The tables: if you get stuck at a tiny one, get ready for the nosy snobs next to you to be all up in your eatin&#39; business.

This is a very popular and very busy restaurant. Ordered Chicken Piccata ($12.95 from lunch menu) side salad ($4.95) and slice of chocolate cake ($8.50)for takeout. The Chicken Piccata was a very good portion for lunch. It was okay but not something I would order again for takeout because the sauce lost its consistency and flavor by the time I got it home. Some foods are just not good for takeout and I&#39;ve had this many times in the restaurant and its delicious. I was not a fan of the side salad. All it was was a bunch of weeds (no lettuce or romaine) 2 small tomato wedges and 2 cucumber slices. Slice of chocolate cake ($8.50!!!!) was just okay. Excellent to go service and excellent to go packaging.

I&#39;ve been here a couple times, just haven&#39;t really gotten around to writing a review until now. This place is a substantial restaurant; clean, friendly staff, and good food. <br><br>Tonight was our early valentines dinner, my boyfriend got the garlic pasta and I got the stuff chicken tortillas. 5/5 for the both of them!! At the end of our dinner we got a strawberry cheese cake (who doesn&#39;t get cheesecake here??) and a smoothie. Overall experience was pleasant, our food was good and the service was comfortably quick. No complaints about tonight!
We just left. Do damn cold in there and to top it off. We waited almost 30 minutes to even get water. Horrible!!!!

My waitress is disrespectful, maybe having a bad day. It&#39;s my mom and my birthday today. I said to myself, maybe something different to celebrate it with my family. <br><br>First, the lady didn&#39;t even introduced herself that she&#39;s our server. She comes around immediately asked me, what will I get to order. Which is good. I gracefully asked her, if theres any favorite that she&#39;ll recommend since it&#39;s been a while that I haven&#39;t been to this location. She said, I have never ate with you or never been with you, so I don&#39;t know what you like and you don&#39;t like. (Good point) but I mentioned that I haven&#39;t been here for a long time.<br><br>I normally give good reviews because it&#39;s uplifting to have a compliment. but this time I really don&#39;t like the service I receive from Sarah. To you,just be polite and respectful. I should have stayed longer and eat with my kids and mom  I was so disappointed and just left. I almost not give a tip but it&#39;s a must.<br><br>And the avocado roll is great, spaghetti and meatballs for my kids are not warm enough. The only warm food is my mom&#39;s order which is the stuffed.<br><br>This is my first time to be in this location. The service I got from Cesar&#39;s palace-cheesecake factory is way better than this.

My wife and I ate at this location this past weekend. We sat at the bar, ordered 1 appetizer, 3 adult beverages, and 2 entrees for a total of $120. For $120 my wife and I got to listen to the female bartender bitch about her good for nothing manager and how her pay sux! Also, my fried Cod was slimy in a couple areas, and for the price I paid it should have been done right (how do you screw up fried Cod?). Next time, I&#39;ll go support my local Pub and pay a fraction that I&#39;d pay at The Cheesecake Factory.

So I know that you guys are a busy restaurant and I have been there many times just to get cheesecake itself on the way home and never had a problem. Tonight we ate dinner there....service was average...food was good but we were full so asked for dessert to go. Got home to 1 good piece of cheese cake and 1 that looks like someone took a bite out of it...pics attached

Great second time experience there about 2 weeks ago, playing catch up here on reviews!<br><br>Our friend Polly wanted to try it and it was her choice via The dice  :D<br><br>We each ordered an appetizer, I got the sweet corn tamale cakes and they were AMAZING!   SO YUMMY!<br><br>Dinner for me was the cajun chicken/shrimp and sausage with brown rice, it was not listed on the menu so I am thinking they removed it but they made it for me, the first time around though they did not include the sausage so I had to have them make a bit for me and the waitress said no problem at all and within 5 mins I had my sausage  :)<br><br>Dessert was amazing, I got the tiramasu cheesecake, my friend got the oreo cookie cheesecake and I liked his a lot better though, mine was just like the tiramasu, didnt really seem like 2 things to me, a cheesecake and a cake but thats ok it was still good.    <br><br>Cant wait to go back and try more of the menu!

Decided to go here and mix it up a little since we had a gift card today.  They were pretty busy since it is Labor Day.  <br><br>First I tried the Fried calamari that was  light and Crisp served with garlic sauce. Decided to go with glam burger. It was served with french fries and green salad sweet potatoes I wanted to try that Kobe burger which was a American-style Kobe be with sautéed mushrooms and spicy mayo and onions.<br><br>The food was great but the service declined as the place got busier.
Good place good atmosphere!<br>Enjoyed our happy hour! Service was great!<br>We will comeback next time for sure!
I love the cheese cake factory!! I had one bad experience and the owner fixed it right away! I&#39;ll be sure to be back. Great portion sizes and they have options for vegans and vegetarians!

Who says that Cheesecake Factory has to be busy with long waits?<br>Who says you can&#39;t find something somewhat healthy at a Cheesecake Factory?<br><br>Nutrition wise, I&#39;ve been trying to clean it up for the last 10+ weeks. Sometimes eating meals prepped at home can be a bit of a grind.  So, it&#39;s good to eat out every once in awhile to break up the monotony. I recently met up with the gf and a friend for lunch here. I discovered their Skinnylicious menu a couple of months ago, so I knew I&#39;d find something clean. Just a reminder, this is a Cheesecake Factory and that means big portions.  Their Skinnylicious menu is no different.  You can get a range from salmon, turkey, lean steak, and chicken off their healthier side of the menu. But don&#39;t expect super low calories due to the portion size.  My advice, split your meal.  But for me, I&#39;m going to be all I can be and eat all I can eat...in moderation that is.  If you do that, then expect a calorie range between 490-590.  Still...this isn&#39;t too bad.<br><br>Like the rest of the Cheesecake Factories out there, there&#39;s always something for everyone.  Since I&#39;ve only had something off their Skinnylicious menu at this location, I am not able to comment on the rest of their food.  I have been to other Cheesecake Factories and pretty much tried everything. I have never been disappointed.  Service was great here and ironically, we didn&#39;t have to wait too long to be seated and served.  I&#39;ll most definitely be back.  <br><br>YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE 2013 - (417/500)
Nice food, friendly service, low prices, nice drinks, cool atmosfere,not bad for a early dinner!!
When you order a drink and the manager tells you they will never be strong . Don&#39;t have to be strong but at least be Worth the money I just spent..

Food: my go to is on the Skinnylicious Menu - Lemon Shrimp. I always request a side of lemons to make it extra lemony. Cooked perfectly and just the right serving size.<br><br>Service: we grabbed hi-top seats in the bar area and our server was attentive.<br><br>Location: in The District - very convenient and parking was easy.<br><br>Would come back!

It was great that they were quick to respond with an apology and that was all they gave. I feel like that&#39;s not enough, for the a stay in a hospital due to incompetence among the service staff. We were told on the 9th of May they were looking into it. But that was the last we have heard from them. That&#39;s just sad and poor management.

The cheesecake is always great and most dishes!  Tonite service was a little slow when i finally got seated.  The bar service was excellent!   Do not get nachos!! Ordered chicken it had maybe 10 little pieces of chicken a dab of sour cream a little more guac No beans very little cheese!  Basically got chips!! Will not order again! Calamari appetizer was excellent!
For a chain this place is kinda amazing. So many options and even the specials are usually good. If you can&#39;t find something here to like them you are probably a terrorist

If you are hungry and not sure what kind of &#34;food mood&#34; you are in, the cheesecake factory is your spot! The menu must be at least 10 pages and includes almost every type of food.  <br><br>Some of my favorites on the menu are the cobb salad, clubhouse sandwich, bbq chicken sandwich, fish tacos, chicken penne pasta, and grande burrito.  I have had almost every type of dessert that they offer and by far my favorite is the snickers cheesecake.  <br><br>The service at this location has always been excellent and although it gets extremely busy towards dinner time, they are prompt and never have too long of a wait until you sit down.  <br><br>Overall, I have had nothing but great experiences and delicious food at Cheesecake factory and I recommend it if you are looking for a wide variety of food and large portions for a reasonable price.

Our family met at The Cheesecake Factory for Mother&#39;s Day last night. All started out great, we were seated and given our menus. At first the waitress was great but then for some reason she became very rude.  My husband was sitting across the table from me and each time she would, I don&#39;t know what you would call it ... but bump into him. At first I thought &#34;it happens, I mean we were both siting at the end of the table&#34; but I watched it happen over and over again. At one point she knocked the spoon and knife off the table on to the floor, I mean you could here it. Even the 2 women next to us looked. No apology, nothing. I would have said something but our family was enjoying their dinner and it wasn&#39;t the time or the place at that point.  We won&#39;t be back.
Always good service. Food consistent. BUT ITS ALWAYS FREEZING COLD IN THIS PARTICULAR LOCATION. I sometimes don&#39;t want to dine due to fact it&#39;s unbearably cold.
Food wasn&#39;t that good and very expensive. Thank God we had a gift certificate <br>Orange chicken was dry, and tasteless.<br>Bang Bang chicken for $18 was not very good. <br>Won&#39;t be back

Worst service ever. It took literally 3 hours if not longer to get our meal finished. It took almost an hour for the waitress to even take our food order. And she wasn&#39;t very attentive. Very disappointed and upset. And on top of everything my meal was just disgusting.

Unfortunately this was the worst experience I&#39;ve had at a restaurant in a while. The table was directly under a huge air conditioning vent. They were either unable or unwilling to adjust the temperature or blower. The meal was miserable trying to eat while your hands are freezing. Horrible to spend almost $100 and be uncomfortable.

Decent food for most folks, but the only truly vegan options in the menu are salads... I am not a bunny rabbit. I love food. And it&#39;s really messed up that they sell the Impossible Burger (a vegan patty) on brioche bun (made with butter) with &#34;special sauce&#34; (made with regular mayo) - and even if you leave off the mayo sauce apparently every single bread option contains butter so you can&#39;t just sub a different bun which sucks.

We went here for dinner last night and had a great time, the atmosphere was very nice and inviting. Our waitress was very fast and knowledgeable of the menu and knew what she was doing. While the service was great, the food left a little to be desired.<br><br>We started with the crab and artichoke dip. This was served with buttered pieces of toast. The dip was just drowning in oils and grease. It was like dipping grease into grease, not very good in my opinion.<br><br>For our main corse I ordered the chicken madeira. For being the most famous dish, it was not really what I had my expectations set for. It was a great dish none the less and was prepaired flawlessly. The chef plated it very beautifully aswell. <br><br>My fiancé ordered the steak Diane and shrimp scampi combination. Again the presentation was very beautiful and the only critic she had was that the scampi was a bit tangy for her taste.<br><br>For desert we ordered the tiramisu and lemon meringue cheesecake to go, both were very good.<br><br>We will be coming back here forsure, it was totally worth what we had spent and the items left us very curious about other items on the menu.

We went here for our office part had a reservation for 8:00 pm. We didn&#39;t get seated till close to 9, took about 10-15 minutes before we got to order our drinks. Which then took another 15 or so minutes to arrive at the table. Again took about another 10 minutes for them to let us place our orders. After another 45 minutes we all got our food which was luke warm at best and wasn&#39;t very flavorful, the staff also were not great listeners as they got parts of the bill wrong and brought out drinks no one ordered. This was on top of the fact that they were out of several Cheesecakes I could not order the one I wanted nor any of the 3 back ups I had planned. The Crispy fried cheese I ordered was so sloppy I wouldn&#39;t even serve it to my family when I&#39;m not trying to impress them. A terrible experience likely to never come back. In fact I started a yelp just to share how bad it was.

The service has been awful tonight. Not only did it take an extremely long time to get our food in a non crowded restaurant they forgot my food and a friend&#39;s food. We had to tell the waiter that our food was missing and you cancel my order. Then the waiter informed the manager about the issues with our food and the manager was not professional nor did he apologize. Literally he walked up to our table says &#34;hoe does the food taste&#34; we reply good (because it did taste good, the appetizers we had gotten) then he walks away with not one other word. I will definitely be making an official complaint to their corporate. I can forgive the late food but for the manager to not even acknowledge the issues after the Waiter brought it to his attention he also did not even apologize for the issues. <br><br>HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!! The manager on April 22, 2017 evening shift needs to be trained in how to provide good customer service.

This factory was in full production mode when I came in on Monday afternoon.  I mean it was really hopping.  I came in at 2:00 PM thinking I would have missed the lunch rush and beat the dinner rush.  It did work out that way.  I had to wait 20 minutes for a table.  I guess that is what happend when they offer cheesecake slices for half price.  Thats what brought me in.  Oh, and the prospect of a good lunch.<br><br>I was seated after waiting a while which I didn&#39;t fully mind.  I would have been fine sitting at the bar if it got me seated sooner but I had a nice table to myself when I was seated.  My serve came over right away and brought my bread and water out pretty quickly.  For my lunch I ordered the lunch size pasta DiVinci.  Afterall, it has MUSHROOMS!  It also has grilled onions, chicken and sauce.  I asked for some fresh grated cheese to top it.  This was not a bad bowl of pasta but it could have been better.  The pasta to chicken ratio seemed off.  The mushrooms were good.  The onion tasted burnt.  And there seemed to be a taste of burnt oil too.  It wasn&#39;t terribly off putting but it was noticeable.  The dish has a lot of potential but I think the kitchen was bitten by the mass crowds and suffered for it.  Regardelss, I saved some for later and also asked to have my left over bread packaged to-go.  This was a late lunch/early dinner.  I knew I would be hungry again before bed time.  So asking for a doggie bag was my way of planning ahead.  I also wanted to save room for the cheesecake that brought me in in the first place.<br><br>For dessert, I ordered a slice of tiramisu cheesecake.  That combines two of my favorite desserts into one delectable sin on a plate.  Coffee soaked lady fingers for a crust, soft and fluffy cheesecake filling, a dusting of cocoa powder, and a dollup of chocolate whipped cream made this one delicious way to end my afternoon.  I&#39;d order that in a heartbeat (possibly my last heartbeat at the rate I&#39;m going with these dishes).  But there are so many other options to try.  This is the Cheesecake Factory, you know.  What kind of place would it be if it didn&#39;t have too many cheesecake options?  All the more reason to come back.

Decided to dine in for my birthday with my family that is visiting from out of state. Our server, Courtney was extremely rude and we could tell that she did not want to serve us from the start. She did not come check on us until after we had halfway finished our meal. Didn&#39;t offer any refills on our waters or beverages. Coming from the serving industry, I would never treat any of my tables the way she treated us. She checked on us maybe three times and tried to walk away as fast as she possibly could when we asked for something. Her section was not full but she was at the rest of her tables laughing and smiling with all of them. Even ran their food to their table. Then after we paid with cash, she kept looking over at our table to pick up the check while we were still enjoying our drinks and conversation. I have never felt more unwanted in a restaurant and I will never return to this location because of the service we received tonight. Courtney, do better.

When things go wrong here, they more than likely can go VERY wrong. We order this same meal a lot, and it usually takes anywhere from 10 to 15 minutes at most to be brought to the table. Last night after waiting just about twice that amount of time, we still had not been served. And during that entire time not once did we see our server to ask her what- the-f  was going on. After watching the next table get their food delivered.. (they had ordered AFTER us).. it was just TOO much. We asked to speak with the manager, told her our gripe.. and got up and walked out (went across the street and got a pizza in 10 minutes). <br>Our mistake was not sitting at the bar in the first place as we usually do.. servers there are captive in a smaller space, and glaring glances are not easily evaded.

I love restaurants that are always busy but also always have a seat for me.  The servers and staff at this location are second to none.  The menu is as diverse as you get with selections for every type of eater known to mankind.  Oh and let&#39;s not forget about the cheesecake!
Excellent service, great tacos and burritos. Consistent timely food with a great patio for cooler evenings.

I come here a lot just because of the cheesecake.   I just love it.  But dining here sometimes makes you don&#39;t want a come back. The reason why is my food never come out right sometimes.  The tables inside are so close to each other.  That&#39;s why I like seating outside. The food is a lot.  This place is always busy too.  Anyway, overalI I will still come back hehehe.  Can&#39;t stay away from those cheesecake.

Our family went to dinner last night and had a wonderful time.  Our server was very attentive and our food came out hot and exactly like we ordered it.  Atmosphere was nice.  The only shortcoming was the acoustics aren&#39;t really great so every ones voice seems to travel across the room.  <br><br>Great place to go and enjoy family time or a date night!

Wow what an improvement this place has made with the service issues since the last time I was here over a year ago and previous visits before that.<br><br>Dinner hour was pretty busy but I didnt get handed a beeper and wait like always. This time I was able to walk up and hostess seated us right away. <br> <br>Like I said the place was pretty slammed, but there was never a lag in wait time, and servers never doubted themselves, something that I had a problem with on previous visits. This time our server and the runners did a great job with taking our orders, getting our drinks, food and desserts to our table in a timely manner. We were always checked on, our drinks filled. Staff was attentive, everyone was friendly. No one seemed stressed out. <br><br>Only minor issue I had was when it got dark outside, the ambient lighting in the restaurant was too low.  We were cracking up because I was not the only table using their cell phone light to read the menu.<br><br>The SkinnyLicious menu was new to me and I&#39;m lovin it!  A lot of the items are low carb or low cal most under 500 calories. I would so order their Kale Salad and the Flatbread with Pear, Blue Cheese and Arugula again. Flavors tasted really fresh and it is noted on the menu they hand make these items to order.  Hard to imagine that healthier choices can taste so good and be low enough that I can have a slice of the delish Kahlua Cocoa cheesecake (better than the Tiramisu!)  and not feel to guilty having it since Im still under my calorie intake for the day. Sweet I can have my cheesecake and eat it too! <br><br>On the other hand the burrito and the chicken dish that were also ordered in our party didn&#39;t live up to the prices they charge for this (13.95 and 16.95) ..it looked and tasted blah. <br><br>With a very pleasant dining experience I had tonight, I wont be hesitant now coming here for lunch or dinner. Stars for improved service, healthier choices on menu and star rating for the killer dessert!

This review is a few months old, so take it with a grain of salt. <br><br>My son and I arrived around 7PM for dinner, and the wait was about what you&#39;d expect. I have a very timid palate, but I ordered items that I normally wouldn&#39;t and I was really impressed with the food quality. We ordered chicken taquitos and what were essentially mozzarella sticks for starters, the cheese was fine but the taquitos were excellent; I normally avoid onions and cilantro, but I ate it up greedily; these were the 2nd best thing about the meal. My son ordered jambalaya and I ordered a chicken Parmesan that was the size of the plate, thin and delicious. The angel hair pasta that was with it was some of the best I&#39;ve ever had; a deliciously creamy texture and perfectly flavored, I could&#39;ve eaten a bowl of it and been happy. The jambalaya was delicious as well. <br><br>The cheesecake however, was, somewhat underwhelming. Nothing wrong with it, but I expected to be blown away by it. For the dish being the namesake of the restaurant, I had expected something more memorable. Considering the fairly high prices (apps, entrees, desserts and soft drinks for two was about $120), I give it 4 stars, but the food was great.

I usually enjoy myself at the Cheesecake Factory.  This was my first time eating at this location and I really felt like this was the best service I&#39;ve ever received at any restaurant.  I believe the waiter&#39;s name is Tommy.  I could be wrong, but whatever.  He was on his job as far as customer service and making sure we were okay.  He did a great job.  Thumbs up.

We stopped here for desserts on Saturday, our server Robert was very nice and polite.<br>The Caramel Pecan turtle and the Ultimate Red Velvet tasted just excellent.<br>Will be back when we are in Vegas.

My fiancé and I enjoyed our first date at this location 3 long years ago and tonight we celebrated our anniversary here. We love the Cheesecake Factory. I get the Louisiana Chicken Pasta and my fiancé gets the Shrimp Bistro and they were great tonight as always. This location never disappoints and the staff is always welcoming! Thank you to Lindsey for serving us tonight

This is a wonderful place for filet mignonette. The salad is absolutely the best I have ever tasted. The service was extremely wonderful . They make you feel special. No matter how busy, you are treated as if you are their only customer. A hint, like a special cheesecake ? Try the Celebration. It is delicious enough if you took some home, you will wake up and eat it. From Janelle Lowrance.

I am writing this review for John S. in the bar, was so personable! We came in late after a Rebel game and welcomed us with stellar service and always ensured our glasses were full and our food was hot. While we were there, I noticed some regulars who he was greeting by name and vice versa. Hospitality at it&#39;s finest - thank you John!

Okay so this review is all over the place, bare with me. First off let me immediately shout out Kevin for being nothing less than awesome. Overall a 3, I&#39;ll throw a 5 in to the equation for how they handled their crappy Sunday services. 4 for how the food was because it was just fine. We show up on Easter with no wait and last minute plans so I was pleasantly surprised to find and get a perfect outdoor patio table immediately for 4, at 11:00 and then... no one shows up for a solid 10 minutes for drinks or anything. There&#39;s 3 other tables patiently waiting with us so I finally go to get someone when a manager sees me coming. She says someone will be right there which ended up being her and another manager...so Cecil(I believe?) comes over super polite and takes our order, drink and food. Food comes out and the order is wrong. I tell the girl we ordered the brioche French toast and she starts to walk away,  I say we can keep this one(the child&#39;s brunch) it&#39;s fine she says hold on and I say uhh ok or you can walk away while I&#39;m speaking to you (yes I&#39;m a little feisty now) she comes back and says I was just checking the order I said yeah and walked away right when I was speaking which was super rude. Fast forward to Kevin, he hears my comments, comes over, and takes our table right away from there on out it was perfect! I must&#39;ve made a stir  because the original manager came over and ended our service with 3 complimentary cheesecakes and a brioche French toast on them. I am impressed that they took responsibility for their slacking but man they really could&#39;ve saved like $40 with their better communication skills and personable etiquette(cough cough server girl) I&#39;m serious that if/when I go back I&#39;ll ask for Kevin because I could be wrong but I don&#39;t think he had responsibility for us and really stepped up.

This was the first Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to that wasn&#39;t sparkling clean. The avocado egg rolls were soggy, and my friend&#39;s spicy cashew chicken had a strange, chemical taste to it. She said it was the first time she&#39;d ever sent anything back in a restaurant. While I normally like Cheesecake Factory restaurants, I doubt I&#39;ll go back to this one.

Huge improvement over the last few years. <br><br>I have been to different Cheesecake Factories.  Upon first visiting this location in the District, I wasn&#39;t impressed.  After giving them another shot, I was pleasantly surprised of the vast improvement of service and food.  <br><br>Service here has been very attentive and friendly.  Drinks are refilled and food is served promptly.  Even the girls at the hostess station are more welcoming.  <br><br>The food dishes such as the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp is becoming my favorite dish served here.  There are plenty of chicken and shrimp surrounding the rice.  The spicy Thai sauce is filled with flavors of curry, peanut, chile and coconut.  Every bite is delicious.  <br><br>Of course it&#39;s hard to leave here without ordering cheesecake.  It is an extensive variety to choose from.  I have yet to try one I didn&#39;t like.  Plus the slices are so huge and easily split with someone.  <br><br>I&#39;m happy to say I&#39;ll be back soon for more.

Ask for Kyle at the gvr location. Best server i ever had at Cheesecake. By the end of dinner i wanted him to work with me and we had conversations about traveling all over the world. Great people person. And by the way the food was good too. Lol

I really enjoyed my food here! Very large portions so beware! They have a very good peach or mango adult beverage as well!  The cheesecake is wonderful.... of course the only reason I gave it 4 stars is because it is so pricey!

Great pancakes!! We tried the cinnamon and the lemon ricotta pancakes and they were both: moist, soft and delicious through and through.   This Cheesecake Factory location  is worth it... going forward, we will skip the breakfast buffets on the strip for the clean, spacious, great tasting pancakes at The Cheesecake Factory. The art work on the walls, the large parking area, our other meals items and the service= return visit(s).

kinda rude to friend, plus undercooked food. Overall bad. waiters be calling my friend a &#34;good eater&#34; like whaaaaat?? stop throwing dis shade at my friend at least he&#39;s TRYING to loose weight like

This is the best location I&#39;ve ever been to of the franchise. The bread is always warm, the service is outstanding, and the food is always very consistent. The vibe isn&#39;t the stereotypical vibe of a Cheesecake Factory, it&#39;s lively, fun, and caring.

Hac an amazing yime at this location. We had a party of 30 with one waitress her name was Sticks. When I say amazing and on top of it. She was pleasant, fun, &amp; vibrant. She could interact with the kids and the Adults. She also did not get one order incorrect. 30 ppl. The food was very good quality. Made very fresh. And all around we would definetly return here for a birthday dinner. Amazing.

Pretty average for a nice place to go out (that&#39;s not fine dining). Hostess said I would be sat in 5 minutes, instead got sat in 15 minutes which was disappointing. It is always better to overestimate on a wait time. The seat was not wiped off prior to me being seated which on a cosmetic and cleanliness level was a minus. Order the Farfalle...with Roasted Garlic. Chicken was a little dry, but the mushrooms had a nice flavor. Did get a shocking bite of garlic which was very unpleasant. My server, Claudia V, was perfect. Volunteered to box my food up for me which is a bonus service. Ordered the Lemon Raspberry Cream Cheesecake which was yummy, but not my favorite. It&#39;s more tangy than sweet so if you prefer that, than you&#39;ll enjoy this. Cheesecake Factory always nails their cheesecake flavors, I will give them that. P.s. it&#39;s a little dim inside so if you have a hard time reading, you may need to bring a light source.
Best Cheescakes ever! They are totally worth the wait! There coffee is freshly brewed too! Every time I&#39;ve been there the food has been excellent and the customer service superb!

Came in for happy hour our server Phillip  was absolutely amazing! He was very friendly and quick with everything, made our visit a pleasure! Portions are huge drinks are delicious. Wish there were more servers like Phillip!

We were told the wait would be 1 hour and as of right now, we are at two and a half hours. They kept telling us ten minutes. They just said we were waiting on one table to finish their meal this while time! Why not seat us on a different table. People coming in after us all got seated and we are now the only ones left.

A great classic American fusion style of food! My boyfriend and I go here all the time and always have great, fast service and food! I love their pastas and appetizers and my boyfriend loves their steaks! So far never had a bad experience at this location. The food prices are fair and decent portioned, clean restrooms is a plus! <br><br>When coming on the weekends though, make sure to come 30 minutes-1 hour earlier than when you normally eat because this place is hopping with people and the wait can be taxing to those who are impatient. <br><br>Try the Avocado Spring Rolls! (Make sure to ask for two sauces not one, it&#39;s super delicious!)
This place is over priced, then on half off cheesecake day they don&#39;t have enough staff. Very slow We left

Came for lunch on a Saturday with my family and had a relatively short wait time. We had an awesome waitress named Sara. She was personable, kind and attentive. There was some older people sitting across from us who also commented on how awesome Sara was. Our food came and I was so hungry that I ate it before I remembered to take a picture lol. I will be back again !

HOLY MOLY - Sunday Brunch was so delicious yesterday!  The lemon ricotta pancakes were some of the best we&#39;ve had in quite some time.  My lovely partner has been jonesing for those for quite some time and we finally found the scratch for her itch.  My spinach, bacon and roasted tomato eggs benedict was very tasty - nothing too out there but overly enjoyable.<br><br>The munchkin went with fried calamari for an appetizer (shared by all, though we couldn&#39;t finish it - soooo big!) and then had the bacon bacon burger (sans cheese or sauce).  The bacon on this burger, though - TO. DIE. FOR.  I&#39;m totally going back to the Cheesecake Factory soon JUST for that burger.  With cheese.  And sauce.  Because that&#39;s how I live.

Disappointed.   We have not been to this location in some time. Went here for dinner for birthday and my husband ordered his usual ribeye dinner.  I dont know what they served him but it was not a ribeye.  The manager came to our table to tell us that&#39;s what THEIR ribeyes looked like. <br>He ended up not eating anything.  I ordered my usual but it was a much smaller serving than usual from another location.  I&#39;ve always loved The Cheesecake Factory but we will stick with the location we normally go to.

The Best Cheesecake on the menu is the Strawberry Lemon hands down.  Its got a bottom layer of cake that absorbs and holds the strawberry syrup.  Not too rich, and not too far from the classic cheesecake taste.  They can get too far away from cheesecake with stuff like the Oreo cheesecake, I&#39;d rather just have Oreo ice cream at that point.<br><br>This CCF is in a great location in the district at Green Valley.  It is your standard CCF with really dim lighting.  Sit outside if you can because it&#39;s a lot quitter and scenic.<br><br>I tend to try to get Entrees that are more on the exotic side, it tends to pay off better than standard stuff.  The Jamaican Pepper shrimp is a celebration of flavors in your mouth.  I also like to get a post meal alcoholic shake like the flying gorilla.  Then sit around for another hour sipping it to annoy the waiter.
We&#39;ve been to cheesecake many times over the years &amp; they never fail to make our experience nothing short of amazing! I highly recommend dining here :)

I was so looking forward to having a good meal never did I think I&#39;d be sending my food back for a refund. Appetizers were delicious, zucchini sticks, macaroni balls, crab cakes, stuffed mushrooms and sweet corn tamale cakes satisfied my hunger. I ordered the fried cat fish...WAY to fishy not mention bland as all heck! Our server was fantastic, Mike took care of us and constantly checked in. Great service mediocre food.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE the Lasagna Verde here! Ate here almost a week ago and was craving the lasagna so bad that my boyfriend and I went again today.. Both times our waitresses were horrible. No attitude but did not check on us at all and didn&#39;t make sure we had all we needed.. Waited crazy long for bread and even had to hunt them down for more bread.. It seems they&#39;re trained this way. Today I watched my waitress play in her hair for 4 whole minutes before grabbing my bread.. Let me tell you.. Disgusted isn&#39;t even the word.. Anyways, the hostess&#39;s are always nice to us if that counts for anything. I&#39;ll be checking out the Factory closer to my home next time and I&#39;d advise everyone to find another also.

This place sucks for customer service!!!  2 people want a booth for lunch ( wife and myself ) and already waited a half hour... WTF??!!  This place has tons of booths but, none for us.....never fails in this crappy town but, like always we are use to the typical Vegas restruant joke for seating. I guess we are the stupid ones for waiting this long....if if I were you id pass and go across the street.

Very busy restaurant. Why, I don&#39;t know. Food is barely ok for the prices. The filling inside the potstickers was dry and tasteless. The chicken and shrimp gumbo was nothing to write home about. Nice place to take a date to impress but that&#39;s about it. Would not go again.
Just ate here with my girlfriend and had an awesome meal!  Everything was soooo delicious and our server Brittany was very friendly and attentive.  Looking forward to coming back soon!

Called last Thursday a To-Go Curbside order. The man who took my order was very cordial, let me know they had gotten pretty busy already. I got to the parking lot and the curbside attendant was getting someone&#39;s card and before I could even call them she came to my car for my payment because she already knew my order was packed up. Prompt polite service, food was delicious, and will be back to try a different cheesecake this week! (:<br><br>Also I am kind of a salad freak- many places like Olive Garden and Chili&#39;s have that out-of-a-can dressing taste where there&#39;s either not enough or too much but CF has their Caesar salad down PERFECTLY. I&#39;m not even a crouton person but whatever they use is amazing.

We had the worst experience at this Cheese Cake Factory location. The waiter and the manager was passive aggressive towards us for asking to correct the bill after the waiter over charged us. Customers beware the waiters at this location will up charge on you a specially for extras like extra dressings for your salads don&#39;t fall for it. We recommend eating at a different Cheese Cake Factory location. We will never eat at this Cheese Cake Factory location again! Also we observed that the silverware was dirty with dried food found on it.

I went out to eat with my family tonight to eat at Cheesecake Factory. My family and I often choose to go here when we do go out. This location is always busy. I highly recommend to get there early if you have big groups. We were only four people and waited 10-20 minutes. You have the option of sitting inside, outside, or whatever is first available. We chose to sit inside.<br><br>Once seated, our server, Nathan, came by with waters and bread. The bread basket consisted of sourdough bread, a wheat bread, and white bread. I ordered a raspberry lemonade and it was pretty good. I definitely like the strawberry one better but it&#39;s not bad if you want to try something new.<br><br>My family and I ordered the avocado egg rolls as our appetizer being that it&#39;s our favorite whenever we come. It was perfectly fried and the avocados inside were delicious and ripe.<br><br>I chose to order a new dish tonight so I went for the farfalle pasta with chicken and roasted garlic. I&#39;m a huge fan of bow tie pasta so I had to try it. Once I received it though I was a bit underwhelmed. The pasta was cooked perfectly but the chicken was okay. They also left huge chunks of garlic in the pasta so if you&#39;re not a garlic fan, ask for it without it. The pasta wasn&#39;t horrible but it definitely wasn&#39;t the best I&#39;ve had there. I feel like I&#39;ve had better farfalle at other restaurants. Besides the pasta, everything relate else was great.  <br><br>We ordered dessert to go (red velvet cheesecake and cherry cheesecake). Red velvet is THE best! It&#39;s part cake and part cheesecake--perfect combo! <br><br>Our server Nathan was awesome and made sure we were always taken care of during dinner. It made the experience much more enjoyable. I will be coming back for sure because I just love Cheesecake Factory :)

My 1 rating is for the service I received earlier tonight! I went in for dinner with my 18 month old daughter and when we got seated the server quickly came and asked for our drinks I asked for a sprite for me and a apple juice with half water no ice for daughter. He immediately went in to asking me if I was ready to order. I asked him for the soup of the day and he said it was chicken tortilla so I looked at my daughter and said soup sounds good and I proceeded to ask the waiter if it was spicy and he said oh yes it&#39;s extremely spicy I said OK let me think his response was so do you need another minute? I said mmm no I&#39;ll get stuff mushrooms and for her the kids Alfredo sauce I asked if I can get it with chicken he said sure if that&#39;s what you want. We waited a few mins no juice yet he had only brought me my sprite. A few more mins passed and he had a tray of bread in his hand I taught that was ours n said thank you but quickly realized it was for the table next to us since that table had bread he dropped it of. After a few mins he realized my daughter did have her juice and said oh let me go get the apple juice. Our food finally came but not once asked how was our food. He definitely asked the lady&#39;s next to us how their food taste did everything come out well etc. After a few mins of eating my daughter had it with the high chair and wanted to be carried (just to clarify she wasn&#39;t screaming or crying etc she only raised her hands and gave me the sign to get her out) I was carrying her still eating and the waiter comes and points at my daughters plate and says should I pack this to go. I said hmm sure after being shocked by it. As I finished eating he immediately proceed to ask if we wanted the check or any dessert  at the point I was uncomfortable and in tears that all I wanted was the check and to run out! I felt as if the service I got different from his other tables was because I had a child. I felt discriminated for having a child.
Service was great, food was delicious.  Just a little pricey for the dessert serving size.

I had a wonderful experience in this Cheesecake Factory. I want to recognize Brandon who is a manager at the Cheesecake Factory. We had a small issue and he resolved it and exceeded our expectations. We come to this cheesecake all the time. We love it here. However when we come here it feels regular and the attention we receive was very warm and friendly something that I personally feel is missing from our dining experience. I&#39;m very happy.
The Romano Crusted Chicken is delucious. Their version of Chicken Parmesan is delicious also!

I forgot how much I like this place. I wish they didn&#39;t have so many items on the menu though. I&#39;m horrible at deciding what to eat, and with a million choices it makes it that much harder for me. I looked at the menu for a good 20 minutes. I finally chose the bbq bacon burger. It came piled high with crispy onion rings, bbq sauce and bacon. It was deelicious! I got a side of the ranch to dip my fries into and it&#39;s the best Ranch I&#39;ve ever had. It&#39;s garlicky and has a bit of a kick to it. So good. You can purchase a jar to go, FYI. My other half had the pasta carbonara with chicken and he really liked it. Others in our party had bbq chicken pizza, fettuccine alfredo, corn dogs and a club sandwich. Everyone seemed to enjoy their meals. <br><br>Now you can&#39;t go to CCF and not order cheesecake. I spent another 20 mins deciding which flavor I wanted. I finally chose the oreo and it was amazing. I also got to sample the smores, reeses, and banana cream pie cheesecakes. They were all pretty good. The reeses has an over powering peanut butter flavor which I didn&#39;t really care for. The smores one was really good and the banana cream was good as well. I can&#39;t wait until they have their pumpkin cheesecake. I love that you can walk in and just purchase cheesecake by the slice without having to dine in. I will be back.

Haven&#39;t been to eat here for awhile. Food was great. Service was excellent, I think his name is Ross or Rob (handlebar mustache guy). Sorry bout the name, a little noisy for a Sunday afternoon. He was patient, friendly, and helpful/attentive. Best server/service we have had in quite some time. We will be back, because of him.

My kids love CF.  The menu is ginormous, there&#39;s bound to be something on there for everyone. I personally like the Baja chicken tacos or Thai salad, they are on the lite menu. My hubby enjoys a few things, chicken masala, the burgers or the jambalaya are his usual picks. My daughters usually get the kids marinara pasta, the chicken dumplings (an appetizer, but they eat it as a meal) or nachos, which 2-5 can share. <br>Of course, the cheesecake is what they really want, and it is pretty delicious if I do say, all 3577326786 calories a bite. It&#39;s not like we eat cheesecake everyday though, so it&#39;s okay. The chocolate lava cake is quite good, as well. <br>Service has always been consistent and friendly, however, weekend nights be prepared to wait at least 30 for a table.<br>Prices are average for that type of restaurant, a couple cocktails, 4 meals, a cheesecake or ice cream is around $100. Minus tip. <br>It&#39;s s go to for us on a Friday night after the kids sports stuff. <br>And as the infamous quote by Marie Antoinette says, &#34;let them eat cake.&#34;
Love their enormous menu, especially the &#39;skinny menu&#39;. <br>Excellent service! <br>Fantastic cheesecake, it doesn&#39;t get much better!

I normally go to the CCF in Boca park, but a friend and I decided to try this location. It was around 2pm and upon entering we saw an older woman at the hostess stand. She glanced up at us, then looked back down. No greeting whatsoever! So I said hello there is 2 of us and she never spoke to us. How rude! CCF needs to realize in a huge way that the hostess is your first point of contact to your guests, and if they don&#39;t acknowledge or greet your paying customers, well....<br>Fast forward a month or so we decide to give this location another try (December 6, 2017). We see the same older woman now working with a hispanic looking young girl. Let me say this...the young girl couldn&#39;t even speak proper English and had no personality. That&#39;s it CCF, get your act together. Hire people on your front line who are personable, friendly and know how to greet the public!! It&#39;s not that hard to do!

Just like with all cheesecake factory, prepare to wait a LONG time to be seated and to actually eat. We were there with a large party to celebrate my uncle&#39;s bday. It doesnt make any sense for restaurants not to take in reservation on weekends for large party. Anyway we got there a little after 6pm and waited an hour to be seated. Once seated, we waited another 30mins or maybe more to get our food. Kudos to our server for (1) getting all 12 orders right and (2) providing excellent service to all of us.   I can&#39;t complain about our food as we all liked our food.

Such bad service, my milkshake was watery, food tasted so bad and tastes like it was sitting out for so long. The waiter kept disappearing then came back with attitude. Been here multiple times and it&#39;s just been bad. Wouldn&#39;t recommend going to this location.

What a classy place! The Cheesecake Factory is awesome because it can be treated as both a high class restaurant or a casual hang. It&#39;s definitely a multipurpose restaurant. The staff is beyond friendly and the vibe of the restaurant is really relaxing. <br><br>The one thing I&#39;d be aware of is the wait. At dinner time, the wait can be pretty obnoxious so call ahead of you can. Other than that, this restaurant is top notch in my eyes.

Went for a late dinner last night, there were a good amount of people but the place was not even close to being full.  Our server Cynthia was awesome however the kitchen was the slowest I have ever seen here.<br><br>We were seated right away and waited a bit for her to come over, but once she did we got drinks really fast and order taken pretty fast an then waited and waited and waited.<br><br>Our server had a great sense of humor an made sure our drinks stayed filled, offered more bread and really made the overall experience am enjoyable one even though it seemed like it took the kitchen forever to get our food out.<br><br>Once the food came, everything was prepared just as ordered and was good.  I would definitely go back as the food is good and our server, one of the best we have had there in a long time.

We usually make it here at least a couple of times a year. This time, we were influenced by $50 in gift cards to dine on a Wednesday night around 7:30. Our party of seven waited about 15 minutes outside before we were greeted by our server who was kind enough to come outside and lead us inside to our table. The menu can be overwelming with endless choices. But that is good for our group which has a pretty wide spectrum of preferences. There hasn&#39;t been too many changes to the menu over the years with the small plates and Skinnylicious options being the most recent to me. For the rookies, don&#39;t go hog wild on the bread, because you won&#39;t be able to finish your three-serving portion entree.<br><br>Our order was pretty varied which included two entree salads, three sandwiches, a pasta dish, and the filet medallion off the Skinnylicious menu for me. There was plenty of &#34;filler&#34; vegetables and not a lot of beef for my entree as expected, but the vegetables were cooked and seasoned well. The pasta dishes have never really impressed me, but the salads are surprisingly good. If I don&#39;t get a steak dish, I&#39;ll usually get the tuna tataki salad which is a very flavorful salad. Everyone was happy with their meals with over half us needing take out boxes. We finished with two pieces of cheesecake. Over time, I&#39;ve found that I prefer cheesecakes without any cake mixed in like the fresh strawberry, banana cream, and salted caramel.<br><br>I do have to comment on our server who left a good first impression by greeting us outside, but everything else really wasn&#39;t up to par. To add to the rehearsed, corny jokes where the response was crickets chirping after each one, he had no organization of our orders. Stating that I was seat 1 when taking drink orders and my daughter was seat 7 sitting across from me at the end of the table, he had no clue who drank what when he brought the drinks out, auctioning each one and running back and forth across the table. He forgot my mother and wife&#39;s glasses of wine, didn&#39;t notice they were without beverage after three return trips to the table, and he had to be reminded by me to grab them at the bar after 15 minutes. Then he did the always annoying checking every three minutes if I had signed the receipt after he ran my credit card. Which meant he was cut and wanting to bolt, but you don&#39;t want to perturb the person that is signing off on your tip.<br><br>Before gift cards were discounted, our check was a reasonable $163. What you&#39;ll get with Cheesecake Factory, as you will with other successful chains, is consistency. They need that consistency to handle the amount of volume that comes through the doors. The food and atmosphere in this location are also consistent with every other restaurant. The changing variable is the service, which is usually a hit. It comes down to whether you think that consistency is good, and I would tend to agree with most Yelpers that it is A-OK.
