Can&#39;t really review the food, but the hostesses in the two nights we TRIED to go hear were awful!!<br><br>First time didn&#39;t expect an hour wait &amp; the hostesses were not polite about the wait.  <br><br>The second time we expected to wait an hour for a table, not wait an hour to talk to a hostess.  When we approached the hostess stand to put our name down, 3 young ladies standing there , 2 doing nothing.   I asked one girl (that was not doing anything) how long the wait was, she pointed to the girl doing something, and said ask her.  I tried multiple times to ask the other girl, but she ignored me.  Even when she was doing nothing she continued to ignore. <br><br>We left the second time &amp; debating if there will ever be a third. <br><br>Did finally make it back, but doubt a return.  $150 for 5 people for burgers &amp; 3 pieces of OK cheesecake.  No alcohol!  Food was ok, great service though. Not worth the hassle for the $$

Sorry that I even have to give this place one star our waitress had us sitting at the table for an hour with nothing but bread next thing the main course shows up not the appetizer then she has an attitude and tells me we did not order an appetizer when we did. Then she remembers we did and says she forgot about it. We didn&#39;t stay to see how the rest of the evening would go because once things go in this direction it only gets worse finished our wine paid for it and left.

Always a good stand by when you have no idea where to eat. The food and service is always good, never been to a bad Cheesecake Factory. The menu is huge so there is something for everyone, plus the cheesecakes are delicious.<br>Bistro Shrimp, Kobe Burger, Louisiana Chicken and Pasta are some of the dishes we always seem to get. Tuxedo Chocolate, White Chocolate Macadamia, Vanilla Bean are the cheesecakes we tend to drool over.

I was not impressed. Despite not being very busy the service was extremely slow. I was there to celebrate my Mom&#39;s birthday and her food was brought out several minutes after everyone else&#39;s. She had soup, salad and a sandwich. How hard is it to get that timed right to come out with the rest of the meals? My pasta was over cooked and quite bland. I&#39;ve always enjoyed other locations so hopefully they were just having a bad day.

I went here to eat and we try&#39;d explaining what we wanted to order and instead of canceling the order and coming back to ask what we wanted or trying to accommodate with us with what she could. She decided to put in our order without even coming back and asking. Then got mad/ laughed at us and didn&#39;t give us any type of respect. Then when they took it off our recite and gave us a free cheese cake she decided to put it down with an attitude and laugh and walk away. Then she had her fellow  employee tell us to have a good day because it&#39;s beautiful as she is laughing swiping my card. The over all disrespect was ridiculous. Will never go back again after that.

Hands down always delicious!!! Consistency is definitely key here.  You&#39;ll never be disappointed.  Vanilla Bean Cheesecake!!! The BEST! <br>Chicken Madeira &amp; Steak Diane, to Die for! <br>Jambalaya &amp; Gumbo BOMB.COM

Hello<br>I was at this location for a business lunch meeting. Ordered a Coke and noticed that in the coke was a giant plastic nozzle piece of some sort. I told the server and all he did was grab it and take it away then brought back another coke. There was never an apology from the server nor did the manager get notified of the situation.  It was as if nothing happened or wasn&#39;t a big deal to the restaurant team.  Very disappointed in the service and will not return.
We eat here a few times a month. Food and service  are always consistently good. My favorites are the orange chicken and the Thai coconut curry. Never disappointed.
I love Cheesecake Factory!!!! My family love coming here everything on their menu sound delicious. Great customer service

We had such a great experience here. We were seated in a comfortable booth near a window to look out of. Ambiance was very nice and food was very delicious. I highly recommend the peach smoothie! It was so tasty and refreshing. What made our dining experience special was the amazing service. Chris Newman was our server and he was able to recommend us items from the menu, made sure we always had everything we needed, and overall had a warm energy about him. Overall great experience at this location!

The food is good, the service was excellent (thanks Bernardo) but they are so disorganized at the front door it&#39;s not worth going to this location when they are busy. We got there early 6pm but I&#39;m warning you, if you see a line, get back on Yelp and find another place to go or commit yourself to waiting double or triple the time they tell you. Some may think the food is worth the wait, but it&#39;s Las Vegas- there are many, many restaurants to choose from. <br><br>Everyone in my party complained about the lighting and I noticed people at other tables using their cellphone lights to read the menu. The general experience was so annoying we took our cheesecake home. We had someone in town and I regret spending two hours there. Our server was so good it probably deserves another star, but the first impression really ruined it for me.

This place was really good. Went to celebrate my moms birthday here. I like how big the booths are perfect for large parties. Also we came at a great time, before the dinner rush. The service was great and the food was good. I tried the crab cakes which were great. I had the spaghetti and meatballs. Huge meatballs with great flavor and very moist. We had the lunch entrees which were huge. Enough for leftovers. Most commercial chain restaurants do not offer their lunch menus on the weekends .Cheesecake Factory you still got it.
What a shame-after waiting two hours for our meal we were told just another 10 minutes, new manager in pink shirt is ignorant, we walked out
Always the best service here! And legendary cheese cake  <br>Almost always busy busy, but i&#39;ve never had a problem with my food or waiting too long! Loveeeeee it here always been a favorite

we came here for dinner tonight for the first time to this location! the atmosphere was nice and the food was beyond amazing! our waitress christine was super and went above and beyond to ensure we were doing good throughout our dinner! we ordered the signature  strawberry lemonade to drink it was super good we had like drank 3 cups of it ;-) hahha !!! we got the shrimp dynamite for appetizer and it was one of the best tempura shrimp we&#39;ve ever had,  my husband ordered the bacon bacon burger and he enjoyed it alot it was the perfect size for him ! i got the shrimp scampi with the steak diane and mash potatoes, it was soooo good , the meat was super tender and sauce was so good , the shrimp scampi was super good as well!!!! we decided to get strawberry cheesecake and that was soo good to top the dinner off! we highly recommend this location and they deserve 5 stars!!! we will be coming back again!

L)Amazing that I have passed this restaurant ten thousand million time<br>as its about 2 miles from my home.<br>Well I was invited to a business lunch on Sat at noon....not a good time or day as this very large restaurant was crowded to the rim. Surprised at the great service. There is something for everyone on their giant menu. I ordered the Cuban sandwich. While is was super sized the quality was not up to pare. The <br>Cuban cafe off of the 215 and Eastern has the real deal. The other 5 guests all<br>enjoyed their fare.<br>The selections of cheese cakes were amazing and New York quality. My choice of the 2 chocolate Hershey was over the top. 5 stars and 5 million calories.The only downside was that<br>prices tended to be somewhat higher then other similar fair
Avocado eggrolls and thai lettuce wraps yummy. Love this place. It is amazing there..

Have been there twice recently.  The food was great, portions were huge.  The wait staff was amazing!!!  Dante and Elisa are terrific at what they do.  Very attentive,  very quick.... not over bearing.  And the best personalities.  Definitely on our list of regular places to eat.

Someone please fix those outside tables! I enjoy coming here so much and when I do I like to sit outside with my family, but those tables are as unsteady as they come. Something is wrong when the waiter and you are adding menus and napkins on the bottom to avoid the table from being woobly. No concern with the food, everything is delicious and waiters are usually friendly, just fix those tables please!

Carissa was our cashier &amp; guide to the wonderful world of cheesecake. We told her we all had different food allergies,  mine being wheat.  Mom is lactose intolerant &amp; bf can&#39;t have certain fruits like strawberries. <br><br>She informed us it&#39;s cheaper to buy a cake by the half sizes but we couldn&#39;t do it.  She was understanding.  We left happy &amp; boy that chocolate mousse cheesecake was mMm! Thanks Carissa D! :D

I&#39;m very disappointed .. I was in a hurry I called in a order for two pasta plates I was asked do you want the lunch or dinner portion I said two lunch .. it was close to 3:00 I get there it was real busy but it took 10 mins before they noticed I was there when I get my order it was 1 lg dinner .. I don&#39;t even have time to to wait .. and I couldn&#39;t even communicate with the girl she didn&#39;t speak English and I don&#39;t speak Spanish ... just real disappointed is all

The good: My favorite appetizer here are the Buffalo Blasts, they taste so good, but are so bad for you. The food was good, as always. I really liked the smores cheesecake we had for dessert. <br><br>The bad: I was here on a Thursday night and the place was packed. Service ran quite a bit slower than normal; we had to ask auxiliary staff for water and bread to tide us over until our food came. Our server seemed overwhelmed, so that made her more short (but not rude) than maybe she usually is. <br><br>I usually get great service at the Cheesecake factory, hopefully things will be better next time.

We don&#39;t often eat at The Cheesecake Factory, we met with our extended family for a Sunday meal. Our experience was stellar, thanks to the effort of our Server - David. He is one of the best servers we have had at any restaurant ever!

Good place, if you&#39;re a tourist. <br><br>I wanted to like this place better but it&#39;s just typical corporate. <br><br>Yeah food is good, you won&#39;t go wrong but - I will say this. They really should lessen the menu. It&#39;s overbearing to look through 50-60-70 things. <br><br>A great restaurant offers less but greater value. <br><br>Of course the cheesecake is good. But nothing beats grandmas. <br><br>I&#39;ll pass next time.

Well Im a fan of the cheesecake and the food I usually order has always been quite decent. This restaurant adheres to delivering in plastic boxes much safer than STYROFOAM. At least I ask for that. I will continue to order from them on occasion, as they are a little expensive but better is more money.
Very nice! Excellent food and service. Megan was a great server and very personable. We like this place.

Husband and I stopped in lastnight for dinner. We were sat immediately. About 5 minutes for our server to appear we order drinks then our meals.  30 minutes in to waiting for our meals to come out a manger comes over and apologizes for it taking so long explaining that the kitchen was confused by &#34; no garnish on green beans &#34; claiming they thought it meant no green then something about the green in the bread crumbs...whatever. Still waiting my food comes out I had the chicken Bellagio. The chicken was soggy and pasta was hard and dry where it wasn&#39;t covered by soggy chicken. The arugula was wilted down to nothing! So dissapointed at this point I&#39;d rather just go home. Another manager comes over and I mention the hard dry pasta and he brings out new in a bowl and it&#39;s swimming in the basil oil again whatever. Then I asked for more of the cream sauce and get it and try to eat something ate some of the chicken and gave up I was pissed and the meal just wasn&#39;t good. Sever gave us 2 menus for free cheesecake which was nice but I didn&#39;t want dessert I wanted dinner. When we ask for to go boxes I was given another container of both the basil oil and cream sauce...which was nice but I knew I wasn&#39;t going to use them. Husband&#39;s food he said was great. This is the 3rd time in a year that my meal has been less than great. Normally I just don&#39;t say anything but this is pretty ridiculous paying almost $20 for pasta that just gets thrown in the trash. Tried to see if I could salvage anything that was a flop to when I realized the extra container of cream sause was just a container of heavy whipping cream. Our server was great. Will bypass this location from now on.
The food was awful and overpriced.  However, the server was very friendly, personable and attentive

Planned a family birthday party here and we were so pleasantly surprised. Early arrivals found the bartender very pleasant and knowledgeable, and excellent appetizers.  Our server Mariye (aka Ilene), made our experience so much fun. She was quick, smart and had a great sense of humor. The miso salmon was exceptional. Great service, great menu!
Very good food and service. Good portions. The bread is great always refilling drinks without needing to ask. Would give 5 stars but my red velvet cheesecake tasted a bit stale for whatever reason.

Sat outside to enjoy the beautiful Las Vegas day we were having. Couple other parties out there enjoying the day like us. Clouds were coming and going so a nice little warmth of sun here and there. Then a party of 3 adults and 2 kids come outside and instantly complains about the sun..so down the blinds go. Ugh really! Don&#39;t sit outside then. It was beautiful outside and not hot at all! Mind you we spent $125 plus tip for 2 people and we don&#39;t get a say in the blinds. Ridiculous! Put a damper on the day for sure.  Second week in a row we were there thought we had found our Monday date day spot for sure but now I could care less about going back. Whatever
Ordered pick up, food was delicious even after a few miles lol and It was a very busy night! My new favorite location.
Always a good setting and great food.  The Almond Crusted Salmon Salad is a hit.  This is one of my favorite places in Henderson by far!  Did I mention the assortment of cheesecakes for dessert?
The desserts were soo yummi!!!! We had carrot cake and red velvet cheesecake! Definitely coming back!!  Our waiter was soo friendly and attentive!

Came here tonight and had a great experience!<br><br>Heather was the best server that we&#39;ve had here. We brought our 1 year old son with us and when she dropped off our drinks, she brought him sliced bananas. Our son is very impatient and likes to eat as soon as we sit. That was the kindest gesture that a server has done for us. <br><br>Thank you, Heather! You are awesome!

Had a great meal , Andrew had the Bistro Shrimp Pasta, he said it was amazing, I had Fish and Chips that were pretty good.<br>Bernardo was our server, he was great, fast and friendly, we have been to this Cheesecake Factory quite a few times and he was the best server ever.<br>Thank you Cheesecake Factory for such a great employee.<br>I hope this review is shared with him.

Came here last month on the 26th a few hours before closing just supposing to grab a quick bite before we head in for the night and we were very glad we did! To start our server Clayton was Fantastic! A seasoned waiter who knew exactly when to stop in when we needed something, Great demeanor and Very friendly (sadly a quality missing among some wait staff in many establishments today). <br>      The drinks were great! If you are a Bourbon fan make sure you try their Bourbon &amp; Honey cocktail along with their Sausage and Ricotta flatbread (two of our favorites after many visits to the Cheesecake).<br>      Most menu items are a generous portion, always food leftover to take home or share. Enjoyable atmosphere and beautiful designs inside restaurant itself, good place for a night out or casual date night! Cheesecake Factory is definitely a higher end casual establishment in which you will not regret paying a visit!

First time here, and  we had the salmon, burger and my son had the pizza (kids). My son had his Pizza straight away while we waited for over an hour for ours. He was restless and over it so we had to eat fast and go. The Salmon was overcooked and dry. My serving had fries which were stone cold. <br>Cant say we will be back which is quite unfortunate as we have been looking forward to coming here.

Came here for a late night snack tonight with my friend and our server was just amazing. I honestly cannot remember her name, but she was one of the servers working in the bar and outside as we had the lil booth right by the bar and hostess stand. She was so nice, attentive and always checked on us. She had short brown hair and we had the buffalo blasts! I hope you find her and let her know we think she rocks!!

Came here with a party of 8 for my friend birthday! The wait wasn&#39;t horrible for Friday (about 45min) but I have to say that the server nick was absolutely Amazing! He attended to our entire party well (refill in timely manner, always asked if we needed anything else CONSTANTLY) this guy is awesome! Great job Cheesecake Factory :)

The wait for was alright around 15-20 minutes on a Friday night. The bread at the beginning was really yummy. Super good food as well. The service was slow and we waited along time for the check, drinks, etc. Cheesecake is always a must!!

I confess...I get jittery and awkward inside when I start reviewing chains on here.  *ducks*<br><br>This is simply a review for the happy hour.  Since 2 nights ago we spent over $18 wasting money at China Tango across the street on soup and bad beef, I felt it relevant to tell the yelp world that Cheesecake Factory has a decent happy hour.<br><br>The bad: It is from 4-6 PM.  This was the one day in 2 years of living near CF that Eric R. and I both were home before 6.  He was on the phone with a friend from 5:15-5:45 when I finally asked &#34;happy hour or not?!?!?&#34;<br><br>We got there at 5:47 and our bartender Sam was cool and patient with Eric (he gets grumpy when hungry and wanted bread and a BIG water glass.  He says CF discriminates against water drinkers because my iced tea glass can eat his water glass).<br><br>With a big debate between 2 or 3 appetizers, Sam assured us they, unlike the evil elephant bar, give FULL appetizer portions for the $5 price.  We ordered 3: chicken potstickers, shrimp summer rolls, and tamale corn cakes sans sour cream.  Full portions they were.  Lots of food, multiple dishes, and my tea = $18.  Nyah Nyah, China Tango!<br><br>Therefore, when hungry near CF before 6 PM, meander to the bar area and have yourself a hearty meal at the hour of our grandparents.  There are deals on drinks too.

Love the food here &amp; usually a great time. Unfortunately, when we went to change our reservation &amp; the hostess said she would hold the name for an hour while we gathered a larger party. When we returned the hostess gave a massive attitude while informing us that they do not hold reservations , something she didn&#39;t feel the need to tell us before we decided to return in an hour. Unpleasant experience from a usually excellent restaurant.

We come here when we want to sit outside during the Spring &amp; Summer --- Sunday Brunch... we love the Ahí Tartar, White Chicken Chili w Brown rice... sooo Yumm...<br><br>Every time we come... we are treated well... never a bad experience... <br><br>Many good choices... Many filled w way too many cals... we choose wisely... ;-) District Local... 2 Thumbs Up!<br><br>Your constant companion,<br><br>~deirdra

I&#39;ve eaten at this Cheesecake Factory location many times and have never had an issue with the service or food previously. However, I had an awful experience today that warrants a one star rating. <br><br>In honor of national cheesecake day, the Cheesecake Factory is offering half price cheesecake. What a deal! And it is. But who knew that you&#39;d have to deal with snotty, rude and unprofessional employees in order to get your piece of the pie, or cheesecake, in this instance? <br><br>So I go in and it&#39;s busy. Like really, really busy. And of course it is! The best cheesecake on planet earth is half off! I go right to the counter line and after waiting for about 5 minutes (which was actually quicker than I thought it would be considering how busy they were) I got to the counter and get not so much as a hello, hi, what can I get for you? Nothing. Nada. Zilch. Just a girl staring at me waiting for me to place my order. Ok-they&#39;re busy and she&#39;s probably stressed. I get that. No biggie. <br><br>I requested 4 pieces of cheesecake - 2 Reece&#39;s, 1 snickers and 1 salted caramel. Alas, I was informed that it&#39;s only 1 piece half off per person. Since I&#39;m there by myself, I&#39;m basically only able to get 1 piece at the discount and the rest will be full price. No problem - it makes sense to put a cap on it so that people don&#39;t go crazy. I decide that I don&#39;t want to pay full price for 3 pieces and adjust my order to remove the salted caramel and just ordered 2 Reece&#39;s and 1 snickers. <br><br>I pay and even leave a small tip ($3) in the tip cup. I walk away from the counter and a couple minutes later she calls me back to get my cheesecake. I look in the bag and unfortunately there&#39;s 1 Reece&#39;s, 1 snickers and 1 salted caramel. NOT what I&#39;d ordered, paid and even TIPPED for! This, my cheesecake loving friends, is how the rest of my visit went - verbatim:<br><br>Me: Oh shoot, I didn&#39;t want the salted caramel. That was the one I cancelled. <br>Her: So what do you want then?<br>Me: 2 Reece&#39;s and 1 snickers. I&#39;m sorry. <br><br>* At this point she ROLLS HER EYES and SHAKES HER HEAD, takes out the salted caramel and walks away. I am so disappointed and feel like I&#39;m putting her out when in all actuality, it was HER that made the mistake and ME that was being apologetic about it. Huh? *<br><br>Me: (out loud and to no one in particular) Not sure what that attitude is all about. <br><br>The manager is standing there and overheard my comment and this is how the remainder of my visit went, again verbatim:<br><br>Manager: Well you know what it is, ma&#39;am? We&#39;re not even supposed to be doing this. <br>Me: You&#39;re not supposed to be doing what?<br>Manager: Giving half price for take out orders. We&#39;re actually only supposed to be honoring it for dine in customers. <br>Me: Well I certainly appreciate that you&#39;re honoring it but I don&#39;t think the attitude that comes along with it is necessary. <br><br>And at that point I got my CORRECT cheesecake and walked out. <br><br>It&#39;s unfortunate that the manager chose to defend his employee ROLLING HER EYES and SHAKING HER HEAD at me rather than apologize for her completely unprofessional and unjustified behavior. Like I said, I get that they&#39;re busy. I understand that it&#39;s a stressful job. And I definitely appreciate that they honored the discounted price when, apparently, they didn&#39;t have to. But as a customer, I should not be treated that way, especially when the mistake wasn&#39;t mine and I was kind and gracious even when she made the mistake. <br><br>Shame on this employee and shame on this manager (both whose names I didn&#39;t get, dang it). Hopefully their attitudes improve-for the sake of other customers who don&#39;t deserve to be treated so poorly.

You&#39;d think that clean eating and the Cheesecake Factory would not compute, but you can find clean eats most anywhere, even here at this chain restaurant.  Yes, it&#39;s a bummer not to indulge in their red velvet cheesecake at the end of the meal, but you don&#39;t always have to eat cheesecake just because it&#39;s the name of the place.  The Skinnylicious menu has many items to choose from that can be made even cleaner.  I&#39;m a big fan of the turkey burger, ordering it protein-style (without the bread), hold the mayo.  The side salad it comes with is good with its balsamic vinaigrette dressing, too.  The b/f and I had lunch there today and he had grilled chicken breast with brown rice and broccoli, also very clean.  I&#39;m a fan of being able to order our meals the way we want to here with no fuss from the staff.  Major kudos and it keeps us coming back!

Came here for a lunch/dinner with my family. We were sat right away. Hostess were friendly and welcoming. <br>Our sever was Sarah J. And she was awesome. We were also being helped by a guy but we didn&#39;t catch his name. They were both really attentive, and took great care of us. They even brought out some bread with slices of bananas for our baby. The food was delicious!! I had the chicken piccata (I think that&#39;s what it was called) and I highly recommend it! Amazing!

Great place to eat with the family. Excellent service and you&#39;re seated quickly. The food is always great and there are a ton of things to choose from. I highly recommend their Louisiana Chicken Pasta! Always on point. Love this place.

Hit the horrible service trifecta. Place is crazy busy. Our server, Melissa J, is super rude and snotty. Bailey asked for a plain bacon cheeseburger- she told him to look at the menu because they don&#39;t come plain and for him to tell her item by item what he DIDN&#39;T WANT on his burger. What part of plain is so hard. I looked at her and said &#34;plain&#34; meat cheese and bacon. Got another snotty comment. <br><br>Now I know why I hate this place. Thought I would give it another chance, figured a couple of years gave them enough time to get their crap together. guess not!<br><br>Server should thank her lucky stars she doesn&#39;t work for me - cuz she would be on the street quicker that you can say fired!<br><br>Server heard the kids talking about me writing the monster of a bad review, so she stood around when his burger was delivered and asked if it was plain enough! Seriously!

My best friend and I decided to come here for dinner tonight. When we walked in and  the hostess Nicole took care of us. We said we were under a time constraint and seated  us as soon as she could. She really made our visit! We we&#39;re so worried we were not going to have time to stop! Our waiter was David, he was so helpful when we were trying to decide what pasta dish to have! We both had the 4 cheese pasta dish, but she had marinara sauce and I put Alfredo in mine. They were both good. It was a 20 dollar dish, but I don&#39;t think it&#39;s worth that much. We did have a cheesecake! It was Bananas and cream! We highly recommend!

Horrible customer service. Front desk wasn&#39;t pleasant at all, understand it&#39;s busy but it&#39;s your job to take care of customers. Very unorganized. Love Cheesecake Factory but I&#39;ll travel across town to another location.

Went here to grab dessert on the way home after a horrific experience at another eatery. The fellow at the dessert counter was pleasant, very sweet &amp; helpful, and basically redeemed our evening. Next time we want a nice night out we will skip the BS at other places and just come to Cheesecake Factory. The service is awesome, the staff is unfailingly nice, and oh yeah - CHEESECAKE!!!
Great food and service! Ask for Deann she is very attentive and has great customer service. She was great with my 4 year old twins.

I had a small Fresh vegetable Salad it came with asparagus, green beans, tomatoes, cucumber, roasted beets, apples, Edaname, radicchio, romaine all chopped with vinaigrette. (So good it was lite nice for a Summer day)<br>Herb crusted filet of salmon came with a lemon sauce, mashed potatoes and asparagus.  <br>It Was A Lot Of Food! I only ate half of my salad and a couple bites of my meal. Our server was really nice I can not have any dairy and my salad came out with cheese once I let him know he corrected it and had another out within 5 minutes with managements apology.
Speedy service as usual Priscilla was awesome came in around lunch. Food was nice and hot. And had a great view of the dock. Never dissatisfied. Thanks cheesecake factory!

Service was POOR !! <br><br>Me &amp; my best friend came in to eat , waiting was minimum . Got sat down with drink orders , ordered our food , asked for bread . <br><br>Our servers name was SCOTT B. <br><br>The second time around we asked for bread again , I was already done with my plate by the time he noticed that we didn&#39;t have the bread we ordered. <br><br>Then I asked him if we could get a split check then he rolled his eyes ! <br><br>Poor poor customer service! Took him long enough to even give us a refill as well .

I ordered a plate with salmon the plate came out the salmon was raw sent it back and they re-cooked the same piece of fish, I knew this because the big piece I cut in the middle and took a bit out of was still there ! It was now very dry a little crispy I was upset and sent it back and didn&#39;t eat dinner and it was my graduation dinner for college and my family was In town I was very upset with the situation and the manager not really doing much about the situation and not being that sorry. However they gave us two slices of cheesecake free but it was a dinner of 6 of us.<br><br>UPDATE GOT A CALL FROM THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY AND THEY TOOK CARE OF ME FOR THIS INCIDENT, therefor this being my first bad experience they deserve a 5?

Wow, I have been to many Cheesecake factories and I usually love them. I have been  to this one a few times now and every time I leave I don&#39;t feel good ... Today again the food was very mediocre. Had chicken Marsala (Usually very good) and the meal was just terrible. The noodles tasted floury mashy ... The sauce was not done well and the quality of the chicken was just terrible. Ate half and returned it. At least the guy took it off the bill. Waiter was very friendly <br><br>Now I am thirsty, have a head ache and a stone in my stomache ... Just horrible. I won&#39;t go back to this one ... Done with it. Do not recommend!

Best restaurant in Henderson. Consistent food and friendly service. Pro tip - open seating at the. At when it is busy. Love the brown bread, ask for the BBQ ranch to dip your bread in. You won&#39;t be sorry!

Still love the cheesecake here though the prices seem to get higher as the portions get smaller service was excellent the wait staff could&#39;ve done more suggestive selling and there was a lack of excitement it felt very commercial. Food was good and was timely drinks were never empty and left with a belly full

The place has a good ambience and is clean, but you pay for it with the overpriced menu. The service is ok. The food lacked in seasoning and something as simple as their house coffee (served lukewarm) was below average.

Why do I have stomach pain after every time I visit at the Cheesecake??? I barely recovered from Saturday night meal there and again had stomach pain after I had the leftovers from this meal. I will never visit again. Not only their food is full of butter, but it&#39;s also bad for you.

Party of 10 , we were told wait is 45 minute ... after waiting for an hour and a half we were told by the manager that they are still waiting for 3 guests to leave in order to use their table. These guests have already finished eating, bill paid and table cleaned. They are just sitting there talking.<br><br>We asked the manager to get us another table, he said no<br>We asked him to move these guests to another table so they can continue talking and we can have our meal, he said no <br>We asked him to inform them that we are waiting, he said no<br><br>After Waiting for 2 hours and no table , we left <br><br>Not sure who&#39;s at fault here, Cheesecake Factory for not training their manager or the manager himself for having no clue how to run a restaurant <br><br>Either way they lost a regular customer.

There is no baby changing station in the Men&#39;s restroom. You know how very upsetting that is for a father to change their child&#39;s diaper on the dirty floor?? Why is there not a baby changing station? Yes the food service is great. The food itself is wonderful. But to not have a baby changing station in the men&#39;s restroom is very very upsetting. In fact I was livid......

First off I love Cheesecake Factory!! This location is great and never too busy! Our server was Tracy, she was EXCELLENT in customer service, gave us details and recommendations. Everything came out fast, hot and delicious! Tracy was very friendly and always smiling making sure everything was good. Overall, phenomenal!

What can I say, so many choices, so lil time.  Have tried numerous dishes, n never disappointed. Bring your appetite portion size giant. Cheesecake always creamy n delicious. I usually get it to go n enjoy later. Be prepared for a wait this is a very busy restaurant, but getting it to go is very easy also.
They have a really great happy hour I hate that it&#39;s only 4-6 most places are 3-7 but the food is very good and the drinks are cheap I&#39;ll definitely come back

Can&#39;t leave less than 1 star. Wow. <br><br>What can I say? Don&#39;t come here if you don&#39;t look like white bread America.. <br><br>Waited for 15 minutes to grab a couple slices of cheesecake in front of the case. Saw and made eye contact with 7 employees, but we got passed by and ignored.. <br><br>So... F this place, homemade is better anyway
Service by John was outstanding, top notch server. Food was cooked as ordered with a delay, but it was Sunday morning breakfast after all. Will be returning many times with service like that.

The food and service was great!<br>The servers name is Deann D she was one of the best polite, courteous, professional gave great suggestions. when food was delivered by food runner he checked to make sure the order was correct, the server who was very busy also came by to check to make sure the order was correct. It was nice that the food tasted as good as it looked. The taste, texture and presentation were spot on. The atmosphere was great a little noisy however that&#39;s too be expected at times. <br>Also spoke to manager that was on duty that evening agin polite, cretinous and happy to get our feedback.  <br> We loved it.  will definitely come back. <br><br>All this being said I wish to say to the people who gave bad reviews shame on you!  In my opinion some of you were simply trying to get a free meal. I am glad you didn&#39;t get it until you have worked in the food service business you have no right to complain. <br>Just because you have had a bad day there is no reason to take it out on someone who has a very difficult job dealing with people like yourself

We had a great little family dinner last night! All of our food and drinks was fantastic but the best part was our server Rami!! He was so attentive and sweet and our son loved him!! Great job! We&#39;ll be back soon!

Server Jessica was amazing! The place was packed, but we got lucky with self seating high-top tables. Because it was so busy, the bar was backed up. However, the cucumber mojito was well worth the wait. For an entree I got the parmesan herb chicken. It was *Donald Trump voice*  HUUUUGEEE and excellent. I will definitely be coming back!

Had a five star experience last night. Robert was our server and his service was on point. Our drinks were always full, and we were always being checked on. <br><br>We started with a Caesar salad and some lettuce wraps. Salad was very basic, but flavor was amazing. Perfect start. We had the portobello mushroom, garlic, ginger wraps. So amazing. Mushrooms sautéed to perfection. My boyfriend was very happy with the start of our meal. <br><br>We had the steak with medallions off this skinnylicious menu and we also had the chicken Alfredo.  The steak on our plate was amazing. Mashed potatoes with asparagus, roasted tomatoes, and steak medallions all layered on top made a perfect combo. Steak was cooked medium rare as requested. Juicy chicken and perfect al dente noodles mixed with the amazing flavor of the Alfredo sauce. <br><br>So happy. I also ordered a strawberry daiquiri. It was blended all the way through with no ice in the bottom like I experience from most places. Deliciously fresh flavor with just a hint of rum. <br><br>We had a slice of caramel cheese cake to finish it all off. Dinner was amazing. Great date night. Boyfriend was happy. So I am extremely happy.

This Cheesecake factory location is worth the extra drive. The servers are very courteous and attentive. No long waits like strip location. Make sure to save room for the ultimate red velvet cheesecake.

The cheesecake is wonderful but the service was incredibly slow. We waited at least 15 minutes to get drinks and bread at the beginning and then we got half of our meals after what seemed like a pretty long wait. It took another ten minutes to get two more plates delivered. The final plate, however didn&#39;t arrive at our table until after we&#39;d all finished eating. The manager did comp the seriously late plate, and it&#39;s easy to forgive a missed order but the overall slowness of the servers leads me to leave this one star review.
Food is always good service has its ups and downs try to avoid going 5-7 pm always super busy in there and takes about 30-40 mins to be seated

We had dinner at Settebello recently and nothing on their dessert menu interested us. So we decided to walk over to Cheesecake factor to share some cheesecake.<br><br>It was a Saturday night and the place was jammin. Although, it seemed as if maybe they were short staffed, because at least 1/2 the restaurant was empty, but we had to wait to be seated (along with 3 or 4 other parties in front of us).<br><br>Once we were seated, it took between 10-15 minutes for our server to approach the table. This wasn&#39;t a big deal, because we had already eaten and it gave us time to decide on what slices to order. But if I were hungry, I would have become hangry real quick.<br><br>We decided to order 3 slices (all cheesecake): Banana cream, key lime and Kahlua Cocoa.  Our server returned a short while later and let us know that they were out of the banana cream and key lime, which were the 2 we really were excited to try.  We were pretty disappointed and I wish he would&#39;ve known this when we ordered originally.<br><br>We then decided on the mango key lime and lemon meringue instead.<br><br>Now, it has been quite a long time (at least a few years) since I have been to Cheesecake Factory. They have a very large menu, and not many places can pull that off. However, the service was painstakingly slow.  We shouldn&#39;t be there more than an hour when we just ordered coffee/water and dessert. Although our service was very nice, I just didn&#39;t expect to be there as long as we were.<br><br>It probably took 20-30 minutes just to get our order.  I mean, come on! For 3 slices of cheesecake, which is obviously pre-made? A bit ridiculous.<br><br>Everything was really tasty, even if it was basically not what we originally wanted. We each had a different favorite - I actually quite liked the lemon meringue, which is not what I thought my favorite would be. The Kahlua Cocoa was really rich, but good as well. The mango key lime was probably my least favorite - I thought the mango over powered the key lime, but it wasn&#39;t bad by any means.<br><br>The prices were reasonable. Our check was $28 for the slices and drinks (1 coffee). Overall, I remembered why I hadn&#39;t been in so long, since there are SO many other options in the area. But I would definitely go back!

This review of the cheesecake factory is primarily based on service. Went there today for brunch and sat out on the patio. We got there at 11:45 and started off with an order of cocktails. I would say that we received our cocktails by noon which for brunch I can understand having to wait a little longer for drinks. We then put our food order in with the server Juliet. Egg rolls, chicken and waffles Benedict, and an omelette. So no exaggeration whatsoever it took literally almost an hour to receive our food. On top of it there were tables that sat around us three to be exact that had been there probably 10 or 15 minutes and received their food at the same time we did and we waited an hour. I am almost sure the server forgot to put in our food and to be honest if that was the case she should&#39;ve communicated that to us instead she barely even checked on us at the table. Then when we decided to mention that the eggs Benedict came out with the eggs over hard and she clearly stated that&#39;s not how they should&#39;ve come out she offered to pull the plate so they can make another one. Now let&#39;s keep in mind we already waited an hour for our food so why would we have a plate pulled to be remade. We felt like we were in inconvenience to our server. She didn&#39;t care about our experience because honestly when you go out for a birthday brunch I think what you are paying for is not just the food but the experience of it all!

I eat here every time I&#39;m in Vegas.  It&#39;s truly a personal favorite.  The food is fantastic!  There&#39;s something on the menu for everyone.  For me, at The Cheesecake Factory, it tastes like somebody cares.  Love this location.

Came in for lunch. The service was awesome! The food was delicious and of course the cheese cake was amazing! Our waters were always filled. Restrooms were super clean. you can never go wrong with cheesecake factory! I loved how some servers are out at work. Wearing rainbow ties. :)

this cheesecake factory was disappointing. came here wanting plain chicken strips and of course that just couldn&#39;t happen. Also, didn&#39;t appreciate the dirty looks from our waitress as well as the whole staff. (:

My husband and I highly recommend THIS Cheesecake Factory in Henderson, N.V.!! First of all, there is plenty of parking to be found and the area is very scenic as well! Now, onto the good stuff......The menu options and the customer service that we received from Terry Cola and Staff was OUTSTANDING!! You will be treated &#39;like royalty&#39; here and the food is super-fresh (gotta try those Summer Shrimp Spring Rolls while they last!!) and the Cob Salad we had filled me up (and that&#39;s not easy to do since I have a big appetite and love to chow down!). Do yourself a favor....If you find yourself hungry in Henderson, stop on into the Cheesecake Factory for Lunch/Dinner! You will not be disappointed!!

On a dark desert highway cool wind in my hair, the smell of the Cheesecake Factory was rising up through the air, OK I will focus now, bus seriously I am living in Henderson Nevada now and it kind of felt that way<br><br>Tried the happy hour here on a Tuesday night. Nice, comfy chain place, bar area was well lit, bartender was attentive and professional, definitely not lacking in service, 5 stars here. Stayed for 2 hours had a couple glasses of house Chardonnay, $5.95 &amp; yummy. Going to go back and do another Happy, this time with the food. Driving home I could have sworn I heard the nightman say we are programmed to receive, you can drive home anytime you want but you can never leave...

Decided to come to Cheesecake Factory with the family to celebrate my bday. It was busy so I get why the hostess forgot to give us a pager. Fortunately we were able to be seated within 20 min after checking in twice to make sure we weren&#39;t called. I&#39;m grateful they turned down the music cause I couldnt hear my family speaking. We ordered egg roll and calamari and the sauce was amazing with it. We ordered fettuccini, kids pizza, pork chop and veggie burger. All of which was just okay. Fettuccini was bland. Pizza did not have enough sauce, pork chop was overpowered by the Apple sauce. Veggie burger was different from last time where it consisted of beets while this time it was beans and brown rice. The server was under the weather and very curt but still friendly. Over all it was okay. Not a place I would go often but maybe once or twice year.

Recently took my family here for dinner on a Tuesday night. Horrible experience overall. First, the silverware was filthy. I mean, one spoon was literally covered in hardened food. It was disgusting. I pointed it out to a manager and she didn&#39;t even apologize. She just took the spoon and we never heard from her again. She didn&#39;t even bring us a replacement spoon!!<br>The service was slow and they screwed up our order. It shouldn&#39;t be that hard to serve four people correctly.<br>I know a lot of people love the Cheesecake Factory, but the management at this specific location really lacks. Pathetic service and just a general terrible experience.

One of my favorite restaurants! Their big menu has a lot of variety and it&#39;s truly a blessing if you&#39;re a vegetarian! Their avocado eggrolls are yummy and their eggplant parmesan is amazing!!!!! The eggplant is cooked perfectly and is crispy on the outside and tender in the center - not soggy. The pasta for the eggplant parm has pesto in it that is so delicious! Their cheesecake is my all-time favorite dessert ever. OK, some cons to be fair: this location is usually busy, tables are really really close together (feels like you&#39;re all in one party with your neighbors), and they do not clean the booth-style seating or their floors very well - you will find bread crumbs 9/10 times because they simply wipe the tables really quick in between patrons and a lot of the the bread crumbs seem to land on the floors/seats. Otherwise, great place to eat! I def. recommend!

MOST RUDE RESTAURANT EMPLOYEES AT THE DISTRICT. First, I called to make an order for pick up and I was put on hold for 12 minutes until I hung up and called again. The second time I was hung up on. The third time I spoke to the manager, Ashley(?), and she was abrupt rude and acted as if I was an inconvenience for calling. She transferred me to make the order and the girl who tried to take the order was rude as well. I gave up on calling AS YOU COULD IMAGINE! I love cheesecake factory but this one is just a complete mess. Saving you a trip, people!! I went to Sammy&#39;s Restaurant down the street instead and it was great(:

Server Jamie was great and nicely changed the dry, greasy, tasteless fish taco with the Vietnamese summer roll which was ok. Never order the fish taco. Stick with the cheesecakes. That&#39;s why it&#39;s called Cheesecake Factory. Although, my granddaughter had ordered the Chicken di pana and raved how deliciously well made it was, so I guess your experience here really depends on what it is you ordered.

I order take out from here at least once a week. The cashiers are always so sweet and friendly both on the phone and in person. I also love the variety of the menu and consistency of the food I order.

The 2-star is for their food, not their service. I don&#39;t have much to complain about the service, this is not fine dining so you def shouldn&#39;t expect a fine dining experience... I&#39;ve been a Cheesecake Factory fan since I was 18... I&#39;m so familiar with their menu and how the food should taste because I always order the same things every time. I ordered shrimp scampi and steak Diane today as usual, the presentation was horrible. Steak was over cooked and fries were soggy. I&#39;ve never been disappointed in my food in CCF but today was a first. I don&#39;t recommend coming here, maybe try a different location.

This location is in Green Valley just off the 215 freeway.<br><br>TOTAL meltdown in service. Slow and non apologetic about the service from the management. Wasn&#39;t just me, it was all tables and they keep filling em up no matter what. Was there 1 1/2 hours and couldn&#39;t even get dessert. CRAZY!<br><br>Huge food portions, blah nothing to taste but presentation of the food was nice.<br><br>Lack of leadership with excuses. Didn&#39;t really care too much about excuses as I&#39;m the customer and went with an expectation of quality food and professional service.<br>Neither was delivered on this visit.<br><br>I may or may not go there again

ONLY GIVING ONE STAR BC THE FOOD TASTED FINE. <br><br>The curbside to go service is a complete joke. I had problems last time with them forgetting half my order. I figured it was a fluke mistake and thought I&#39;d try the curbside pick up again. I placed my order over the phone and was told it would be ready in 15 mins. Great! <br><br>I go to pick it up, park in the designated curbside pick up parking spot, and call to let them know I was outside waiting. I WAITED 18 MINUTES!! They never brought out my food. My husband, growing more and more impatient, went inside to pick it up. They asked for the name of our order and when he told them, they were like &#34;oops you&#39;re orders been on the counter this whole time.&#34; How professional. Apparently the workers here can&#39;t do there job. Won&#39;t be back.

Came here on New Year&#39;s Day, partly because it was one of the only places open. Had a very anti-climactic meal here. We ordered crab and artichoke dip, which they were out of, so we split the cheese and artichoke dip and a Chinese chicken salad. Both were just ok. I ordered a strawberry lemonade and it was sooooooo incredibly cloyingly sweet. <br><br>Also, our server, though nice, left in the middle of our meal and the replacement server didn&#39;t come by for a solid 15 minutes. Eh. Not the best experience.

One of my favorite restaurant&#39;s for happy hour or any other event lol. I decided to try the salmon mashed potatoes and broccoli which was Delicious! I then finished my dinner off with the dutch apple cheesecake, smh, Amazing! The chunks of apple with the crumble mixed in is sooo good. I usually switch my cheesecakes each time but I  may be stuck on this one for a while.

We were seated quickly even with a long wait at lunch time. Our sever was patient even though we took turns ordering beers every time she came by  . We had the meatloaf and the veggie burger... Both perfect.  <br>My only complaint when I come here is just they the tap water is disgusting! (Worse than any other Vegas restaurant.) no problem, it&#39;s my fault for ordering tap water . Lesson learned. <br>On the way out we ordered a cheese cake slice to go.  I&#39;ve never tasted a fresh Cheesecake Factory cheesecake. IT WAS DELISH!

Stopped by for lunch and drank a green iced tea that I couldn&#39;t get enough of. Sat at the bar with Jennifer who was just the sweetest thing ever. I had tuna tartar and a salad, it&#39;s in the triple digits outside so thank you for having the ac cranked up. I haven&#39;t had  cheese cake in a while but know they are awesome , wouldn&#39;t mind one now.

&#34;CONSISTENTLY EXCELLENT&#34; One of my go to restaurants. Never walk away disappointed. They do it right. Great service every time. I enjoyed my Cajun Chicken. My mates enjoyed Cobb salad and Diana Steak. Topped of with delicious Key Lime cheesecake. Good reason this place always has a wait line!

Totally blown away by the amazing customer service our extremely large party of 25 received from David L. and Dante W. They were spot on with the orders, extremely friendly and professional. They totally rocked as a team and made our dinner go by flawlessly. Well done!
Still good food but when you want to get a banana cheese cake you also get rotten bananas. I love balut but this is gross for Cheesecake Factory.
Service is depending on how busy they are. They are pretty attentive though. Food always tastes fresh and servers are all friendly!

The packed parking lot speaks for Henderson locals who flock to this place well ahead of the dinner hour. We arrived at 5pm and still had to get on a waiting list for a table. The service, the menu and the atmosphere are top notch. My first visit because I thought it was a dessert place because of the name! Much more than could be anticipated and the appetizers, entrees and desserts were definitely a photo opportunity here.

The Chinese chicken salad was enormous and constructed perfectly. Even the lady sitting at the next table who ordered a less ornate salad quipped, &#34;I wish I would have ordered that salad.&#34; My wife had the Thai Coconut Lime Chicken with brown rice. She stated she could taste all the spices, with her dish looking like a picture as well. Speaking of pictures, why don&#39;t they have pictures of their cheesecake? I told the waiter I needed to look at the pictures on line on my phone before ordering 2 pieces to go. The Tiramisu cheesecake was outstanding.  The new Cinnabon flavor not so much-the layers looked good but way too sweet. Mike our server was very attentive and would request his section again on our next visit!

so i ordered steak diane with no garnish i get my food and it looks like i got extra garnish i tell server its not suppose to have any parsley she does not say sorry just takes my plate i wait 10 mins as my husband is almost sone with his mine comes and the crazy part our server walks by 3 times see i have no food and does not srop to ask why finally my food comes i ask server for manager because i looked like they just tried their best to pick the parsley off my food i show him he apologizes ans asks can they make me somethine else i state no i just want my food made right he brings food back 6 mins later corrected then server drops off menu and keeps walking manager comes back apologized again and says he told server desert was on them because what happened was not ok funny thing is server never told me they were comping cheesecake. My foood was delish as always when i finally got it right and lots of points to manager i see why he has his job he redeemed cheesecake factory for me

My family and I have been coming to this place for years, and for good reason! It is always packed because of the popularity but with the efficiency of the staff, they never have you waiting for too long. This time we had Gary as our server. Gary was very kind, funny and very engaging. My fiancé didn&#39;t know what kind of cocktail to have and he recommended a Georgia Peach cocktail which is pretty much now her favorite drink. The food came fast, drinks and service was spot on, and we ended the night with of course, their notorious cheesecakes. Always a fantastic place to go for any occasion!

Illyana is the best!!!! After having an absolute terrible experience a few months back at the Boca park location, this was such a great experience to have!!! She was super attentive, always made sure our drinks were full and she just looks like she enjoys what she does! Thank you illyana!!!!

My favorite place for great food day or night hands down. They have what must be the worlds best passion iced tea ever. Well my world at least. But pretty much anything on the menu is fantastic. I love the Renee&#39;s special with the chicken salad sandwich and salad AND soup. I can barely finish this. The lemon chicken piccata is amazing. The factory burger is amazing. The Asian chicken lettuce wrap tacos are great as a light meal. Oh yeah cheesecakes are great too lol but I rarely order.

Table 92  Server: Clayton H<br>Decided to take my two kids for dessert, started off ok.<br>All we ordered was a chocolate milk, a coffee, 3 waters and two slices of cheesecake.  After waiting about 13 minutes, we get our water, chocolate milk and coffee.   ...he brought creamer but no sugar and walked away.  After about 5 minutes I managed to flag him down and ask for sugar...took about another 5 minutes to get that.  Coffee was cold.  Tried to flag him down but would pass our table quite quickly, finally got his attention and said it would be about 5 minutes there was a new pot of coffee brewing...so now we&#39;ve been sitting close to 30 minutes and STILL have no cheesecake, my daughter is done with her chocolate milk and I&#39;m still waiting for my coffee...  he now comes out with my coffee and no creamer, I ask for creamer...when he comes back with the creamer...he plops it down on the table and states, &#34;are you okay ma&#39;am, you don&#39;t seem okay?&#34;  I tried to give him the short version of this and his response was, well i&#39;m sorry but as you can see I&#39;m very busy....i state...but all we ordered is cheesecake and after 30 minutes we STILL don&#39;t have that.   It was fairly uncomfortable...what was supposed to be a treat for my kids and I turned into this uncomfortable, unnecessarily frustrating situation.

This place is filthy...had sticky cherry or strawberry residue on the table and they lay out your utensils on the dirty table.  The utensils are filthy too.  They have food stuck to them and water spots.  A lady that was seating guests was not in any type of uniform and they picked up the extra utensils on the table that weren&#39;t being used and put them back on their drawers.  Gross...not eating here again unless they clean up their act.  The waiter was nice and the food was ok.  That&#39;s why I gave this review 3 stars instead of 1.

We live down the street and come here often. Always love the food. Service is sometimes good. Sometimes great. The other night GREAT. Our server was David L. We&#39;ve never been served by him before. I myself am a server and I take pride in providing great service. He was very prompt and polite. And his order timing was perfect. I accidentally spilled a few drops of sauce on my shirt and used my napkin with water to get it off. Before I know it he pops around the corner with some soda water for me. Wonderful. I will be sure to ask for him next time we go.

This place is awesome! Have not had a bad experience here yet. I come here with my friends all the time. The prices are really reasonable . For about $32 I got the fried macaroni balls , chicken picata  and a chocolate cake. The portions are huge. I always have so much left overs.The chicken Picata is always on point . Very moist, tasty, fresh, and hot. The servers are always very friendly also. They always made sure I was ok and filled my drinks on a timely manner. This is always my go to place when you family comes to visit. Highly recommended.
This one is absolutely amazing!! Buffalo blaats amd lettuce wraps. Killer lunch with my love

I wish I could give zero. What is the problem with this place &amp; take out cheesecake orders??? We have ordered twice now, first time wrong order, called and spoke with the manager.. supposedly we were getting a gift card for &#34;reimbursement&#34;, 2 months later and still haven&#39;t received the phantom gift card. Gave another chance today and low and behold, Another wrong order. Called Cheesecake Factory to let them know for the second time we had a wrong order, this time we were met with a put off hostess blowing us off saying &#34;we are so sorry, there&#39;s nothing we can do for you&#34;. Save your money or experience a variety of cheesecake that you weren&#39;t in the mood for- and overcharged for.

The food is delicious!<br>Except for the hosts, one of the girls were kind of rude not smiling and just made me feel uncomfortable. Overall I would defiantly come back.<br>Also Amy our server was super nice, very fast, kept our drinks filled asked us questions about our order to make sure it&#39;s correct, great friendly girl. If I come back I&#39;m going to ask for her, she was amazing. Great great customer service.
Excellent dessert of course ;) Great food, lots of choices! Never had a bad meal but service is sometimes slow. Friendly staff.
Got the meatloaf, which was pretty good, and the peanut butter cup fudge cheesecake.....which was great.

I&#39;m not on a quest to go to CF every weekend, but coincidentally it seems like I am. We &#34;happened&#34; to be in the neighborhood so when all else fails, cheesecake seems to work.  I have to say this visit was not inspiring. <br><br>The Caesar salad is always a favorite and my mini foodie always insists we order it, so that&#39;s an automatic.<br><br>We started off with an appetizer.  We got the sweet corn tamales and I was a little disappointed, bland despite all the flavors of avocado, parsley, tomato and sour cream, it just gets a two star.<br><br>I ordered the shrimp tacos and the side serving of rice was so lame!  Usually I get enough to share so the serving was disappointing.<br><br>My little one ordered a pepperoni pizza and this time it was greasy and slimy. YUK.<br><br>Overall, I won&#39;t be visiting this Cheesecake, I&#39;ll stick to Summerlin or the Ceasar&#39;s Palace one instead:( Oh, BTW service was good but waiter a bit robotic.

I don&#39;t want to give a long term bad review if I have not had long term bad experience, so I suspect I will update this later after my next dining experience there.  Typically we love cheesecake factor however, this trip we had an issue and I was taken back as to how it was handled.   I ordered spaghetti and meatballs for my kids to all share, the first few meatballs were perfect, but the last one I cut into was significantly harder than the others when I did finally break thru, it was a dark brown inside, almost black in some areas.  As someone who cooks, I can not fathom how this kind of a thing happens other than it being an OLD meatball that somehow stayed in the pot well after its expiration date.  I could be wrong on this, but it was not explained to us and I cannot fathom how this could have gotten this way from being overcooked because the outside was not overcooked in any way.  -So, this makes me really disgusted on how this could happen.  The kicker for me is...there was not explaination, no visit from the manager, and no reduction of the bill either.  I was really taken back by it all.  So, I am not sure what happened but it scared me about eating at this location, wondering what their health standards are.

3.5 stars<br><br>We&#39;ve been to this location once and only for cheesecake.  But, in general, we really do like the food at The Cheesecake Factory and sometimes even crave some of the apps and meals here.  But there are a few things that keep us from coming more often.<br><br>The good: <br>The cheesecake is delicious, and there are SO many options.  I want to try them all but usually can&#39;t pass up Reese&#39;s or Red Velvet and my husband LOVES the Snickers flavor.  And the portion is very large.  I had to bring some of mine home!  The service was friendly and efficient.  When we sat down our server immediately brought us bread, and we thanked him but told him we&#39;d only be having dessert.  He brought our cheesecake quickly, kept our waters filled, and brought the bill promptly.  Don&#39;t you hate going somewhere for dessert and waiting like an hour to receive your bill? So glad that didn&#39;t happen! <br><br>The not-so-good: <br>This place is just expensive.  Seriously.  Sometimes I wonder - what right do they have to charge these prices?  It&#39;s a good chain but our cheesecake cost as much as a small dinner somewhere else!  We knew that going in so it wasn&#39;t a surprise but just be aware that cheesecake costs a small fortune here.  <br><br>The lighting is very dark.  I have excellent vision and I was squinting to see the menu.  It almost made me too tired to eat cheesecake.  But I found it in me to keep going. <br><br>I can&#39;t STAND the seating.  The table you get can make or break your experience.  They have these HUGE cushy booths that they do give to parties of 2 - I saw it.  But of course we get that small 2 person table crammed between two different parties on that really long booth.  Ugh, I could hear entire conversations of the people on either side of me.  And that awkward moment when you have to turn sideways to get in or leave the booth and hope you&#39;re not brushing someone&#39;s plate with your rear end... I know I&#39;m making kind of a big deal about this but it really is annoying to me.  Please, spread the tables out more.<br><br>Overall this is a restaurant that we enjoy coming to sometimes. They have a really great menu selection of food, drinks and cheesecake.  But it&#39;s just a once-in-a-blue-moon thing.
I typically order to-go as it&#39;s always super crowded. My order is always right, portions are huge, and they deliver curb side which is great when you have kids

This place rocks my world! I have been here so many times and I&#39;ve always had an awesome Expierence. The food the drinks, everything is so tasty and well done. It feels like a magic trick that the menu is so big but always executed so well. I try to get something new every time I go. The venue is always clean, the lighting is perfect, I love the ambiance of it all. Perfect for a date night or any night. Dress up or dress casual it all works here. Don&#39;t even get me started on the cheesecake!! Ugh get in my belly.

Very busy! And I don&#39;t think it&#39;s worth the wait or price... but if you want an absolutely god awful amount of food this is the place for you. I got the salmon, my friend got the blt and neither of us could finish our meals! So if there is one solid thing about the cheesecake factory it&#39;s the size of helpings you get!

First off I am not a fan of Cheesecake Factory. I love Grand Lux and even though they are owned by the same parent company there is a huge difference. We ended up eating here for a work dinner and I must say I was surprised.  For the very first time I actually like my food and loved the service. We ordered chicken poppers and calamari for apps. Then I had the chicken pasta with sun dried tomatoes. Someone else ordered the jambalaya and one other guy orders the Cajun chicken. To our surprise we gave the food was B+ compared to D- in the past. I&#39;m glad we have it another shot and now we will reconsider going back. Great job!

We&#39;ve been to this location multiple times over the years.  The food is typically delicious and service great.  The biggest problem is getting a table. Our most recent experience was a Saturday night during dinner time with a group of 10. We understand that makes it more difficult, but the restaurant didn&#39;t handle it correctly. We were told the wait for a table would be 45-50 minutes, but we&#39;re not seated until over an hour and twenty minutes elapsed. The worst part was that it was clear that the restaurant was not properly staffed for a Saturday night. They had an entire section of tables empty while the lobby was full of people waiting.  We suspect that the kitchen was understaffed because f he amount of time it took to get food out. Again, food was delicious and waiter was great but the mismanagement of the staffing is almost enough to make me not want to come back.
I had the pepperoni pizza and small salad lunch combo. My wife had enchiladas. We had lemonade that was pretty strong. We both enjoyed our food.

I love the product and the location. The reason for my review is a recent issue with a cake order. We are all humans and mistakes happen - not the end of the world - especially in a high volume restaurant. However, the way the issue was (not) resolved by the manager is what a see as a sign of a bad service.

Let me start by saying that I LOVE the cheesecake factory. The menu is extensive something for everyone. The salads are incredible. Tell me that you don&#39;t love the bread, served warm and soft, and I&#39;m not much of a bread eater but I must say I LOVE the bread at the Cheesecake factory. <br><br>Audrey was an excellent server recommend the Cajun pasta which was excellent with a spicy kick. The<br> barbeque chicken salad was incredible which Audrey also recommended. <br><br>I hadn&#39;t visited the cheesecake factory in a year. I truly must say I missed one of my old favorite standby restaurants and will  definitely be back and highly  would recommend that you stop in and enjoy a great meal with someone or alone. <br><br>Audrey, thank you for the incredible service . you rocked it!

This review is based on one visit, not my overall opinion, because usually I&#39;m a huge fan of this place. <br>My daughter  chose this as her 11th birthday dinner location. We&#39;ve always enjoyed their food and of course the cheesecake. We had a party of 9 on a Friday night. I called early in the week in attempts of making a reservation but they do not take them on weekends.  That was my 1st and main disappointment. I didn&#39;t want to have a large group (half kids) waiting long. I told my party to arrive at 7, I arrived about 15 min prior. Our total wait time ended up being about 25 minutes. Not too bad on a Friday night. <br>We were sat at a beautiful big round table where everyone could see everyone. <br>We ordered multiple apps and dishes including spinach dip, calamari, tex mex egg rolls, chicken picatta, garlic noodles, sliders, steak, shrimp, and more. <br>Everything food wise was 4 stars easy. It did take a full on hour before we were eating though. They served us basket upon basket of bread but took forever on the real food. <br>Service was 3 stars. Our waitress was nice, just overworked and slow. <br>Cheesecake selections were red velvet, Oreo, Hershey&#39;s, and strawberry. <br>Seriously can I say anything wrong? Of course not. <br>I will return to Cheesecake Factory. Overall they are a great &#34;chain&#34; restaurant.

I really like The Cheese Cake Factory desserts, food is not that amazing but is not bad at all. Since I am a student from the Art Institute I use to take lunch in this restaurant but today service was denied to me because I was trying to take lunch on the patio area and have my dog with me, my dog is a 7 week Schnauzer mini toy puppy...That was RIDICULOUS!<br>A 3 pound puppy inside her cage won&#39;t hurt nobody...<br>But that&#39;s ok, I will never visit this place again.

Normally I love their sweet potato fries but today they served me burnt crispy fries and totally skimped on the fry sauce too. The customer service which is normally pretty good was lacking today as well. Don&#39;t know if they are just having an off day or what but I am totally disappointed!

The food is good. The service was all over the place, but mostly bad. We were forgotten and remembered too many times. We wanted to order cheesecake at the end of the meal, but got so sick of waiting we just said check please. We waited for that too for far too long. Again the food was really good. Service not so much.

I love this place. I love this company. No matter where you go in the US this brand is consistently giving their all to customer service. There&#39;s always a little wait but the food is phenomenal and the variety of all the items on the menu is awesome! There&#39;s something in it for everyone.

Great customer service but avoid the steaks!<br><br>Went in tonight (party of five, two kids), service was great!  They brought out the kids meals first, no problem; then came two of the entrées, mine was still not brought out.  I ordered the Hibachi Steak (medium rare), it came out about 4 minutes after the other entrées.  The quality of the steak was aweful, very veiny with fat; also under cooked.   I buy better meat at Costco all day long.  I sent the steak back the next time the manager brought it out, same problem, it was just warmer.  The manager said that it was cooked to the internal temperature specifications to qualify it to be medium rare.  The server took one look at it, and agreed with me that it was still undercooked. They offered to redo it, or make me something else, I declined; I don&#39;t want to be the guy who sends food back just for a comped meal.  I&#39;ll go back, eventually; but I&#39;ll never order a steak there again.

The Cheesecake Factory is always a great option since there are so many selections on their menu and there is always something for everyone. I usually have one of my faves, which is the four cheese pasta which is sooooooo yummy! It&#39;s penne pasta, with mozzarella, ricotta, romano, and parmesan cheese.

Love this place! One of my all time favorite places to eat for a zillion reasons. Food is always consistent no matter which location or any state I visited. The cocktail menu is overrated. I have tried a few cocktails and really didn&#39;t like them. This place is about the food for me though, not the drinks. 2 choices of complementary bread...awesome! Every dish I ordered has been good, but I tend to stick to my few favorites most times. Cheesecake is ridiculously good! In fact I hated cheesecake until I first visited a location over 25 years ago and have loved cheesecake ever since. I always order the avocado egg rolls every time. Always awesome! Service is always great at every location I&#39;ve been including this one. Outside patio is awesome to dine at on a date. Love this places location because it&#39;s so close to where I live. I can&#39;t get out of this place without spending $80 for me and my girlfriend. A little expensive, but I feel as if it&#39;s mostly justified. Cheaper lunch specials would be nice. The one and only thing I don&#39;t like at CF is their side salad. Poor thing to call a salad to me, but once again I don&#39;t care because I love this place so much and never disappointed. This is the smallest CF location I&#39;ve been to, but I&#39;m from Chicago where their locations are quite large. Wait times are reasonable at this location which I love. Back home I would have to wait at least an hour no matter what time or day I went. Will go back to this location over and over until the end of time.

Beautiful restaurant that&#39;s very large inside. The place was packed with customers around 5pm, so it was pretty loud inside. The cheesecakes are sold by the entrance, where you can purchase whole cheesecakes or slices. The pricing for them was surprisingly high. Some of the whole cheesecakes ranged from $20 to $50 or more. The slices were $7 to $9, which are small in length, but a lot taller than the normal cheesecake you would find somewhere else so the slices are still very fulfilling. When we first came in, the hostess wasn&#39;t very welcoming, but the servers were great throughout the entire time we dined there! They were attentive and friendly. The food was awesome, it was freshly cooked and hot. The wait time for the food wasn&#39;t long at all, approximately 10 minutes. Overall, I do recommend trying this restaurant.

The cheesecake is wonderful but the service was incredibly slow. We waited at least 15 minutes to get drinks and bread at the beginning and then we got half of our meals after what seemed like a pretty long wait. It took another ten minutes to get two more plates delivered. The final plate, however didn&#39;t arrive at our table until after we&#39;d all finished eating. The manager did comp the seriously late plate, and it&#39;s easy to forgive a missed order but the overall slowness of the servers leads me to leave this one star review.

Ugh. I hate the Cheesecake Factory. I always try to give it another chance and I don&#39;t know why. It&#39;s not to the food, it&#39;s the service. Every. Damn. Time. Worst service ever. <br><br>My husbands birthday, we didn&#39;t make a reservation be it wasn&#39;t busy so we were seated right away. Ten minutes pass before the waitress takes our DRINK order. Just taking her time, talking to the table next to us, doesn&#39;t even look our way. So we wait ten more minutes to get the drinks. (Which were delivered by someone not our waitress) Ten more minutes pass and she still hasn&#39;t been back. We got up and left. <br><br>Not exaggerating about the times either! Every time. We&#39;re never going back. Not sorry
My Lunch is fabulous. Strawberry Lemonade and a Tuna salad. I&#39;m set for the rest of the Day. Great service.
Cheesecake is delicious. Very creamy and soft. The pasta in this place is not that bad as well. Definitely will eat here again.

It had been awhile since my husband and I came here to eat. We were so glad we chose to come back because we loved it! We ordered the fried macaroni and cheese for an appetizer. The Louisiana chicken pasta for an entree. And our favorite part was the Cheesecake which we ordered the Kahlua and the oreo cheesecake to go. Everything was absolutely delicious! The portions are very large! We easily could have shared just the entree and been full, but at least we took so much of the food to go. Highly recommend!

I had a great experience coming here. It&#39;s such a casual restaurant that also has its own elegant flair and atmosphere. <br><br>Our waitress was very kind and helpful. I don&#39;t remember her name, but she always checked on us and was very patient with us when we couldn&#39;t decide on what to eat.<br><br>The food was definitely delicious. I&#39;m usually not fond of the entrées when I come here because 1) they&#39;re supersized and when I use them as &#34;leftovers&#34;, they get soggy and I can&#39;t eat them anyway, and 2) they&#39;re usually not the best tasting even at the restaurant. However, I decided to order only small plates / appetizers to satisfy myself. <br><br>I ordered the crispy crab bites, which were decadent and had a lightly battered outside. The presentation was nice. It comes with six bites in a small skillet dish and a side of sauce and a lemon.<br><br>I shared the fresh basil, tomato and mozarella flatbread with my friend. She got the beet and goat cheese salad. Overall, we finished all of the food and we were still satisfied. The appetizers, in my opinion, taste 10000x better than the entrées. <br><br>Now for the good stuff...the cheesecake. After several minutes of skimming through the endless list of various cheesecakes, I finally decided to go with Chris&#39; Outrageous Cheesecake, which, in the words of the Cheesecake Factory gods, it is &#34;Layers of Moist Chocolate Cake, Chewy Brownie, Toasted Coconut-Pecan Frosting and Creamy Chocolate Chip Coconut Cheesecake.&#34; Ohhhhh yes...<br><br>My lovely waitress put this in a to-go box for me, and it was fresh the whole time I ate it. It was super sweet (which I love) and the coconut paired perfectly with the decadently rich chocolate and toasted pecans. And to top it all off, the brownie and cheesecake-y cream in the center made this cheesecake - eating experience all the more better for me.<br><br>I&#39;m definitely coming here again, but this time, for the cheesecake only.

This restaurant is average. Decorations are good, quality of food is correct. But is so cold inside !!! My   meal wasn&#39;t the same than my order and the server didn&#39;t let us finish our plates ... my friend wanted to eat a cheesecake inside restaurant that the server gives her a bag with the cheesecake inside... we really felt oppressed ! Others places of this franchise are better.

Took a client here for lunch .<br>Great service provided by Amy.<br>Salads were large and fresh. We skipped dessert though its hard to do this with a bakery full of<br>Cakes displayed to entice you.<br>Maybe next visit.

Came in to get a whole cheesecake to go for the husband&#39;s birthday- our favorite! Bakery staff was extremely helpful and nice. Didn&#39;t discover until after we got home that we got the wrong cheesecake- one we haven&#39;t had before. It&#39;s too far out of the way to return and we haven&#39;t not liked a flavor before so we decided to try it- delicious!!!!
