I&#39;m sure it doesn&#39;t take long to make a good hot plate of cheesy melty hot and creamy nachos right to order....so why not of made it a la minute before making the other entrees and having the runner bring it out when it was hot and ready to go? Or perhaps it was the runner&#39;s delay of bringing the food? Also, if a customer wants their burger medium and you give them a burnt black burger...that&#39;s not good.

Yep it&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory alright. <br><br>Giant portions, decent food, standard upper-middle tier chain type prices. Expect to have enough leftovers for lunch the next day. Nothing is out of the ordinary for this this Cheesecake Factory. The wait staff is friendly, the building is huge and they have a lot of outdoor seating. It was very nice and a mildly breezy spring evening. <br><br>They have advertisements in the menu as if it were a magazine. I&#39;m not offended by it, I just thought it was odd.<br><br><a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.merchantcircle.com%2Fbusiness%2FThe.Cheesecake.Factory.702-207-6372&amp;s=d9006b8953cf441a269d5a528b003b10d0353a66656845408f01db2ddd5e6500" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">merchantcircle.com/busin…</a>

My favorite aspect of the Cheesecake Factory is its dependability and consistency.  The menu is large and incredibly diverse, yet everything I have there is always good to great.  We&#39;re not talking gourmet excellence by any stretch, but for the price point I always enjoy myself there.<br><br>I&#39;m also a huge fan of their curbside to go system, where you call in your order and they deliver it to your car.  Very convenient and I believe it was the first restaurant to provide the service (at least it was the first that I noticed).<br><br>Oh yeah, and the cheesecakes are pretty damn good, too.  You have to love the variety offered.

I&#39;m giving one star strictly based on service. The food is great. <br><br>I had just moved to Las Vegas from California and have eaten at multiple<br>Cheesecake Factory locations on many different occasions. <br><br>We decided to eat in the bar area rather than wait for a table. We sat down and our server, Melissa N., came up after a few minutes and took our drink orders but didn&#39;t ask us if we wanted to eat (we ordered 3 waters and a lemonade). She brought back our waters and walked away. We tried to flag her down for menus but she never stopped. One of us went to the host stand and got menus, 10 minutes later she came back and we placed our order and asked about the lemonade and she said she&#39;d bring it right back and did. <br><br>While we were waiting for our food she brought us bread however she forgot bread plates and place settings. We waited for a few minutes and didn&#39;t see her so we asked another server if we could have silverware and she promptly returned with silverware, napkins, and bread plates. <br><br>Our dinner arrived via food runners and upon inspection 1 of the 3 salads had dressing and one of the sandwiches had mushrooms when we requested there were none. We waited and waited, no Melissa, so we stopped a host who was walking by if she could find her. She finally appeared and delivering another tables food and one of us had to walk after her because she never even checked on us. <br><br>She apologized for the mushrooms and said she&#39;d have another one sent right out and also said she&#39;d bring the dressing right back, &#34;I&#39;ll be right back with your balsamic&#34; however, I previously had asked for ranch. <br><br>It took another 10-15 minutes for someone to tell us that the sandwich was almost done. It was a manager and I asked for it to be packaged to-go because everyone was already done eating. We told him about the utter lack of service and he apologized and offered to buy us desert, we accepted. Melissa came back with the sandwich packaged to-go and asked what kind of deserts we&#39;d like, we told her and requested no whipped cream be put on the cheesecake. <br><br>She said she&#39;d get them packaged up for us and left the bill. The manager was kind enough to comp the meal but only comped one of the slices of cheesecake after he offered to buy it for us. <br><br>We paid the bill and Melissa returned with our cheesecakes, of course one had whipped cream. I would NEVER recommend this location to anyone strictly based on service, the food quality and portions are great but the service is absolutely dismal. <br><br>Sherman Oaks, Woodland Hills, Glendale, Redondo Beach, and Thousand Oaks are a few of the Cheesecake Factory locations I&#39;ve been to and I&#39;d give all of these locations 5 stars all the way around and have no hesitation recommending them to anyone.

My favorite was the Thai chicken wrap appetizer.  Great to share but don&#39;t plan on having room for dessert unless there are four of you sharing it. The menu here offers a huge variety. I ventured away from my usual favorite entrées (Meat loaf, asian or one of the pasta dishes) and tried the jambalaya pasta. The flavor was delicious but the chicken was dry,  as was the entire dish. It was probably overcooked. The flavor was so good that I may try it again after getting the waiter&#39;s opinion about the norm for this dish.  About the waiter,  he did a great job despite a very busy night. We spent $80 for 2, with alcohol. Norm is more like $20-$25 ea. Recommended

We had dinner here a few weeks ago and for $100 I&#39;m not impressed at all. I was expecting better food for the price range. Our service was fantastic and the restaurant was nice but the food was a let down. Definitely not on the list of places I would return to.
good service, good food, good atmosphere. slightly too dark inside... hahaha no big deal though.

After church, came to the District. We took the kids to the big carousel so that they could ride. The kids had a blast, shortly after, we walked around in the Whole Food market, and came to Cheesecake Factory. We had a little wait, but it was well worth it. We were seated as quickly as possible. The waiter was awesome. My son had a dish that consisted of meatloaf, mash potatoes, and a soup. I had a seafood sandwich dish that included the sandwich, salad, and a soup. Everything was fantastic. One of my nephews ordered the corn dogs and fries of the kiddies meal. My other nephew had kids pizza and kids Mac and cheese. My mom had a soup and salad dish. And my dad had an appetizer as his dish. The bill for the six of us came out to be about $87. We had a great time eating, talking, and taking in the ambient environment.

I have been here probably 5 times in the last 3 months. I can honestly say that out of every single experience we have had great service and the best food in Las Vegas. The menu is so diverse and anyone can find something to love here. I really think this is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. Service never disappoints and once when I made a mistake on my order the waitress had my entree remade to my liking and didn&#39;t even bat an eye. Priceless! I will gladly bring friends and family to the Cheesecake Factory anytime!! Can&#39;t wait to go back. BTW my favorite dinner is the Spicy Chicken Chiptole pasta!! Love it!!

What a disappointment! I don&#39;t mind waiting for a table when it&#39;s busy. If I didn&#39;t like the wait, I would go elsewhere. But when you are finally seated and then you get to watch servers run around you for 15 minutes and not even one stops to greet you, THAT is very annoying. I finally had to get up, go to the hostess station, and threaten to walk out in 60 seconds if a server didn&#39;t show up. Well, that got their attention, or so I thought. Then, the server comes and complains to us (!!) that he was taken out of his section and &#34;thrown&#34; at us. Thrown?? Sorry to be a burden, pal. Your comment directly affects your tip unless maybe you don&#39;t understand how a fleeting patron-server relationship works. You be nice - I be nice. It&#39;s that simple - not a long-term commitment. We haven&#39;t been back since and it would take a lot to get us to walk into another Cheesey-cake Factory. Why not just call it the &#34;Factory&#34; if that&#39;s how you treat people?
Came here around 2pm to take a lil dessert back to the hotel! This place was crowded and hot. Outside was cooler! I didnt like this place because of it being crowded and hot inside.

I am really happy that more restaurants have the lower calories menus now went here Sunday and they had a separate low Carrie menu. Since I belong to Weight Watchers but still like to eat out sometimes this helps me a lot Thanks

We came in here on a Sunday night and had the worst experience EVER. I love cheesecake factory but the service was horrible. We waited for 45 mins for our table, got seated &amp; waited another 20 mins to get greeted. Our food came out cold and the server never came back once to check up on us once he delivered our food. We complained to the manager and he was nice enough to comped our dinner and apologized to us.

I had the worst experience. My family and I waited forever. The electronic device to let you know you&#39;re ready to be sat didn&#39;t work. They gave me another one but didn&#39;t program it. Another 25 minutes went by and nothing. If it wasn&#39;t my mother-in-laws favorite place to eat, I would have left already. When I went to the desk to see how long we had, our name was crossed off. I complained yet again. Then the girl who originally took our name said &#34;Sorry your next&#34;. About a minute went by and she forgot and sat another party of 3. How can a 1/2 way Intelligent person forget something one minute later? &#34;Are you kidding me!!!&#34;  I will never go there again and hope anyone that reads this takes warning of the bad service.

This is not my first CCF.  Lately I am afraid their quailty is going down.  I had a chicken sandwich and the chicken was tough and dry.  The fries were cold and tasteless.  For the cost of meals it really is not that great.  Service was good.

The location is perfect, celebrated a birthday luncheon with a few co-workers and had the Miso Salmon plate with garlic mashed potatoes and steamed brocolli it was fresh, healthy and very tasty not to mention the strawberry cheesecake for desert. All four of us enjoyed our meal for less than $100. The service was excellent, no wait time and everyone is very curteous. We then strolled around the district before returning to work. This turned into a wonderful afternoon.

My husband doesn&#39;t like chain restaurants so to get him to try Cheesecake Factory, I had to lure him in under the premise of Happy Hour. Happy to say, the staff at this CF did not disappoint! Fast, friendly service- awesome happy hour pups and great cocktails. $5 each? Wow. I have found something to like about visiting the Las Vegas area!
I used to LOVE this place. But the service was TERRIBLE. The woman was so slow and put her FINGER in my food!!!! I won&#39;t be coming back.

I want to start out by saying I LOVE the cheesecake factory. I would give the one in Anaheim, CA (in the Gardenwalk) 5 stars. With that said, I give this specific establishment 2 stars. The service is a hit or miss. Sometimes you will get a server that is right on point but most the time the servers are &#34;ok.&#34; The food gets screwed up at this place on a regular basis. One of the mess ups out of many was burned French fries. At an establishment like this I expect high standards. First off the cook was a jerk for even putting it out there to be served. Second the waitress failed by bringing it to us after clearly seeing that it was burned. We had to tell her they were burned (it was obvious) and she didn&#39;t even apologize or seem sympathetic she just said ok i&#39;ll get you another one, in a quick fast tone. If you alter a dish, they will bring it to you wrong. And i&#39;m not talking about an extreme alteration. I&#39;m talking about asking for a different type of pasta vs. the one it comes with. If they mess up your dish it will come back more screwed up as if to punish you for having the audacity to correct the mistake. Take out is always a guarantee mess up and they always give you less food when you do take out vs. when you sit inside. I am speaking from 3 years of experience with this place. If you can, go to the one in Summerlin they are much better and more on target. its really sad that such an awesome establishment is screwed up and nothing is done to rectify it. I&#39;m not going to list all the messed up incidents from this place because it will turn into a novel. Its a great food chain with wonderful food. There is something for everyone here and you will not be disappointed with the taste of your food, when made properly. I know a lot of flack is given to this place for the high fat and calorie content. I really don&#39;t think that people are looking at it from the proper perspective. You need to know they give you huge portions here. The fat and calorie content is based on the huge plate of food you receive. This place is giving you all this food with the intent of being able to have the consumer bring some home for later. You cant possible think that you are supposed to eat all that food in one sitting. The food you get on your plate is way more then what you would get on the appetizer plate. Appetizers are meant to serve 2-4 people and your entrée contains more food then that. So I will leave you with that food for thought ;). If you eat the proper portion its really not that bad in fat and calories. Have you ever seen the fat and calories in a marie calendars frozen meal at the grocery store?! Just think, the portion in a Marie Calendar&#39;s frozen meal is 1/3 to 1/4 less then what you would receive on your plate at The Cheesecake factory.
First timer the hostesses were STUPID told us 15 min waited 40 told us our table was being bussed sat 4 other people. Almost walked out, dinner was awesome- waitress kathia saved the day.

I love the lettuce wraps.  Garlic Bread  Was One Of The Best I Have Had.  Our server was great, not sure her name.  In fact I think there were two helping us. Jason and I enjoyed the chocolate peanut butter cheese cake after. With A Late.  We where going to go for drinks at a local bar, but decided to stay and sit at the bar.  So pleased we did.  Go just for the bar experience.

Don&#39;t come here until they figure out their new menu. We ordered a couple items off the new skinny menu and supposedly they are now cooking their thousands of menu items on the broiler. Maybe they are &#34;skinny&#34; items because you will starve, it was an hour and a half till we got our food and all the manager could offer was 2 free cheesecakes (half of a normal portion) in return for a black and blue steak (which I sent back-it was ordered medium), cold fries, cold chicken tacos, cold burger with un-melted cheese, etc. It wasn&#39;t our waiters fault he did everything he could to deal with it and we tipped him accordingly. We ended up fighting our $150 bill and got our entrees removed since we ordered 3 rounds of drinks and there was something wrong with all of the entrees, the bill was still over $90. For tonight&#39;s performance, i would give no stars if I could.
My husband and I went to the Cheesecake Factory for lunch. PROS- no wait, friendly waiter, large menu. CONS- atmosphere was very warehouse/industrial, food was overpriced. We will not be going back.

Had to wait for a bit because most of the guests were celebrating with family and their recent graduates.  We ordered the Avocado Rolls for appetizers and they were awesome.  For the main meal, I had the Meatloaf and it&#39;s so much food, I couldn&#39;t finish it.  But I did have room for the Pineapple Upside Down Cheesecake and now I have diabetes. (Just kidding).  Definitely a restaurant I&#39;d stop by again whenever I visit Vegas.

We arrived for a late lunch started off great but ended terrible. Bread good, southwest egg rolls good and the fried zuchini good. But then it just went down. My wife got a small pizza and it was undercooked and soggy, I got the fish and chips, they were very mushy and oily. My son got the alfredo pasta and he liked it. They comped the pizza that did not have a bite out of it and I got an eye roll about the fish. I guess my major problem is crappy food for $100. This was my first time there and unless my wife pays it will be the last.

Finally!!! I loooove this place excellent food as always but the service is really what makes it so wonderful!! Our server Kaytee was absolutely amazing! She was so fast and stayed on top of everything, she noticed we weren&#39;t happy with our appetizer and immediately took action even the manager came out to apologize! Kaytee was so sweet and on top of her game all the tables around us were in awe and bragging about her.... Literally! I have been searching for a great spot and lets face it...Vegas has alot of places with great food but it is beyond hard to find good, fast and friendly service BUUTTT I think I finally found it! Great job Cheesecake Factory! I will definitely be back!!!
Love the atmosphere and food, my favprite is the cobb salad. usually has okay service but could definitely be better! Won&#39;t stop me from coming back.

Some people go here just for the dessert and I cant blame them.<br>ADAMS PEANUT BUTTER CUP FUDGE RIPPLE was honestly a harmonious blend of peanut butter and chocolate. Neither too strong or too soft, just good. <br>That&#39;s what we ate the next day. At home.<br>Because I couldn&#39;t bring myself to even attempt the cheesecake, after the buffet we had at the restaurant.  We went unannounced on Valentine&#39;s night. The wait was an hour which was understandable. <br>AVOCADO EGG ROLLS and FRIED MACARONI &amp; CHEESE.  Sound like a lot? No, me either, but I couldn&#39;t finish my meal. So I guess it was. We really underestimated those appetizers, because I&#39;m dumb. And honestly that could&#39;ve been our meal.<br>And I don&#39;t why but I keep trying to find a suitable mac and cheese, but I guess I just like it simple. Because anything too fancy just doesn&#39;t do it. For me.<br>CAJUN PASTA JAMBALAYA  was the dish across, and the SHRIMP SCAMPI &amp; SALMON was the dish in front. Of me that is.  I know what shrimp and salmon taste like, but That salmon was perfect. Enough for me to mention it again here, I was just pleasantly surprised. Even with how full I was, I dominated that thing. Like a duck. (No chewing)<br>If you&#39;ve never been, then you should, at least once. It&#39;s one of those places that you wish you could call it you&#39;re favorite restaurant (because of the decor, the ambiance, the food) but then you see the people you&#39;re eating around with, because you decided not to get a booth. And sad face. <br>But it stills bare mention though, it&#39;s just not a place you want to go all the time. Just once in awhile.
I love the cheesecakes here - my favorite is the Dulce de Leche!! The food is okay. I just wish there were more vegetarian options, so I can join my friends when they eat here.
OMG I am in food coma still!  The service is great, the food wonderful and the dessert to die for!

I ate too much.  But then again, that&#39;s why I love this place.  I&#39;ve now been to about 6 different locations, and by far the service here is the best.  My food was fully cooked (which isn&#39;t always the case at other locations), we only waited 15 minutes (unheard of!), and the waitress was friendly and attentive.  As the Cheesecake Factory goes, you can&#39;t ask for anything more!

I love cheesecake factory and grand lux cafes, so I knew coming in that this was a good choice... we did have a minor hickup with table seating... we were sat next to the POS machine and for the first 1/3 of our meal we got to hear all the personal conversations and happenings of the servers.....    i politely requested to be moved and the manager(didnt get his name) was so fast and efficient in moving us....   his efforts were appreciated...  our server was wonderful!   I would definitely return and feel safe recommending to other yelpers  :)

Went here with my beautiful and perfect girlfriend who is absolutely just a blessing in my life and ordered her whatever her heart desired for lunch. Portions were huge, waiter was awesome, we were full, and cheesecake was delicious even after being snuck into the movie theatres. I gave this place a 4 because it was like 60 bucks for lunch..

It was the first time that I dined at a Cheesecake Factory and it will likely be my last.  The wait time wasn&#39;t bad at all even though it appeared very busy.  The waitress was pleasant but seemed rushed.  She filled our drink orders promptly which is a big plus.  It was very noisy but aesthetically pleasing.  We ordered the calamari as an appetizer and it was adequate.  We ordered the ribeye steak medium rare for our main course. It came out well done.  They offered to cook another one for us but we didn&#39;t think they the next steak would be prepared any better so we just ordered some pasta.  The waitress never apologized for this inconvenience. The pasta was pretty bland but edible.  Overall it was not worth the time or money that we spent there.  If your going to go to a chain restaurant stick to Outback, they at least know how to cook a steak.

We love this restaurant and have been to many different locations throughout the states. But this past wkend the service was weird. Our waitress appeared to be drunk or sleepy. It was so bad we asked her to go home. She was falling asleep while taking our orders and her behavior was not the norm for CCF staff. Long story short the  orders were wrong and confused her. (Service for 6) She was replaced with another waiter and we were told she was sent home. So to make us happy we received 3 free cheesecakes and one meal free since it arrived after everyone was finish eating. I can say this was the worst service we have ever had but thank goodness the food remained at its highest quality as we would expect. I must say we did appreciate how fast the managers stepped in to make sure our dining ended on a good note. Becuz we love CCF I can&#39;t give it less then 4/5 stars but I will give our waitress a 2 star. Sorry. Hope u get better sleep nxt time u work.
I thought it was overpriced and it took forever to get seated. The pasta i ordered was ok, but there are better places for cheaper prices.

What a HUGE disappointment!!!  I would never go back to this place for anything other than cheesecake!  Their food is absolutely pathetic!  And I sincerely mean that!  I don&#39;t believe people even know what &#34;good food&#34; is anymore.  And clearly the manager that was working 6/25/14 @ 1:00 pm, doesn&#39;t have a clue!!!  We ordered Fish Taco&#39;s &amp; a Beef Sandwich similar to an philly cheese steak.  I kid you not....the taco&#39;s had ONE piece of fish in each taco the size of a nickel!  The rest of the taco was shredded cabbage!  The rice sat under a heatlamp so long that it was like biting into uncooked rice!  The sandwich that I ordered was beyond disgusting!  I ordered it without onion&#39;s.  When sandwich came it was loaded with onions....so I sent it back.  As well as the pathetic excuse of a fish taco!  Finally the incompetent waitress brought back the sandwich....and it literally had a cold piece of cheese in the roll....with cold raw fatty beef on 2/3&#39;s of the roll....and the other 1/3 of the sandwich was bare with nothing in it!!!!!  I couldn&#39;t believe they would serve this!  I called the manager over and he said &#34;Well that&#39;s how much meat we use and usually the onions bulk the sandwich up.&#34;  I wanted to backhand this fool!  You serve me cold, raw, fatty beef on 2/3&#39;s of a sub roll with cold non-melted cheese and think that&#39;s acceptable????  He said well I can get you something else.  At this point I said no thanks....you can keep it....we&#39;re leaving!  He said &#34;what about your taco&#39;s we&#39;re re-making?&#34;  I said ....Keep those too!!!!  He says...&#34;the waitress feels really bad....she really does.&#34;  The truth is....I could care less how the incompetent waitress feels!!!!!  I&#39;m the one that feels bad here bud!  I just waited 45 minutes for food that I wouldn&#39;t give to my dog!!!!  Wow....this manager is in the wrong business!  And that waitress wasn&#39;t any better!  This place has NO STANDARDS for their food!  So do yourself a huge favor and go elsewhere!  I ended up going across the street to Capriottis and ordered a philly cheesesteak and it was great compared to the sandwich The Cheesecake Factory attempted to serve me for $13.95!!!!!  What a joke!  Ugh!

Overdone and half baked concept food fare fosters a large belly with a check of equal size for what is now average food at a big box food factory. Far too dark at night - Just get dessert and head for the hills.

It is what it is.  I like the patio at this location.  We go every so often when we don&#39;t know what we want because the menu is huge &amp; has something for everyone.  The waitstaff is fine.  Some are stars, some not so much.  I never leave saying wow that was great, but it fills the void in my stomach in a manufactured, corporate kind of way...

Went for Valentine&#39;s a day early to beat the crowd. Christine was our server but I wish she wasn&#39;t. I ordered the mahi special it was disgusting. There was so much runny chunky tomato on top of the fish and mashed potatoes it was more like a soup. So if you like your fish, tomatoes, and potatoes all swimming together you might like it. I didn&#39;t say anything. I know the server noticed me trying to recuse my potatoes from drowning. So she said she was leaving and Jennifer would be taking over. Well I don&#39;t think Jennifer was even there yet. 10-15 minutes go by meanwhile Christine is still taking care of the table next to us. Finally Jennifer! She was only there to put in our cheesecakes to go and grab the check. I wish she had been our server the whole time. Night and day difference.

I&#39;ve been to many Cheesecake Factories around the country and I was just as happy with my experience here.  We had a large party and were fed relatively quickly.  I do wish the wait staff would have cleaned our table more regularly and given us a bit more time between the appetizer and the mail course.  The pan fried Salmon and pasta was delicious, maybe the best restaurant cooked Salmon I&#39;ve ever had.
The service was very slow at 10pm. The waitress was lost thence found her.  Great food when it arrived. I almost forgot I ordered
I don&#39;t think that I have ever had a bad meal at a Cheesecake factory and this was no different.  Thai chicken pasta and fish &amp; chips were great, as well as the cheesecake.
Cheesecake factory is a great consistant chain. From Summerlin to Ceasars to Henderson this chain delivers on a diverse menu with great flavor and a very upscale setting for a very pratical price.
I love Cheesecake Factory period but The District location is my ultimate fave in Vegas.

I can see how this would be a very popular restaurant - nice bar, large menu with lots of options and good cheesecake.<br><br>My experience has been that the cheesecake here is good for dessert.  Fresh, well made, lots of options and flavors, etc....<br><br>Bar is good too with good beer and drink options (Fat Tire on tap is always a plus).<br><br>Overall design of the restaurant is pleasant, albeit a bit loud due to very high ceilings.<br><br>I just always find the menu, which is very large and varied in options and cuisine types, to be very middle of the road for the actual food.  Maybe because this restaurant tries to offer something for everybody - in my opinon, it results in lighty seasoned food (in large portions, in my opinion, that is not objectionable to anyone but just not that interesting.<br><br>I did want to really like this restaurant (not typically a huge chain fan, but really like The District and all it offers), but based on my few visits here, I would have a drink or dessert here, but find the main meal options lacking.
Good, solid tasty food, well prepared in sizable amounts for reasonable prices. Waiters were friendly. Bartender poured big glasses of wine. Always a good option at home or travelling.
Food is excellent. Service. Bar. One of my favorite restaurants. I never had a bad meal. It gets crowded at the dinner hour.
great for a midweek brunch treat. Nice location. did not appreciate that my waitress DID NOT tell me that cranberry is not part of the kids&#39; meals options and costs an extra 3.00 a glass.

I took my mom here for her birthday  because she had never been and she&#39;s a Big Bang fanatic, so she had to go &#34;visit&#34; Penny. When we arrived we only had to wait 10 mins, but once our name was called there was a sea of people that filled the front. So I&#39;m guessing it&#39;s a great idea to call ahead. service was fast. Our server Daniel was very nice and poise, looked like he had been serving for years. We started with a CUP of soup, it looked like a regular soup bowl. By the time out entrees arrived, we could barely eat. good thing, because i was so0o disappointed in how my entree tasted. I order a Smokehouse Burger, and it was so0 dry and bland =[ I figured i was a bit out of it, and my taste buds just weren&#39;t awake after that AMAZING clam chowder, but no. I brought it all home to my Hubby, and he was confused on when he was going to get some flavor. I don&#39;t know if it was an off dish or what, but next time I&#39;m ordering a steak or some pasta, and if they can&#39;t get one of those tasting great, then Cheescake Factory will only be for Soup &amp; Cheescake for this family.
Get yourself a Peach Bellini while waiting for the avacado eggrolls, so good!

The only reason why I put one star is because the cheesecake is phenomenal. Me and my bf dined there one night he got the mac n cheese burger and I got like a western one , our server I think her name was Amanda talk blonde girl , never checked up on us and I watched every one else that was sat after us get there food and we sat for about 2 more hours with no food other parties that were there after us left already , then one guy comes up to us apologizing about the food delay , and that he would take care of it , well then the food came and finally.our server comes back apologizing for it taking forever , well the burgers were gross over Cooked, Mac n cheese was dry with rubbery noodles , we didn&#39;t even finish it , then we get the bill and we got no discount no nothing , they didn&#39;t take care of us at all , we paid the bill and left and will never be dining in there again ever just going in to get  cheesecake to go for now on. The only thing good there is the cheesecake , poor poor poor service

So we were celebrating a late moms day/bday lunch &amp; were a party of 13 &amp; gave our name before the rush came in...we were told it&#39;ll be a few min...that was at 1230p...so people started coming in &amp; they were called left &amp; rt, &amp; so after 25min we asked again how long &amp; they said if u want to seat outside it&#39;ll be faster which was fine by us.  So again more ppl were seated &amp; we were still waiting...so I asked &amp; they said we&#39;re still waiting for tables to open up, which after a few min my DIL went to check outside &amp; saw 3 tables open side by side so she told them why can&#39;t they put them together we&#39;ve been waiting for so long &amp; a few min later they put 2 ppl on 1 of the empty ones &amp; my DIL spoke to the mgr &amp; she said why didn&#39;t they seat us there &amp; the mgr said she was waiting for these other tables to open up cuz she was thinking to sit  us at another spot &amp; didn&#39;t realize she could&#39;ve sat us at theose other tables...so again we waited even longer...yep a few min means an hour &amp; 20 min...ridiculous....as a mgr she needs to organize the reservation desk &amp; get it together...lack of communication...if u can&#39;t handle a large party setup u need to work elsewhere...then to top it off, the waiter forgot to put in the bday person&#39;s order in...unreal...thank god the food was good &amp; we just shared with the bday person cuz everyone had already ate &amp; he didn&#39;t wanna wait for his food...better to eat there for a small group or they&#39;ll tell u a few minutes &amp; just pass u by no stars for me but it won&#39;t let me do it!

I&#39;ve been here 3 times before this last time. On August of 2011 I went to Cheesecake Factory with my family for my mother birthday (10) people. I understand that this place does get busy and there was going to be a wait. So they told us it&#39;ll be a hour wait which we were fine with. An hour past we still waited 2 hours are creeping by so we ask if our table was ready, no not yet. Still waiting and now 5 kids are getting inpatient and crying they are hungry. Now Im getting upset and whats taking so long to get a table. It seem as if they didn&#39;t care I had to ask for a manager to get anything done. The manager did try to make the situation better by comp some food but the damage was done for a 2 hrs and so wait. I with to order a cheesecake for my mother and some man that work there made a comment that I had to pay for that. I just brush it off and reply I know that. I will never return to this or any cheesecake factory. The service was bad and made to feel as dirt.
go for happy hour!  Full size app portions for less than 1/2 off. Assorted cocktails and specific wines also reduced.  Was pleasantly surprised by quality of the food as well.

Went to this place for lunch and what a mistake that was. I ordered the gluten free skinny ceasar salad. I was happy they had an option for me. I received my salad and 3 bites in I found a BUG in my salad. I was shocked and disgusted. The waiter was shocked as well and took my salad. About 5 minutes later the manager came over and gave me a fake smile and apology that was very procedural. She offered me something else but why on earth would I want anything else from this place. I am very limited as to what I eat and this was one of the only options for me. I sure didn&#39;t want another salad with BUGS in it. Yes, I get it- it&#39;s lettuce and bugs like lettuce but they should be washing their lettuce more thoroughly to avoid this disgusting situation. I had to sit the rest of the meal while others in the party ate their meals which were not salad. As a person in customer service, the manager did not go out of her way to rectify the situation. She could have offered a discount on the rest of the bill. She took the salad off the bill but of course she would, I did not eat it and this was their fault. When we left the same manager was standing near the exit and she turned her back when she saw us leaving. Did not say another word to us. This is horrible customer service at it&#39;s finest. I will not ever go back to this place and urge others to be aware of the BUGS in the salad. To all the restaurants out there, when it is your fault someone&#39;s meal goes terribly wrong it is your responsibility to make things right. Had they discounted the rest of the bill or heck even offered to cover the bill themselves maybe I wouldn&#39;t have written this review! Customer Service should be a priority to make the customer&#39;s want to visit again. Cheesecake Factory ruined my day with my family.

We visited Cheesecake factory for take out tonight. Isabel was so kind and accommodating! I had my baby in my arms and she promptly took my order and my food was ready in minutes. She walked around the corner and said, &#34;let me walk you to your car, clearly your hands are full.&#34; It was pouring outside and she went above and beyond to help a mom. I appreciate the over the top customer service and will return. Thank you!
I work.around the corner from here so when I get off every so often I stop by for lunch. I just ate here again yesterday. I love all their food! Make sure to try the mahi mahi! Its the bomb!
My wife and i like this place But the prices is to much for the food we&#39;re paying for. The icetea yummy, service is very good and well trained.

We don&#39;t go here a ton but it is an every other month restaurant for us. Typically I can&#39;t finish my entire meal as the portions are huge and if I want cheesecake then I have to save room. The service is typically adequate to very good, but compared to the Plaza branch I&#39;m used to in KC, MO it is missing a little bit of charm.  A few things I was very happy to see on this trip (October) were firstly a very expansive healthy menu that filled all of mine and my wife&#39;s needs and secondly a new cheesecake that was made to have hints of pumpkin pie. Both were welcome additions and both were full of very tasty bites!!  Things that would make this a more regular trip to me and my wife....more draft beer choices and super cold iced draw glasses, and lastly more intimate seating.

Food has very nice presentation, not just thrown together.  Staff if friendly and thorough, atmosphere makes you feel as though you&#39;re on vacation even if you&#39;re a local.  The Navajo sandwich fry- bread is as close to pow-wow fresh as you can get, and the Mai-tais are super smooth (dangerous!)  Will def come here again.

Stopped in for a quick lunch. Amanda was very personable with our 4 year old. She was busy but stopped by often and we never felt rushed. The food was great and we will be back. I highly recommend this place. ask for amanda
